Follow them on Facebook/Twitter for tea & menu options as well as any specials they have each day.

No Wheelchair Access!

- How is it that they just did a giant renovation, and somehow managed to get by the requirement to install a ramp and wheelchair accessible washrooms?

If you would like to try this coffee house, you'd better not be in a wheelchair.

I went there yesterday afternoon for the first time ever, and I feel like an idiot for not going there everyday since they opened.

Very lovely and cozy atmosphere, great for coffee and chat with friends, and for working or studying.

Their coffee is simply fantastic, the baristas are incredible at what they do. Highly recommended!

As several other reviewers have observed, this place looks very good. One wants to like it. The management, however, is so clueless that I have decided to permanently give it a pass. There are so many really good places in this area where the management knows how to retain good people that one need not spend time in a place where the servers seem to change on a daily basis.

When I buy high-priced coffee, I like to have it in a real mug, not a cardboard cup that I could get at any fast-food joint. When the people here mistakenly put mine in a cardboard cup, I did not ask for a new coffee. Instead, I politely pointed it out in the hopes that they would get it right the next time. In return, I got an argument and nasty looks from the crew at the counter. Also, no matter now many people they have at the counter, they manage to keep even small groups of customers waiting on long lines.

Yesterday was the kicker. I asked for a decaf coffee and told there was no decaf. Even your average diner will usually ask a customer if he or she wants to wait while they brew up a pot of decaf. And this is a fancy café? I then asked if they had decaf espresso and was told that this too was all out. The person telling me this clearly had no idea of her surroundings and thought she was working in some civil service office: nope, we ain't got it, too bad!

With so many good options down the block, this place should stop relying on their decor.

I visited Roast for the first time on a Tuesday evening. It wasn't crazy busy, but still busier than I expected for a weekday. I can understand how it must get packed at certain times. It's a very comfortable and inviting space in a beautiful historic building. I had actually thought they served only coffee, but there's quite a selection of various drinks and teas, and a variety of food. The staff were pretty friendly and there's lots of seating. I definitely plan on returning to try some of their other drinks.

This is a diamond in the rough!  While the area of town felt a little sketchy, you walk through the doors of Roast and it's like entering another world.

The smell of coffee was marvelously inviting and the decor made me want to spend the day there.

Their creativity with drinks is exceptional... the new seasonal drink is the "Cinnamon Bun Latte" and is exquisite.

If the location was a little bit easier to access, I could see making this a regular hangout.

Transcend, Credo, and other such cafes are obsessive about their coffee. Roast is practical about it, but not as practical as Tim Horton's for example. Roast serves coffee from the artisan Verve Coffee Roasters. I don't know much about them, but the coffee is surprisingly non-bitter and smooth. You pay for the quality: $5 for a large latte. But included with that is the environment.

Like the Mercer Tavern next door Roast takes advantage of the old warehouse in which it is housed. It's spacious, trendy, and comfortable; an atmosphere well worth a $5 latte.

Roast also has some prepackaged quality food, I think from various downtown restaurants. The salads are small, but not too expensive. You can pay extra for your choice off protein (small containers of various meats or tofu). My friend seems to enjoy the baked goods.

I prefer Transcend coffee and philosophy. But I come back here as often as I do for the non-pretentious atmosphere. Oh, and they start serving wine at 2pm.

Admittedly as I am not much of a coffee connoisseur, I judge a cafe based on how it makes me feel when I step inside. When I pay $5 for a fancy coffee, I want to feel like I'm indulging in some sort of fantasy world outside of my day-to-day reality.

And the combination of tasty drinks such as the maple bacon latte (well, it's essentially a latte with whipped cream and a piece of candied bacon on top) and urban warehouse decor takes me to a trendier, more urban place than Edmonton.

I like how they're making this an all day establishment and look forward to checking out their wine list.

We spent 26 hours in Edmonton and visited Roast twice.  The first was following supper.  Hubs used to live in Edmonton and knows the city fairly well so after reading some great reviews I knew we needed to seek it out.  As the name implies Roast is both a coffeehouse and wine bar.  They are however separated into two unique spaces.

Immediately we loved the ambiance and decor of the coffeehouse.  Spacious & Airy it felt very comfortable.  The staff behind the counter were uber friendly and helpful.  They alone deserve 5 stars each for outstanding customer service.  They were chatty and very accommodating with our kids which also impressed us.

We picked up a few items to try, the cookie topped doughnut, maple bacon cinnamon bun, cookies and a pain au chocolat.  Also indulged in some hot cocoa (kids), a cappuccino for me and hubs tried the salted caramel latte.  Everything was heavenly but the salted caramel latte was the big winner for me and well the maple bacon cinnamon bun for hubs (anything with bacon, right?).  They also had a Bacon Latte on the menu but were out of the candied bacon so we didn't get to try (this time).

The next day we stopped in on our way out of town.  The same friendly peeps were working behind the counter and remembered us.  We picked up some more goodies and coffee (this time I got the salted caramel latte - heaven) and left a very satisfied family indeed.

Roast  we'll be coming back soon for the bacon latte :)

Pretty awesome little coffee shop in the building i used to play paintball in!

The last time I was in that room I had a gun in my hand and was part of the "Law & Order" paintball team. This time it was I meet a guy about a video

Americano with cream was served in a massive mug and was to my liking

I've only just begun to visit local coffee and Roast will be a food audition to my list if I can only figure out how to swing free parking. I want to try the salted latte's

The Mercer Warehouse downtown and I have had a love affair that has been going on for years.  From the art installments, to the Halloween Parties and Ghost Tours to the building being empty for years.  When I was at the City Market downtown one weekend, I saw that they were restoring the building and it looked like maybe some new tenants.  I hoped that they were businesses and that they were not turning it into condos.

My prayers were answered and Roast Coffeehouse and Mercer Tavern were soon to be opened.

You would think that with my food obsession I would be one of the first people in on opening day...  Due to the busy summer I did not get to visit Roast until almost the end of August.  I had saw a tweet about a Maple Bacon Latte and knew I would have to drop in to see what they were all about.

The Bacon-Maple Latte is a maple flavoured latte. It is garnished with whipped cream and then a couple of pieces of caramelized Bacon.

The Bacon is fantastic! Crispy and gooey at the same time - it stuck to my teeth. Bacon lovers would love this taste experience.

If you want the latte to have any Bacon flavour in it you need to dunk one of your pieces of Bacon into the latte and let it float - that is, if you can resist eating it!

The Baristas at Roast took a while to get the latte out but it looked like they were having problems with one of the spouts on the espresso machine pulling shots. It was worth the wait - the shots were perfect.

The atmosphere and decor in Roast make for a very comfortable experience. The hardwood floors and open beamed ceiling are the originals from the warehouse. It has a rustic feel while the fireplaces give the atmosphere warmth and the stainless steel bar type chairs give it a touch of modern class. There are overstuffed leather chairs by the fireplaces so there are "homey" feels to certain areas as well. Sure to please many different types of customer.

If you like to avoid the hustle and bustle that the "Green Giant" offers - then you should give Roast a try. I can see myself curling up in front of a fireplace with a good book and a great cup of coffee for an hour or two.

Kudos Roast!

I'm on the fence about my feelings towards Roast Coffeehouse. While it does have many appealing qualities, there are certainly some things that are lacking. 

The Good:
The space is lovely. It has great ambience and is roomy and stylish with plenty of comfortable seating. It's always cozy and warm, unlike many other cafes. There are nice little touches around, such as a self-serve dispenser with lemon water. This place doubles as a wine bar in the evenings and there's a  decent selection of wine and beer. The baked goods are also quite good. 

The Bad:
The service here is hit or miss. On some days, I have been greeted by a friendly face and on other days, I have had to deal with an unhelpful and lackadaisical hipster, whose description of the maple bacon latte was simply that it is "sweet". 

While they do have a small food menu, I have not had the chance to try anything as the one time I wanted to order something, I was informed that they were sold out of everything. This was at 4.p.m., which is the advertised time that they start serving food. 

The coffee here is ok. While they do have a selection of interesting and creative drinks (Maple Bacon latte, salted caramel latte etc.), the actual quality and taste of the espresso is on par with, or marginally above,  most chain coffee shops. For the prices listed, you would expect better quality. This is not to say that the drinks are bad -- only that they could, and should, be better. 


I will continue going to Roast, mainly for the ambience. While it does have some flaws, it is, overall, a nice spot.

I'm not a coffee coneiseuer to say the least, so I can't rate the finer points of the coffee - but what I will say is that the decor and ambiance of this little spot is fantastic. Other than music that is a little too loud for that atmosphere it was really nice.

As for the coffee - I thought that was really good too.

Roast is a fantastic alternative to the chain coffee shops that dominate the downtown core. I went just after the coffeehouse had opened, so their espresso bar had yet to open, (it is functional now,) so I treated myself to one of the many fresh smoothie options on the menu. And how fresh! You don't get the feeling that you're drinking some powered icy-milk solution from a chain-shop here -- they use real fruit (albeit possibly canned? It didn't matter to me... it was tasty!)!  The baked goods are just as delicious; on-par for price as Starbucks or Second Cup, but bigger and fresh-tasting. 

Plus, the the location is huge! It looks fantastic, and I hope to have small work meetings here in the future!

I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but this place was pretty nice. I had the Earl Gray Tea Misto and a Cookies and Cream Donut.  Tasty. The décor was warm and trendy. My boyfriend and I both liked the cool water dispenser that had slices of lemon in it. Refreshing.

I had trouble placing the stars on this one because I actually love going to Roast, and enjoy it quite a bit. It is beautiful, tastes great, and is welcoming. BUT and this is a very big BUT for me. I understand that this business is new, and it's busy so I have given it some grace in that regard towards the issues I have concerns with but after happening to me on 7 different visits now I have to say I'm fairly dissapointed. 

Whomever is in charge of doing orders for Roast really needs to figure out how to order in abundance or order more than they normally do or whatever it may be. I have gone there on 7 different occasions to order different drinks each time and I am always told "sorry we're out of this, or we're out of that" Thus forcing me to order a drink I could get anywhere and was really less than thrilled about trying. Especially when it's a feature drink that you read on their FB page and decide yum! I'm going to go try it out and both times you visit during that special they are out of it. I once tried to get their Powered Chai literally 4 days in a row and they were out the entire time. Which was fine because I understood that they were new and the order had to come in and they gave me the option of trying their tea based chai. The time after that it was Pumpkin, the time after that it was the Apple Juice (out of Apple Juice?) 

I do love the atmosphere which is what keeps me going, and the drinks taste just fine, the desserts are delicious, and the service has been great, but the order issue is a serious bummer and definitely has me wanting to take the trip downtown for coffee meetings with clients less and less. 

Has the potential to be awesome though if they could get that glitch cleared up :)

So Roast has become my new, kind of semi-ish regular coffee spot because it's so close to Grant MacEwan. I know I'm a student, and I should be saving my money to pay off my loans, but caffeine is a necessity and sometimes the line at Tim Horton's on campus is so long that I decide to walk the two blocks down to Roast. And why not? It's so pretty inside, and the atmosphere is nice - not too casual and not too upscale to the point of being stuffy. The coffee is good. My favorite drink so far is probably the pumpkin latte, but I also enjoyed the maple bacon latte. Yes bacon and coffee together is a good thing. The food is pretty good too. They have a Thai sandwich from MRKT which was good, although I found their chocolate pastry a little dry. Prices are your typical nice coffee shop price - equal to being at a chain like Starbuck's - except Roast is a better coffeeshop.  Wifi is free and works well, except in the outdoor seating where I had a hard time picking up a signal. The staff are friendly too, and happy to make recommendations. It's a wine bar as well which I would love to check out one day - although during my breaks on school days I'll probably stick to caffeine.
Love the atmosphere. Coffee is pretty good. High prices, but I pay for the experience.

After hearing a steady stream of constant raves about Roast, I went out of my way to get there this afternoon. I can say with certainty that I love the atmosphere. The lighting is perfect, the place is huge, and there is a lot of seating - and of many different kinds, from tables and chairs, to comfy chairs, to sofas. I spent some time walking around and saw a good selection of loose coffee and tea for sale, pastries in the display case, and the wine and food list, which was not huge but decent. As for me, I took advantage of a free coffee offer this week and tried a medium roast. It was good, but did not knock my socks off. Still, just the fact this is an independent, local, non-chain place with a great vibe is enough to keep me coming back to try an espresso drink.
Great bar Happy Hour 4-7 every day. Wine & Drafts $3, $5 pizza, $4.50 apps. To-go Dinners and lunches are very reasonable and fast. Staff are as friendly as it gets.

Went here for the first time a few days ago and had lunch. Although it is a chain restaurant, I really liked it. The decor was nice and provided sort of a classy atmosphere. It was not very busy so we were seated quickly but the hostess was not the greatest, basically just handing us some menus and walking away. No explanation of the menu or any specials or anything. Thankfully, our server was very nice and walked us through the menu since we had never been there. While there were a lot of options on the menu for lunch, the prices seemed to be what I would pay for dinner. It didn't seem like much of a lunch special to me. We got our drinks fast and some hot, fresh out of the oven bread that was so yummy, we quickly devoured the whole loaf. My husband got the create your own pasta with the garlic cream sauce with pene, shrimp, and mushrooms. We both agreed that the sauce was a bit of a let down. It was not very creamy or garlicy. Next time he's going to go with the alfredo. I had the meatball sliders with garlic Parmesan fries. The sliders were fantastic. The meatballs were so good, I could have been happy with just a plate of those, but putting them on the buttered buns made them even better, The order comes with three, which was the perfect amount, but the glutton in me wanted more. The fries were ok. They were very thin cut, but could have used a lot more garlic, they were pretty much just regular fries with a bit of cheese on top. Overall, I enjoyed the meal and we plan to go back to try some dinner items and maybe dessert.

I recently dined there for a birthday gathering. The restaurant was mostly vacant and our 20 person party was placed in the back. We were assigned 1 waiter who worked his hardest to serve a party so large; however, drinks were late and not refilled, silverware was dirty with old food from previous customers (in multiple sets), and food came out late. I have worked customer service and usually ignore the small mistakes. We are all human. However, our waiter should not have been alone in serving a party so large. 

Moreover, a glass shard damaged my pants and scratched me from sitting on my chair. The manager on duty gave me a bandaid and contact information to relay my experience. I feel like I needed to explain my experience and my disappointment of the way the situation was handled to the point of not returning. We paid for our meal in full and left with a bloody rip in my pants.

Please, this place makes a semi-new menu and raised their prices. The food is very mediocre. i just started cooking and i make a couple pasta dishes which include spaghetti and lemon chicken piccatta.  As a beginner in cooking I can judge this place's food is horrible. A day after the food looked like it had been out for weeks. Good food can last for a day or two.When i went in there to eat the hostess was nice. first, we ordered a glass a wine. he poured the wine, missed the glass and some spilled on the table and he just ignored it. hello. idiot. waitressing 101. go back. well needless to say. not worth your money at all. ive been there during happy hour with girlfriends and its fine. not a 'high end' restaurant by any means even though they try to make it that way.

We came here for a change as we hadn't eaten here in quite  a while. The hostess seated us promptly within moments of our arrival. Next, came Joe our server who took excellent care of our needs. 

We started with Calamari as an appetizer which was excellent. My wife had the blu salad which she said was great. I had the Capris salad which was excellent. Next my wife ordered the mix grill which was way to spiceynfor her as they used way too many  red peppers. 

I ordered the steak med rare and it was cook perfectly, but was way tuff and had no flavor. If it wasn't for Joe's service I would have given 2 stars
Management is not professional and does not honor reservations. Quite an attitude. I do not recommend this place.

We stopped in for lunch- as my husband was having a recollection of a great chicken and pasta meal he had a year or so ago- I looked over the menu and ordered a Bibb and blue salad, crispy artichoke appetizer and pomodoro soup. He had chicken Marsala. Our server was Denise. It was early, 1140 or so- not busy or rushed to say in the least. Our order was brought to us in a timely manner, my husband enjoyed the mushrooms in the entree, the chicken was cold around the edges and a bit chewy. I had a salad with greens that were not as fresh as I like, the dressing was flavorless and the artichokes were definitely  NOT crispy- but tasted ok. My husband had to ask for Parmesan and cracked pepper, also the soup was forgotten and cold when served. I can't understand some of the reviews with 4 stars- as this meal was not terrible, but freshness and adequate temperature were seriously lacking. Our bright spot was the male who was attentive, smiled and had a great attitude overall. Our waitress needed a little help in the customer service area. I would say that this meal was not a terrible experience, but I gave it two stars for a really good reason. Maybe next time.

Well it's good thing for this place that it's Christmas and every place is busy lunch was lack luster salad not dressed croutons stale wait staff slow asked for stuff like balsamic vinaigrette none came never came back to ask how
Everything was I asked for chicken on my pasta no chicken told him forget it since I was so starved my fault skipped breakfast won't come back unless it's a family thing and I don't get a say I don't like to give bad reviews I know that waiting tables is hard I have done it but this lunch sucked it wasn't busy enough to justify crap service

I very much enjoyed my first visit to Romano's Macaroni Grill in July of 2011, shortly after my husband and I moved to Reno, Nevada, from the Midwest, after hearing positive reviews form family and friends.  I vividly remember our first visit:  My husband ordered the Mama's Trio, I ordered Create your Own Pasta.   We were both pleasantly surprised; our meals were fantastic.  So fantastic, in fact, that we went back again the following week.  And then a few weeks later I invited my in-laws to join me for their first visit, to celebrate my birthday.  They left very very impressed.  Food and service were both excellent.  The lasagna left a memorable mark on me.  I raved to others that Macaroni Grill has the best lasagna I have ever tasted.

My husband and I continued to frequent the Reno Macaroni Grill.  We became fans on Facebook of the company and enjoy the updates.  We purchased several boxes of the Macaroni Grill lasagna at our local grocery store and frozen entrees to enjoy at home.  We have asked for and have received gift cards for birthdays and holidays from family because of our interest in the restaurant.

Food was fair. Every one at work likes to come here so I go along. Service was just fair. The wait staff only checked on us when it was check time. Aka tip time. Needed extra napkins water to go boxes. Oh well. Food took a long time. I think next time I'll eat a sandwich in the office

There is a weird smell when you walk in the door... Not sure what it resembles. The bread was gross, and the food not much better. I should have expected as much because it's macaroni grill, but still. This is the top choice first date restaurant of frat boys trying to be fancy. Meh, at least it's edible.
If you like SALT, eat here. I should have refused the buffalo chicken dish, but didn't.. Thought I would just give it a THUMBS DOWN on Yelp.  WAY TOO MUCH SALT!!

We ate here for Mother's Day and couldn't be more disappointed.  We waited 20 minutes for our glass of wine and another 45 minutes for our food to arrive.  I ordered the chicken Marsala.  My mushrooms and roasted garlic were burnt.  The waiter brought food for 2 of us and said the rest was on the way.  My daughter in law never received her food.  She had to take it to go at the end of our meal.  The manager apologized and they paid for her meal and gave us a 25% off your next order.  It's unlikely that we will ever return to use that coupon. I used to love eating here.  I don't know what happened but it continues to go downhill.   On the plus side, our waiter was very nice.

Delicious. Servers are always amazing. Food is always amazing- I love the Eggplant Parmesan and the Penne Rustica.  Create your own pastas are always delicious too.  Love the music they play and the singer for birthdays.

We ate here a few weeks ago and enjoyed the food.  So we decided to go back and have a nice dinner.  The place was crowded and we had to wait 30 minutes for a table.  Once seated our server took our order which was a main entrée and a side salad.  In about 5 to 10 minutes we received our salads.  Everything was going just fine; we finished our salads and were enjoying the bread and wine.  

After some time we realized we had drank two glasses of wine and finished the bread, but had not received our entrée.  Our waiter never came by to check on us or explain why it was taking so long to get our entrée.  So we asked the manager if she could check our order.  Come to find out the waiter never placed our order! 

We sat there for an hour eating salad, bread and wine and our order was never entered.  We were giving the place the benefit of the doubt that they were busy and had gotten backed-up in the kitchen. We even over heard the table next to us ask our same waiter why it was taking so long to get their order.  We just did not realize how much time had passed until we ran out of conversation.  Wow!  The level of incompetence at this place is extraordinary. 

The manager was very apologetic.  She was embarrassed at the level of service we received and made no excuses.  She of course comp our meal and offered to expedite the order so we could eat.  However, there is no excuse for this type of mistake.  Hiring staff that are incompetence is unacceptable.   Unfortunately, we will not be supporting a business that can't hire a professional waitstaff.
Food showed up cold, salmon was raw inside, plastic in the dessert, fatty lamb chops and some sort of stringy thing at the bottom of my wine glass!! The service was great though.

Brought the family here a few nights ago for dinner. After being seated, we sat for about 15 min without even being asked if we would like a glass of water.  So we grabbed our stuff and headed out the door. We will stick to the Olive Garden in the future.

Troy and his staff always make it a really good time at the Macaroni Grill I've been here several times for birthdays and special events they've always taken care of us.
Fantastic food fantastic people.
Never had a bad time here.

First off if there was a lesser rating I could give it I would. Never in my whole entire life have I ever been to a place that handled a situation so horribly. So a group of us went in for Valentine's Day, we had a reservation for 8 and were sat by 845, no big deal we were just a bit cranky and hungry. The host was very nice and was trying her best. 
 We finally get sat and get drinks ordered and Our appetizers. It's going well, our server was nice and we were happy. Now this is where it goes down hill. Our appetizers come out about 5-10 mins apart. We brushed it off. A party that got sat after us were now getting their entrees? We start getting irritable at this time we've been in the restaurant for 2 hours. We finally start getting out entrees. 5 people are missing theirs. Sever comes over tells our friend their out of what she wanted. Would've been nice to know before everyone stared receiving their food. But she got to pick whatever she wanted for free, not bad. Everyone is now done with their meals and My friend beside me never got her food. By this time the restaurant is basically empty. The manager comes over and just goes " what did you have" my friend told her then she just walked away. No apology. Nothing. Her food finally comes out and she asks our sever why was she just now receiving her food? He replies with "oh you know the kitchen gets slammed, things happen" our jaws nearly hit the floor. Granted they comped her meal. But everything was poorly executed and the manager never stopped by to apologize, our server never apologized. 
  I guessed they assumed that they were gonna go down in flames cause they thought passing out a $5 off coupon for next time would do anything. Safe to say we spent 3 hours in a restaurant for a lousy experience. The food was decent but not worth it. Like the saying goes " you can fix lousy food with great service but you can't fix lousy service with great food" and we don't ever, ever plan on coming back here. I get that it was Valentine's Day and it was busy, completely understood but it's the mangers job to smooth over the situation. Comping the food is great but that doesn't fix anything. Get it together macaroni grill.

I tried the tasting menu.  The ravioli were good. It came with a Caesar salad, and fettuccine Alfredo. Tha main coarse was chicken Marsala. I didn't much care for the chicken Marsala. Everything else was good. I usually get the spaghetti and meat balls.  Those are great. I think I am going to stick with that next time.

The best part about our experience was walking out the door. It took about 10 minutes before our hostess noticed we hadn't been visited by a server. Once the waiter came the service actually got worse! Gino (run if he's your server!) arrived as though he'd been at the table right after being seated. No apology or promptness to the service thereafter. He then proceeded to spill olive oil all over the table, sloshed drinks everywhere (of which they were out of Coke), and bring out bread within a whopping 20 minute time period. Everyone around us had been served by the time our drink order was taken. The only time he offered to refill drinks was after we asked for the bill and a box. His attitude was terrible (we even remained polite throughout the whole ordeal and he continued to be rude and disrespectful, tossing the to-go box on the table and crumbling the bill before briskly walking off with the debit card). We have never experienced such profoundly terrible service. Gino takes the cake on this one and we will never return.

Very disappointed! We were so excited to see a Macaroni grill on our visit this time, we had eaten many times at the macaroni grill in the Bay Area and were never disappointed. This time however we struck out! We ordered the lobster bisque and one of the bowls of soup was served cold while the other hot! The soup was extra salty and did not have even a hint of lobster in it! When this was brought to the notice of the manager she kind of blew it off as oh well yes we keep the soup in the fridge so that it doesn't spoil, also saying she had never had lobster bisque with lobster in it!! Then she reheated the soup in the microwave and returned it Luke warm. The rest of the meal was so so my lobster ravioli was also served partly hot and partly cold like it had just been reheated in the microwave !! Not going back to this location for sure! The servers however were polite and did their jobs well!! I think they need a quality check for sure!

This review is less about the food (which is generally good), and not about the service either (which is usually great). Rather this review is about the somewhat dishonest $7, 7 minutes lunch special.

We were short on time, and on a budget after Christmas shopping. We went into the Macaroni Grill for lunch and were seated as usual. Only to find out we had to get up, walk over to the "Kitchen Counter" to place our order and sit in a different seating area in order to get the $7 lunch special.

An awkward experience to say the least. Probably less likely to return now.

I went with 2 friends for dinner and not impressed. The shrimp in my pasta dish was still frozen and my friends dish came out wrong. We had to wait to remake the dish and then after buying a bottle of wine and dessert the bill was not cheap by no means! Even after talking to the manager they couldn't do anything but half *** say sorry!

MENU: To-go, host gave me a thick paper menu to look at. I was surprised not to see any pizza on the menu. I'm from CA, and the one we have has pizza unless it was a recent thing where they no longer serve pizza. Ordered the chicken marsala (which was yummy) and a new entre cannelloni Bolognese (which I wasn't a big fan of, I thought it would have more meat, but it was basically a cheese and spinach Italian cheesy omelette with some meat sauce spooned on top). Salad to-go was room temperature, lettuce was soft and limp and not fresh and crispy. 

PARKING: outside parking shared with a big outside shopping area across from Petco and a Brewing Co. 

OUTSIDE: location itself is nice in a well developed shopping/restaurant area. Your typical look of a Macaroni Grill. Lots of outside seating on their wrap around patio. Refer to my photos. Nobody was sitting outside though, which was too bad since the weather was nice. I like how to the right of the front door there are nice benches and shade in case you need to wait for a table or for your to-go food. 

INSIDE: like all Macaroni Grills, darker ambiance, but setup and décor was the same. Bar on the left. Hostess counter straight ahead of you. Double door entrance as you come in with a second door to open. 

OVERALL: A-OK. Nice that they have to-go option and curbside to-go option. I was disappointed about the cannelloni, but even more disappointed about the salad. Usually salads are chilled.

I had the worst customer service of my life. The food was good up until the dessert. When I started to eat my sorbet, THERE WAS A SHARD OF PLASTIC ABOUT AN INCH LONG. I told the waiter and when he told his manager about it, she literally ignored it and shooed him away. I am very disappointed in the customer service, seeing as if I was a health inspector, the place would have been shut down immediately. What I experienced could have sent me to the hospital if I had actually swallowed it. I am never ever going back there again, seeing as I want to keep my life.

There are not many chains that deserve any kind of kudos for their food, but this Romano's is about as close as they come. As is my usual chain policy, I only went there because my mother in law was buying:) 
I had the chicken scaloppini and it exceeded my expectations, not that I have high expectations at a Italian chain restaurant. To their credit, the restaurant was clean and well lit, and we had attentive service. However, if I'm craving Italian and I'm footing the bill, La Strada is my first choice.

The food was great and the service though slow was done with finesse.  When we arrived and parked it became apparent there were no handicap ramps for the wheelchair. 2 wonderful gentlemen helped us get up the curb. This was our first visit. No signs indicating handicap parking anywhere.  Inside we were told there was handicap parking on the other side of the building.  If you didn't know there was another side you'd never find it. Please spend a back to indicate handicap parking on other side with an arrow. Basic consideration

Bon Appétit!  Not really, If you go to Macaroni Grill or Olive Garden demanding Authentic Italian food you are too hipster or just a donkey (ahem you know I meant).

I always get great service here, the prices are fair and food is good for a chain restaurant. 

if you use their free appetizer coupon, you can get 2 entrees and an appetizer for less than $20. That's HARD to beat anywhere else. 

is authentic? no, it's Macaroni Grill.
Are you too good for it? No you aren't

Starting off, the ambiance in this place is amazing for a date. I love the fireplace in the middle of the restaurant. The service was good and friendly. The Bread they start you out with is to die for!! I couldn't stop eating the bread! I ordered Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo. It was yummy, but not enough shrimp in the dish.

Our experience started by being sat at a table with a dirty tablecloth. The hostess looked at the olive oil stain and shrugged, sat us anyway. 

The server was friendly but slow. My husband and I both ordered the clam chowder unfortunately our waitress had given us the wrong days soups and there was no clam chowder. My husband changed to the roasted mushroom, which was nothing but mushroom gravy in a bowl with added garlic. I was glad to have cancelled my order! 

My penne rustica must have been sitting under a warmer all day! I are not even 25% of it. My husband had a meatball, sausage and ricotta pasta (I don't remember the name). The positive note was although it all tasted canned and the ricotta far a funny texture it was at least edible. 

$54.00 lesson learned, if you want generic everyday Italian Olive Garden will do.

I really enjoyed the pick 2 mix and match option for lunch. Good selection of tasty options. My favorite was the chicken Caesar calzonetto. It was really very yummy! The seating outside was nice and shaded so a good option for enjoying a meal outside during the summer. To top it all off our waitress was fantastic!

If you absolutely have to go here for their mediocre food and their mediocre service,  BEG the Host/Hostess to seat you as far away from the bathrooms as possible.  They seem to have a problem with the P traps and every time someone went into the bathroom we were engulfed by the smell of sewage.  

My friend said her chicken cannelloni was quite tasty.  I didn't make it past some bread and a few bites of my chicken parmesean before someone went into the bathroom.  The rest of my dinner had to go home with me (then in the trash this morning...)

It still gags me just to think about it!

This had to be the worst Mac Grill experience ever.  The food was about 3 stars, but the service was horrid.  I wont name anyone, but our server did not care about anything.  First off, server seemed annoyed to serve us, had to pull teeth to get balsamic with the bread.  That was after not having any water for 10 or so minutes after being seated.  When the food was brought, server just sat it down and ask anything else.  Well, yes.  Parmesan, red pepper etc would be nice.  Again, server seemed annoyed to have to get these items.  

Then, when we paid the bill, I was not even fished signing and the server came up and tried to grab the unsigned receipt as if he was just trying to get out of there.  Everything about our experience after finally getting water seemed rushed and this place does not seem to have any organization with the service.  There were two servers and about 4 tables at this time, so not sure what the problem was.

The food needed to be salted and it still was very average.

Well we had an interesting dining experience. Our server Choncy was nice. She took our order and got our drinks promptly. We received our salad after about 15 minutes. Then we waited... And waited.. and waited.. an hour goes by we ask what's going on and say we are about to leave. Choncy got the manager, he apologized profusely and said he was getting the order now. He also said the meal was on them which we appreciated. The culinary manager came out and apologized and said he was keeping an eye to get it out to us quickly. The food finally arrives, my mom's pizza is hot my food is luke warm. It tasted ok, definitely not note worthy. 

So I appreciate the measures taken to correct the problem but the food was not really with that wait. The server was nice but she could have been more attentive and aggressive about our food.
Great ambiance, good service and the food is delicious!

I went to macaronis grill today and ordered the pasta Marini  which had mussels in addition to other seafood. My plate came out with the majority of the mussels not opened. Now although I didn't grow up on the coast, my New England born wife has always said that unopened mussels should never be eaten. I returned it and the next plate was ok. But the blackened chicken pamasan that my wife ordered was as tough as shoe leather. Additionally my table was not cleaned well with cheese remnants still in the table and stains on the table cloth. We sat near the fireplace, which was nice, but decided this is our final visit as the quality of their food and ambiance has deteriorated. We've been customers from the time they first opened!! What changed? It stinks from the head is an old polish saying.

Tonight wasn't our first night here, but it was definitely our last.

I really like the lighting in this place, and that's about it.

The service was extremely slow and forgetful, we had about three different people randomly helping us, and still doing poorly. I got the veal, which was terrible. The pasta that came with it was even worse and I literally didn't take more than two bites.
The boyfriend liked his main course but his salad was warm and full of browning lettuce.
We were both seriously disappointed and wished we'd spent our money somewhere else :/

My family was very hungry when we dined here, and Romano's did not disappoint us!

I had the "Chicken Portobello" which was a huge portion that was plated over a very ample bed of "orzo with spinach & vegetables".  The flavors of this dish were quite impressive, not too salty as with most chain restaurants.  Only $13.99.....well worth the price due to the unlimited fresh baked bread that was delivered piping hot to our table.

Daughter had one of those Bowtie pasta dishes with chicken....it looked a lot like the dish she orders at the Cheesecake Factory.  She devoured every drop on the plate.

Wifey ordered the salmon "low calorie" plate, which consisted of baked salmon and fresh vegetables.  She seemed very pleased.

They are offering a special "extra" where you can get your choice of Appetizer and choice of dessert for only $5.99 extra. (a $13.50 value based on the individual prices of the crab-stuffed mushrooms and the smothered chocolate cake, which we all shared).

The total bill, including the tip, was under $55.  We were completely satisfied with both the food quality and service from Tyler, our young waiter.

As chain restaurants go, you could do a LOT worse than Romano's.

Due to the competition with the nearby BUFFETs at the casinos and hotels, THIS PARTICULAR LOCATION must try harder in order to lure the Reno tourists away from the cheap buffet deals that proliferate in Nevada.  

Now, if only the local Romano's in Roseville CA had the same competition.....they would be much better.

We stopped in to the Macaroni Grill for a friends birthday lunch and this is where she wanted to go.  I'm a sucker for ravioli and I had heard they have really good ravioli.  They share a parking lot with Barnes & Noble and Great Basin Brewing so I imagine parking can be an issue during busy times.  They have two dining options - the first is with their traditional menu where you sit and a waiter takes care of you, the second is their express dining.  It's sort of a lunch line where they make the food fresh, but it's a limited menu and they do it for both lunch and dinner.  We went with the traditional dining and were seated promptly.  Our waiter was friendly and he kept the drinks and fresh bread coming.  The bread was delicious, piping hot with rosemary and they have olive oil and balsamic for dipping.  I ordered the Mushroom Ravioli for lunch and it was really good with lots of mushrooms.  However, I think the plate may have been left under the warmer a bit too long.  The plate was scalding hot - no biggie but the parts of ravioli without sauce were very dry and almost crunchy.  That's really the only reason I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 4.  I was really looking forward to that cheat lunch and it just didn't live up to my expectations.

I was surprised to see such low marks on this one... we had a great time! Food was amazing and service was quick/attentive. We sat down after a half-hour wait, and our meals were ready (no joke) in about ten minutes. We ordered appetizers but our main course was so quick, it beat it and the staff threw the appetizer in free. We couldn't be happier and would easily recommend this location for those wanting to get out.

Our fave go to Italian place.  Love the atmosphere, smells wonderful and the food is excellent.  The hot loaf of bread is simply delicious.  The meal cost is good and they often have coupons.  Best all around .

Well they have a new menu since the last time I went. It is much less daunting than the old menu.

The good stuff:
-Nice ambience and lighting. Romantic/chill.
-Some nice new dishes, and a low calorie notifier for the healthier dishes, as the portions here can be quite out of hand.
-Pretty good wine selection. I had a nice syrah from Spain.
-You can still draw on the tables. I don't have kids, but I was bored and drew something anyway. I imagine this allows the parents to go to a decent restaurant with the kids, since they will have something to do.

Cons:
-Service was meh.
-Food came cold and late.
-Vegetables were a bit too marinated in oily stuff. It was a low calorie dish, but apparently few restaurants know how to prepare nice fresh veggies without completely masking the tastes of the vegetables themselves.

Horrible experience!!! We made reservations in advance, and the table still wasn't ready when we arrived (we were a party of eight). The manager was rude to the first two of our party that arrived and brushed them off when asked about our table. 

The drink order got mixed up and it took over 20 minutes to get a draft beer (the place was not that busy). We ordered two appetizers and all our entrees, and when the appetizers came it was only one. Later the waitress came back and said they were out of the second appetizer. After about thirty minutes half of the dinner orders came out, and then the waitress told us they were out of one of the dinners we'd ordered. Another fifteen minutes later and still half of our party were missing their food, the waitress came back and told us they were out of yet another one of the entrees we ordered. 

The waitress said the manager was going to come and talk to us, but she never did and in fact, it looked like she was avoiding us. Finally, I got up and found the manager, told her about everything that had gone wrong and told her we were leaving. As we were putting on our jackets the manager finally came by and hastily apologized and said she'd checked with her "sub-manager" and they were comping the partial meal we'd gotten, which is hilarious because there's no way I was letting any us pay after all the screw ups on their end. 

Oh, and did I mention that the couple at the table next to our group seemed to be having the same kind of problems, but the manager managed to go over there and apologize and even sit with them for a bit. This is probably the last time we ever try to go here for a group outing (or even as a couple).

Arrived for lunch at 12:40. David immediately came up to us and led us to a nice booth towards the back. He wrote his name with (1 of the 3 available crayons) upside down & backwards towards him on the paper covering the table cloth, but easily readable for us. He introduced himself as he wrote it and asked what he could get us to drink. He quickly brought a warm loaf of fresh bread for us to tear apart and dredge in their delicious garlic and olive oil. 

We ordered Mozzarella caprese, warm spinach salad, and capellini pomodoro to split between the two of us. David brought out mozzarella frittas by mistake, but when we told him that wasn't what we ordered, he quickly apologized and offered to replace it with the mozzarella caprese. The frittas looked so good, we decided to keep them. They were delicious, lightly breaded with a tasty arrabbiata sauce. When the frittas were gone, I dipped the remainder of the bread in the extra sauce. 

The spinach salad was topped with creamy, toasted goat cheese that really added to the flavor of the spinach. Try to get a small bit of cheese in every bite. Supposed to have prosciutto, but there wasn't any? We don't care to eat the garlic slices, so picked them out, but loved the flavor they left behind, which blended perfectly with the lemon juice. The pomodoro provided a generous helping of tender capellini pasta covered with juicy, ripe grape tomatoes. 

This was our first time to ever go to a Romano's Macaroni Grill, but thanks to the excellent service provided by David, the delicious food, and reasonable prices, we can't wait to return.

Great bar Happy Hour 4-7 every day. Wine & Drafts $3, $5 pizza, $4.50 apps. To-go Dinners and lunches are very reasonable and fast. Staff are as friendly as it gets.

Love the HH Pizzas. A flatbread style thin crust pepperoni and only  $5.  Peroni, Sam Adams Seasonal, Icky and BudLite on tap.

Refer to the Check-in description. 
Again the staff were great and food was at the high standards of Macaroni grill. 
The house wine (Rossi) was a good choice with the meal.

I used to eat here weekly, but have been consistently disappointed for the past few years. The food is bad and you have to wait forever to get it. I don't know how they're staying in business. After the last visit I will never be back. Seriously, it's garbage, and I leave angry every time. Go anywhere else.

My family and I are not high maintenance customers in any way. When we arived were seating by a very nice host. As we sat down out waitress served the family next to us and promptly walked past us. No eye contact, no hello, no "I will be right with you". We waiting 23 minutes to be exact, as she walked passed us 4 other times, not saying one word or attempting to make eye contact. Never have I been stood up by a waitress.

We've been coming to this restaurant for years, and yesterday's visit was different than any before. 

1) New lunch menu that tells you how many calories are in their dishes. 

2) New olive appetizer that was very good. 

3) New dessert menu that features smaller, and less caloric, choices. My wife and I shared the vanilla gelato with strawberries. It was served with fresh mint, and it was tasty. 

4) Some things didn't change: bread and olive oil, efficient service, and the manager checked in to make sure that all was well with us. We shared the scallop and spinach salad, and this was also very good. 

5) We arrived after the main lunch hour and we were able to be seated, eat, and exit within 45 minutes. Very tasty and very efficient without feeling rushed. 

So, it was a new experience for many of the food choices, as we were provided a chance to consider our health as we ordered, and there were some consistent old favorites for our enjoyment.

I'm still hunting for a decent Italian restaurant in Reno.  This isn't it.  The food had too much cheese and my daughter's meal barely had any meat on it at all.  Neither one of us ate very much of our meal.

   On the plus side the service was great and the manager comped my daughter's meal since she didn't eat it but I definitely won't be returning here.

Normally a great place to eat and great customer service. The last time we were here was horrible. Took 10 minutes for someone to take our drink order. Ordered bread when it came out it was super hard and cold in the center. Waitress came back over and told us the bread could have been frozen and that she would have them put more in the oven. 

Finally got our food and we needed to go boxes. We had to ask another waiter for the boxes. Our waitress came over and asked if we needed to go boxes when we had already received them from the other waiter. Asked for a bag three times. When the waitress brought us our check she asked how old our baby was and completely ignored me and was staring at my husband for an answer. He told her that I was speaking to her and she had the nerve to ask me if I still love my baby. And then said just kidding and walked away. 

We paid and the waiter that was being trained by the waitress brought our receipts and card back to us and stood there at the table waiting for us to sign the receipt. 

We spoke with the general manager as we were leaving and he stated that this was not an off day and people have been acting the same today as they have been for months. Didn't seem to really care that his employees are very rude to his customers and we will probably not go back because of this experience.

I enjoy coming here with my hubby for grown- up meals and drinks. We allways have a good time with the wait staff, whom are knowlageable and friendly. Lunch  today was no exception, we had a supper yummy peach Belini frozen drink WOW! New Summer fav!

This was one of the grosses dining experiences ever.  I came here while visiting a friend against my better judgment.  It was a fancier olive garden to say the least.  The prices were ridiculous for the quality of food.  I had a vegetarian pasta dish.  While eating it, I bit down on something that made a big crunch sound that kind of hurt my jaw.  I spit it out and it looked like bone.  I asked for a manager to come over and she said it was probably chicken bone.  I'm not a vegetarian but when you aren't expecting any meat in your meal and you get a random piece of chicken bone it's pretty disgusting.  I was not happy and nothing was done to make me feel better about this.  I will never ever go back to a macaroni grill ever again.

Italian food consistent and always tastes good when we go. Portions are good for splitting
it was the great service i appreciate. Our server  Amanda was kind enough to run the items my son left behind out to the parking lot.  Never had bad service or food!! Luv this place

We were excited to get to Reno to eat at Macaroni Grill. I am disappointed to say it was Horrible!! I ordered dpi i h and artichoke dip. It can as we were finishing our meal. It was ice cold inside, the bread was gross and microwaved texture. The Bibb and Blue salad was tiny and had an overwhelming flavor of the pickle juice from the pickled onions. The service was terrible. We waited for about 5 minutes for silverware AFTER getting our food. I have to say the five of us all had a horrible meal. We will not be going back. Awful food and mediocre service at best.  Steer clear!

We ate here once, I love macaroni grill for their fresh pasta, I was disappointed going, which was right around prom or homecoming so there was a ton of young kids there. The dinner was decent, nothing to write home about, and I ordered a house table red wine. The kid waiting our table was flustered which was understandable given that they were busy and we just so happen to decide to go on that one night. Oops, who knew? 

He brought me my wine in a HOT mug. Who on earth brings ANY wine in a mug, not to mention a Hot mug? Wine is served in a wine glass. Funniest thing about it was he drew on our table noting a wine glass and a tic mark. My boyfriend asked the waiter if he had a glass like he drew, and he obviously got upset and flustered saying they always serve house wine in a mug. 

I understand its traditional to serve it in a glass, in Italy, but if you know anything about wine, red optimal flavors are represented in 60-65F degrees, white a bit colder 50-55F degrees. If in the least they should give the option to customers of traditional customs or in a stem glass which they have, instead of serving in a hot glass ruining the flavor and raising the temperature to 80+F degrees.  

Hard for us to want to come back here unless it's 1/2 off.
Food tastes great and is as expected.  Saul and Oby are wonderful servers and beyond personable!

Seen its name on the back of my gift cards for years finally decided to try one in Reno. Definitely interesting but when it comes down to it not very impressed. We skipped the appetizers since they bring you bread and have a oil on the table. I suggest asking for balsamic since the oil has a strong flavor. We ordered the Butternut asiago pasta, it was not at all what you would expect with a cheese filled pasta and diced chunks of butternut squash's on top sitting in a very salty asiago alfredo sauce. What they advertised as prosciutto tasted more like little strips of thick bacon, which you didn't need because it was already too salty. Our other meal was blackened chicken parmisan which was actually quite delicious and spicy chicken and a buttery garlic pasta with some greens. Overall it wasn't horrible but with prices like those it wouldn't be first on my list for Italian.

I have always loved going to Macroni Grille but this time was really disappointing. They had removed my favorite dish the salad didn't have the great creamy Italian dressing and the bread wasn't warm. The service was so so  I think I will have to find another go to restaurant when I go to Reno.

The food was cold, we waited an hour, and it tasted like the food was out of a can. This is not the Macaroni Grill it was a year ago. I used to love this place but I am not going back any time soon. $20 per person is too much for bad food.

I was so disappointed by this Macaroni Grill! I love the restaurant, but this location in Reno was just so scattered! I don't even know who my server was through the night and when I simply asked for my pizza to be more crispy, the chef came out as if he was at a funeral and just dropped it to our table and gave us a mean look!!! I really wish I could get a refund because the entire experience was not what my other experiances have been in the Macaroni in Los Angeles. I did not enjoy the food or service at this Reno location and most of our food went to waste. Please grant me my refund!!!!!

First off Roman was an amazing server!!!! The bread is to die for and everything was amazing! We made our own pasta and it was fabulous. The tomato basil soup is also so good!!!!! Highly recommend this restaurant

I had a much better time than I expected given the 3 star rating! The food was delicious and in large portions, enough for two meals. The service was amazing, we had a very attentive server who refilled drinks and took away plates before I even realized that i needed a refill.. I recommend this place over Olive Garden and think it deserves more than 3 stars :)

We celebrated my mother's 78th birthday here tonight. Had not been back for at least eight years, although none of us could remember why. The food was amazing! The service was phenomenal! The manager was absolutely delightful and they treated my mother like the queen she is. It will not be eight years before we return again. Will be lucky if any of us can go eight days, it was that good! Thank you for treating our mother like a queen and making her birthday so happy

Cannot say anything about the food itself, just the horrible service. There was no sign in plain sight specifying whether or not to "wait to be seated" or "to sit down yourself". A server looked me in the eye as he walked past us twice and did not acknowledge me or my mother. Another server did the same thing, we walked out. Never coming back again, don't recommend the restaurant, save your time and go somewhere else. Also place wasn't as crowded as Chili's across the street that we ultimately went to after our unpleasant experience here, so no excuse to stop and acknowledge a customer.

My wife, son and I went to this place a while ago and have never been back.  The service was terrible, the menu overpriced, the noise level extra loud, and after waiting for nearly an hour our meals were served to us cold and bland.

Sometimes I'll give one bad experience a pass and try again to verify before forming an opinion. However, when a chain restaurant makes this poor an impression, I only need one visit. There's plenty of good family-owned Italian food in Reno, so 

Thanks, but no thanks.

Went for lunch and I was not impressed with the food or the service. The soup-salad-bread lunch was off the menu and the food we did get tasted like it had been under the heat lamp for hours. The server left the check with out entrees and then didn't return to fill our drinks or check on our food. Terrible.
Food was okay. Had a gift card, so figured we would try it, most likely will not return. Service was NOT good!

We typically go to Macaroni Grill  to celebrate  special occasions, due to my moms terminal illness, we have not had opportunity in over a year to  dine out together but  decided to  go for my daughters 24th birthday -  so on 4-2-12 we  picked Macaroni Grill as it had  always been   good in the past. This turned out to  a huge disappointment on several levels -

We  went for lunch  the restaurant  was  basically  empty at 1:45 when we  arrived - 
the service  was  terrible - 
We were presented with the dinner menu  and when we asked for the lunch menu were told  this was all there was...

Once the  order was placed, the waiter parked himself  by the cooking line  & never came back, so we had to ask the bus boy for the Focaccia bread. The waiter then brought  everything  directly after the bread arrived, therefore we didn't have time to enjoy the bread, which  we  normally  devour as soon as it is put in front of us. Then had  to again wait for someone to come back so we could  ask  for balsamic vinegar to  add to the dipping olive oil.

My mom ordered:
Calamari Fritti crisp-fried, pepperoncini, arrabbiata 10
& house salad

The birthday girl ordered:
Bellini Cipriani - la marca prosecco, white peach purée 7

and we shared

Italian for Two @ $25.00

Tappas - Zucchini Fritti
 
Eggplant Quadratini
roasted eggplant, basil, tomato, ricotta salata, red chile 13.5

Chicken Milanese (add $3.00)
arugula Parmesan salad, roasted potatoes,  lemon butter

ok the -   Bellini  in a  tulip glass - lovely  but  $7.00??
The  Calamari was  a disappointment -  pale & - not  crispy  as  advertised-  the  house salad was  good.
Zucchini Fritti -  my daughter & I  each ordered one,  which for a change  was a mistake because one would have been enough for 3,  it was good but... not as good  as it looked on the menu or  I had hoped -  the " ribbons" were  not  long ribbons  instead they were small  pieces and a little greasy - should have  ordered only one of these and a different 2nd  tappas...
The Chicken Milanese was  pounded so thin  that it was  dried out &  had  no flavor -  the coating  was thicker than the chicken& the sauce  over top was  almost  non existent  - the arugula salad  had  absolutely no  taste what so ever,  the potatoes were plentiful, cooked  correctly &  had   loads of roasted garlic  which I did  love -

The eggplant quadratini was good going down, not so  much  later that evening when my daughter became ill and eventually  threw up after being miserable for several hours ... therefore she never touched the  leftovers...

The  ambiance we had always loved  in the  dining room  was  gone -  the music was no longer classic Italian music, the beautiful white gladiolas  were gone and  the happy birthday song which the waiters sing  in Italian never even happened - 
The hostess never looked up from the stand  to say goodbye -


Total for lunch for 3 guests including tip  almost  $70.00 

I don't think we  will  be using  Macaroni Grill for our special occasions anymore...

This place has gone downhill fast. 

Everytime I visit my grandma, we try to go here, but I think yesterday was our last visit. (The previous time we visited, we walked out because our food took over an hour and my 4 year old was freaking out.)

My grandma had some coupons for their new "$7 meal in 7 minutes or it's free" so we each ordered two lunches at the counter. After about 15 minutes, we are still waiting for our food. All the employees keep looking at us nervously because they know it's been longer than 7 minutes. 

The lady who rang us up briefly says something to the head honcho chef looking man and then brings our food to us. I tell her she knows it's been twice the amount of time promised and that we want our food for free as advertised. Now, if it had only been a few minutes longer, I wouldn't have made a big deal. But it took TWICE as long. She immediately says, "you only get it free if you are dining it. It doesn't count for to go orders." No. I can tell right off the bat that's a load of crap so we ask to speak to the chef boss man. 

Here is a whole new problem. This man walks up to me and my 70 year old grandmother and says, "Hi girls, what's going on?" GIRLS? Really? What a patronizing prick. Don't you dare address my 70 year old grandmother as "girl." UGH. Anyways, he claims that corporate told them it doesn't count on carry out orders. I tell him to show me that on any one of their numerous advertisements. He can't because obviously he's lying. He just doesn't want to get dinged for being so slow. He says, "Alright girls, I'll take care of it for you this time, but those are the rules." Great, take care of it asshole. 

So while we are waiting for a refund, I look up this 7 minute express lunch deal on my phone and find that it is indeed for dine in OR carry out. I show it to him and he is immediately red faced claiming he had no idea. 

To top it all off, the lady who rang us up realizes that one of our sandwiches is wrong because the right one just came out. 20 minutes later.

We first encountered the Mac Grill in Carolwood, Florida. (The one that burned down about 10 years ago.) We really loved the food and could always find something for everyone. The service was good, the food was good and served hot and we could get in and out before the kids got cranky. We were delighted to find there was one in Reno when we moved here and we have probably eaten there more than all other Italian places in Reno combined. Up to our last visit, it was great.

Unfortunately our last trip was something else. As we entered we found a white board with the special of the evening listed. Only to be told they only had one more left. Then we went to the table and got the menus. My wife's favorite, veal Parmesan was no longer on the menu. She had to settle for something else. I ordered spaghetti with meatballs. Next we were informed they had no fresh bread and had to wait until they made some more. Then I was informed they were out of meatballs so I settled for meat sauce. Then the food came and my wife found that her's was not very warm.

There were just too many "ran out of" issues and add that to the menu changes and that was it for us. We shall now be searching for another Italian place.
Food was delicious and place is not crowded at all. Nice experience.

I am not big on going to chain restaurants to begin with, however I received a gift card card and decided to give it another shot this last week. It has been over a year since the last time I went here, and unfortunately nothing has changed. The food is bland and EXTREMELY overly priced. The bar has the cheapest wine you could ask for and they charge crazy prices for a glass. The only positive thing I could say about this place is that the service is friendly. I will not  EVER be going to this place again, despite if I have a gift card or not.

My wife and I went here for our anniversary and were very disappointed.  Although the wait staff was extremely nice and our server Holly was exceptional, they didn't make up for a bad experience.  The food was mediocre and extremely over priced.  We chose a very simple spaghetti dish, no extras, not even salad.  One iced tea and one small glass of an inexpensive wine and our bill was almost $70.  Like I said, the service did not make up for the overpriced and lackluster meal.  Needless to say, we will never go back.

Wonderful service and delicious food. However, really dislike how it is per management to drop the check off during lunch time when you receive your meal. Even though the server told us, "No rush, we are supposed to leave the check early at lunch time, it's per management. " I still felt really rushed and just really dislike that they do this. Can't customer's just ask for their check if they are in a rush? Anyways, my husband' and my meal was delicious and absolutely exceptional. Definitely recommend.

Nothing special. Received cold/hard bread. The restaurant was nearly empty and my boyfriend and I waited almost an hour for our food. He ordered chicken and they gave him it burnt and wayyyy over cooked. Knowing this, they offered to give him a meal to go with the chicken cooked properly. We took it because we were tired, hungry, and rather annoyed. Why not make it right the first time and bring out the good plate? Won't be returning.

Yes, the hot fresh rosemary bread is DELICIOUS!!!  I had the "Choose Your Own Pasta", you pick all your ingredients, sauce, meat if you want and then they deliver it HOT and YUMMO!!  Tonight there was a bit of a delay due to some kitchen problems, but Management, Teresa, took care of things in a most professional way -- so KUDOS to you Teresa!!!  You did a GREAT JOB... as did our waitress, Amanda.  They all kept cool under the pressure and took care of things!  THANKS EVERYONE!!!  Definitely will be back to try some other dishes -- YUMMO!!!

Eve & Paris

What is the hype all about?  I tried their shrimp portifino.  It was tasty. But was it worth $13.99?  No, not really.  It was a small portion loaded with pasta with few shrimps.  

Love their bread!

Parking sucks!

Service was okay. Friendly servers but not too attentive.  I always have to call my server to get refills.

At this point, three stars for mediocre experience.
Just got done eating here, really disappointed at the quality of the food. Kind of a bummer since we don't get to go out to dinner much.

If there was an option for no stars, this restaurant would receive a zero rating. I'm not surprised though, the last time we were here, the food was bad then too. I must say that over the many years dining at this particular restaurant, the food has gone downhill. I ordered mamas trio and the food came out cold! Not just sitting in the window warmed ready to be taken the table, but cold out of the frig. I had our server touch the fettuccini with his finger to verify and he concurred that the noodles were refrigerator cold. He then took my plate and must have placed it in he oven and yes it came back hot, but the bottom of the lasagne was burnt and stuck to the plate, I couldn't scrape it off to eat it. Not to mention that he price of $19 was way too much for the small portions without a salad. We were one of only four tables in the restaurant and not once did my tea get refilled. My husbands tea sat empty at the edge of the table for quite some time and was refilled as we were paying our bill. My husband had the chicken scallopini--the exact same item he has had for years and obviously the recipe has changed...for the worse. There was no sear in the chicken, it tasted boiled. The cheeses for the first time tasted like velveeta, not the original butter and cream recipe.  The kids each had spaghetti and meatballs and no thank you, we don't want to mix those leftovers to take home. And just like last time, the bread was dry and tasted like it was old, not fresh out of the oven like we used to get.  Not once did our server come back and ask us how we were doing or if we needed anything. Sad to say, but you lost our business.

Reno, NV

A little slow being seated.  Friendly people, nice and ambient place to be. Good house Red wine if you want my recommendation.

Don't waste your time!! We used to love going to this restaurant when we lived in Cali so we thought we would give it a try.  That will be our last one. The oil on the table to use for dipping your bread was sour and spoiled.  The entrees are overpriced and the quality was sub par. I believe they are using frozen ingredients.  Won't be back, ever.

I'm very sad to give a poor review, as Macaroni Grill has long been one of my very favorite places to eat.  

Sadly, though, after years of being a loyal customer I don't think I'll ever go back.  

I'm not sure if they changed from wonderful, amazing, delightful, delicious rosemary bread to dry, white, hamburger buns permanently, but the last time I was there that's what we were served.  Very dry, white bread buns that were barely edible.  I'm a bread person.  I'll choose a restaurant just for the bread.  Gah!  I'm so sad.

The server on our visit was barely available to us, took FOREVER to provide drink refills, never brought condiments we requested or refills for my two kids and wasn't ever at our table long enough for me to ask her what the deal was with the bread. 

They've also changed my favorite menu item that has been unchanged for many years, so that was just the straw that broke the camel's back.  I will not return.

Very disappointing.  Used to be my favorite.

My family went out for an affordable meal (the $25-for-two deal), but it was hardly a deal given the quality of the food.  The organization of the waitstaff/kitchen was horrid.  To be fair, our server was exceedingly friendly and apologetic (and the wine was free - accidentally or intentionally), but everything came out in the wrong order.  Entree before apps before bread?  Ugh.  I honestly can't remember what I ate, but the entrees were lackluster.  The red sauce-eggplant pasta was exceedingly bland, only somewhat helped by the shave-at-your-table parmesan (a nice touch, for sure).  The apps were tasty but minuscule.  We won't be back.

It's true, we drove 45 minutes from North Lake Tahoe to get to the Macaroni Grill in Reno.  I guess when you have a large group and you're in a relatively rural area...there aren't that many places to go.  

We were a large group (11 people), and they were able to take our reservation relatively late in the day (just a few hours before dinner).  Always so convenient for a large party.  Even though Macaroni Grill is a chain, it's actually relatively nice - the open kitchen and stone decor on the interior make it seem much higher end.  

Unfortunately, the food was definitely below average.  My friend and I ordered the portobello mushroom chicken and the lobster ravioli and split the two dishes; it was probably the worst lobster ravioli I've ever had.  I'm not actually sure there was any lobster in my ravioli.  The portobello mushroom chicken was pretty decent, but the side (spinach orzo) was very blah.  We started the appetizer sampler which really is just a taste of a bunch of different appetizers (calamari, fried mozzarella, bruschetta, etc.).  We also ordered desserts which were huge - I'm not a dessert person, and I didn't even try a bite, but people seemed generally satisfied.

The service was actually great.  The bottle of wine we ordered wasn't available, and they provided a few other options and allowed us to try them.  Also, our server was really attentive and nice.

We partook in the express dinner tonight for the first time. The hostess was nice enough to explain how it worked! It was a great option forbus because the price point was good, and we weren't  wanting to spend a lot of time out at dinner, we were just avoiding cooking at home.  Our server was Aubrie, it was her first time doing the express dining but she was great. Her cheerful  attitude made our experience excellent! I would come back again for the service alone, although the food was also wonderful! If you are coming in and wanted a faster dining experience the express dining is the way to go! The food comes in 9 mins or it's  free (I  timed ours for curiosities sake, and it came in less than 3 mins). Overall a great experience!

I always stop in for the thin crust pizza. Basil, tomatoes, mozzarella spread generously. The Quattro cannoli from the tapas menu is another favorite. Since they redid the menu with the "tapas" dishes, I've enjoyed this place much more than in the past. My girlfriend always likes to build her own pasta dish. I usually prefer the meat based dishes over the pasta based.

Ordering from this place is a nightmare. I work for ubereats and they "missed" my order. I lost 30 min of work time. They look very unorganized and don't seem to have a lot of communication between the chefs and the servers. Also the manager did nothing to help. An employee asked her a question and she responded rudely to her own employee.

Food was OK not very good. Would not go back. Server Jamie was very nice! The bread that they give you to start was overpowering with rosemary and salt. Way too much salt. And the pasta was something that an average Joe person can make at home. Save your money and go to Sardinas or Johnny's for good Italian food.

Half Price Wine... say what?  
Are you kidding me, $2.75 for a glass of their house wine?  #SOLD

Keeping in mind that I had never dined at a Macaroni Grill before..
I ate at this Macaroni Grill last week and sat at the bar.  The service was stellar, met two nice employees and enjoyed my Chicken Parmesan.  The food came out  quick, was a big portion and had a nice atmosphere.

I enjoyed it - and am taking my staff here next Friday for our holiday dinner.

Give them a shot - a nice in-between considering Olive Garden or Carraba's.

I went to Macaroni Grill because I was craving this specific pasta dish I always get in Cali ... so we go there... it took FOREVER for our waiter to come to greet us.  Then we finally got our food and it was cold and tasted dirty.   We told the manager, he quickly got us another dish.  Still did not taste great.  Overall the management staff was great, took care of us but the food was not.  But I will give a lot of credit to the management because even though I won't go back because of the food the management made a bad experience tolerable.

We don't dine here often because we live in out of town, but each time we've been the service is friendly, helpful and timely. The food is consistent in quality, love the paper table cloths and I really like the atmosphere.

We have eaten at here on many of occasions although it has been a while since we have been in to the restaurant. Our server Jayme was fabulous. Nice smile and service throughout our visit. 

The food is why only the 2 stars. I ordered  rustica and my husband ordered fettucine alfredo with shrimp. I have ordered the rustica on several of our visits it is one of my favorite dishes. But tonight it was dry and the shrimp were small compared to all the other times I have ordered it. They were dry and tough. Size wise they probably were something you could buy in a 60 count bag. I did ask for extra sauce and Jayme was more than happy to get it for me. However, the sauce had a lot of black pepper in it which made it spicy/hot and not very enjoyable. A few pieces of the chicken were fatty. Just not a pleasant experience.  My husband said his alfredo was bland and needed some help. His shrimp was also the same size that were in my dish  and it didn't have very many in his dish. The bread was awesome. Hot and fresh. 

I probably will go back because this is the first "bad" experience we have had with the food here. I just hope they are not trying to adjust the recipes using less quality products.

My last visit to this establishment was about 8 years ago and the experience was quite good. We had friends visiting us from Tanzania and we decided to treat them to an Italian evening, bad idea choosing Macaroni grill! 
We were seated promptly, our server was very friendly (1  star), bread was served, balsamic vinegars hit the table midway during the meal. The food was really mediocre, my Salmon was dry, the raviolis were ok to say the least, the chicken was also dry. We pretended to enjoy the food as we did not want our friends to notice our discomfort  I bet they were probably doing the same!!  Not spending my money here again.

Normally I like Macaroni Grill, but I don't know what in the hell has been up with them lately. Lack of concern? Lack of giving a crap about their patrons? Who knows. So I went there with my wife this past Monday night and our waitress was definitely not on point. Right out of the gate she asks us about our time constraints, and it was about 5:30 P.M. Now I can understand this logic if it were lunch time or earlier in the day, but that is literally the first time any waiter or waitress has ever asked me this at this time of the day.
