I hardly get asked this to begin with.

Not that it mattered, even if we were on a time constraint, we sure as hell weren't going anywhere fast, because "prompt service" was clearly not in her vocabulary. My wife ordered a glass of Pinot Noir and I got a Soda and Salad to start off with. I get my drink and Salad within 5 minutes... Still no wine for my wife. She's going around attending to some of the other folks, then mentions that "the wine is on the way." It's one glass of wine - what the hell? I didn't ask for a bottle of vintage wine from the Manager's personal stock at his house. 10 minutes later the wine gets there. My wife doesn't want to spoil the mood so I don't say anything, but I'm very visibly irritated and it's obvious at this point.

We had ordered around the time I got my salad, and come to find out now also, what my wife ordered she is just now finding out that they are "out of" for the night. Wonderful. So my food is almost ready at this point and my wife is having to re-order now. No offer to comp, no offer for complimentary dessert, nothing but pure apathy. Some of these waitresses and waiters wonder why people get crappy? Interesting.

We end up getting our food - I got the Chicken Marsala and my wife did a build your own spaghetti. My food went from pretty "meh" to kicking my ass afterward - it wasn't spicy at all yet it felt like fire coming out.

I won't go on and on beyond this because I don't have much else nice to say. I'm very disappointed with Macaroni Grill and their staff. I usually get better than this and they really flopped hard this time. I might give them one more chance... we'll see.

Brought the family here Saturday night for dinner and we were dissapointed.  Three of us ordered Mama's Trio and the food was totally lacking marinara sauce. When we asked for more the server brought us the tiniest cup full.  In addition, the servings of Chicken Parmesan were ridiculously small.  I find it amazing that the server even brought it to us.  It's too bad, but we won't be back.  I can think of better ways to spend +$100 for dinner.

I'm a big fan of Italian food and this place is awesome! Sure sometimes there service can be long, but in the end it's all worth it. The only reason there slow is because they're packed. That must be a very good sign. I've had Carmela's Chicken Rigatoni and it's delectable. I've also had their fish dish. Aka sole. now I'm not a big fan of fish but this dish was very well done, it didn't even taste like fish it was so good. The place is clean and well put together. One time it took a while for my food to get there but the waiter felt so bad that he got me an apron. Kinda weird but helps with cooking food. I love it!!

We came here on a Monday around 5:15 in the evening, and found the place to be very empty, which was a nice change from previous visits.  We were seated right away.  There was something on one of the benches at our booth, so we decided to switch sides.  I then pointed out the puddle of liquid on the floor to the young man that seated me, but he didn't offer to clear the puddles on the floor, he did clean the bench, or move us to another location.  Thankfully the liquid was just far enough out of range to where it wouldn't get on our feet.
We had an offer for a BOGO Pasta Milano dish, and we planned on taking advantage of it.  Our server, Saul?, was very friendly and attentive.  He was sure to bring more bread and water as we needed it and offered fresh crushed black pepper or cheese with each dish that he brought out.  However, he did fail to tell us that we would be charged for ordering soup with our offer, even though we read (we could have misread) that soup and salad was included, but you could upgrade to a better salad for an extra cost.  In any event, the tomato soup was quite good, but the minestrone left something to be desired.  There was plenty of "content" in the soup, but the broth was lacking flavor.
The pasta dish portions were very nice, we both brought home left overs, and it was also very tasty!  If we had one "issue" with it, it was the lack of sauce.

The food was really delicious, and at a decent price. However, I felt kinda ignored by my server. She never brought us bread, and kept forgetting to check on us. It wasn't very busy at all, and we were still forgotten multiple times. 

I had the eggplant parmesan and it was absolutely amazing. My fiance had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and he really enjoyed it. The only complaint we had was the service. And we were really disappointed about the bread.

Amanda was very attentive. Amanda knew her stuff, my boyfriend saw food being delivered and we asked what it was and it was the mama's trio, thumbs up. Service was fast and efficient, everyone helped to serve.
Prosecco la marca: very good. Eggplant parmesan was good, of course I had a to go box. Chocolate cake for dessert, yum!!!

My rating is based upon the fact that it is a chain owned resteraunt. I always get the eggplant parmigiana. It's made with handmade pasta noodles and it's delicious. Everytime I come here it's always good, hot, fresh, and welcoming.

My little thing that annoys me about this place is that they put like 2 cups for every customers plate setting and then on top

You always know what to expect when you go there; a long wait, decent food, and poor service.  

Normally on a Friday or Saturday the wait can be up to 45 minutes...and the food is definitely not worth the wait.  The food is decent; stuff I could cook at home if I felt like cooking.  However, since it is a chain, the food is pretty consistent and bland.  The service pretty much sucks!  Our server spilled two glasses of water over me and two other people in our party.  All we got was a simple, "Oops", not even a "Sorry!"  I will only go there again if I am out of options.

Ate there last night with a group of about 50(with reservations). Room was so crowded servers were unable to get around tables. Everything had to be passed from one end of the table to the other. Entrees were prepared by type. That is all of one item was prepared and then so on. So in our case my wife's entree came out first and mine came out last. We were offered 3 dessert choices. After waiting approx. 45 mins for the chocolate cake they finally brought out the lemon dessert,with no explanation, for those that didn't get their chocolate cake. Finally after the lemon dessert was delivered it was apparent why it took so long, it was still partially frozen! Food was nothing to get excited about and a glass (actually 1/2 glass) was definitely overpriced at $8.50. Won't be in any hurry to go back or make a recommendation that anyone else does either!
My meal was very good. My waitress was excellent. The price was a little higher than other restaurants with a similar dish.

So my boyfriend took me here to eat tonight for our date night. I ordered the Seabass. In my opinion it was lacking some flavor. I liked the orzo spinach side better than I liked the main part of the dish. The server was friendly and our food was brought out promptly. The place was clean and decorated to look semi fancy. For dessert I ordered the vanilla gelato. It was tasty! Overall I enjoyed my experience and I would go back.

Is it possible to give this place a - review?!?!?! Just left the place waiting to get served, literally watched the server help 3 groups that were there after us, drinks and got their orders and all, while my wife and I watch and still they do not acknowledge us!!! I dont post any reviews whatsoever but I feel that future customers may feel this type of service as well! Thanks but no thanks, I'd rather take my business to the Olive Garden down the street since past experiences we've been treated WAY better! BTW, when we first got there, there was no host, and they weren't even busy at all!!

My boyfriend and I came to Macaroni Grill for our anniversary and the most awesome waiter! I wish we had gotten his name, but he was so kind and wonderful to us. He asked us questions and talked to us every time he came over. Wonderful human!

Had a terrible time. First my server was not very nice. Second, made my kids wait for their food while everyone else was served. Third, spoke with manager and then it just got awkward. Server got snotty and tried to show no I'll feelings, but just pushed us aside. Made faces and failed to connect with us. This was my wedding dinner that we did with our closest friends. This has ruined the meal. Dessert, I did not have the stomach to ask had a hard time enjoying my dinner also. More things happened that made the night very uncomfortable. Please stay away from this place if it means anything to you or your family. I will never come back again.
This is a to be the worst place for food. The food was dry no flavor and they take for ever to get your order placed not worth the wait i would have rather not have eaten dinner..

The 3 stars are for the new Ginger Spritzer, which I could never get enough of, & the Italian lessons you get in the ladies room, lol!

I've had a couple of dishes here. 

The eggplant in the eggplant parmigiana was sliced really thick. I'm used to thin slices, so I can't say I loved it. 

The crusted sole was my least favorite dish here. I'm not sure if it was simply a fluke, but it was SOAKED in grease (butter or oil, not sure & don't care). There were maybe 5 little capers on top & I did ask for more, hoping to salvage the taste of the least greasy portions.   

The orzo with the sun dried tomatoes was YUMMY.

I and my wife's first reno attempt at a restaurant and we stood at the host station waiting to be seated or greeted for nearly 5 min a waitress eventually walked by and asked us if we needed anything she attempted to ask the hostess about seating us she shrugged her shoulders and walked away so the waitress sat us no one smiling or friendly it was not packed decor was nice with out door seating avaliable but after being seated in the middle of the room no one around us I liked the separation with the wife but no service employees standing around joking with each other while we sat hungry I read my menu 7 times so we walked out I have never felt so insulted by a restaurant

Started with bruschetta and it was super bland. The Alfredo sauce was overly salty had to send it back.  The spaghetti was pretty bland as well.  I had the fat bread and it was good, tons of crust!  The marinara for dipping was a little on the sweet side for my taste.  Overall disappointed in our visit.

Ok. Nothing really to rave about. I have not eaten at Romano's in over six years and wanted to try it out. They took off two of my favorite dishes, which was the cannelloni and the prosciutto and peas penne. The rosemary bread was bitter and the balsamic vinegar they serve with the bread is really low quality because of the acidity of it. Ok place if there isn't any other better Italian places in your city to eat; however, in Reno, plenty of other places I would recommend.
Being seated and waiting 30 minutes before anyone checks on us. Drinks, bread. A date night gone bad due this fine establishment.

Our waiter was very attentive and always making sure we were doing okay or offering suggestions. However, the food was "okay." I had the Alfredo, but there was nothing special about it. My first bite of the chicken had a long black hair in it, which definitely disgusted me, but I didn't want to make a fuss so I just kept picking through it carefully. My fiancé had the Truffle Macaroni and it didn't have any distinct flavor to separate it from any other macaroni at a restaurant. The cheese was a little hardened to the macaroni and was just overall, not the best. We ended up sharing my Alfredo. My sister got the salmon and was not impressed with that either. She maybe ate a half of it and then switched to eating the bread. 
Overall, if you are looking for somewhere that has decent service, Macaroni Grill has that! But the food isn't anything special especially for the price!

Top notch! My girlfriend and I have been here a few times and every time we have been there the service and food has been fantastic! We are always treated with so much respect. The staff is always so quick and caring about our service. The food has always been amazing. We love the portobello fries and the sauce that comes with it. I haven't ordered everything off the menu but I can vouch for it because what we have ordered has been so good. I highly recommend the Macaroni grill to anyone looking for delicious Italian cuisines!

My spouse and I went to the restaurant on a Tuesday night about 7 pm .They were not very busy. We both ordered dinners.The service was very good, but the food was terrible. My spouses lasagna was burned on the bottom, the spaghetti was luke warm with very little sauce.My meal was an angle hair pasta with shrimp and it was not warm enough for me to eat. When I order meal I at least expect it to come to the table hot. We have given this place 3 times to get it right, we will not be returning gor a 4th try.

We had a birthday dinner at The Macaroni Grill last night. I have to say that I received wonderful service. Amanda, our server, was friendly, helpful and did everything she could to make sure we had a great experience. We had the manager come over and check on our party, making sure we had a great evening. We even met the head chef, who wanted to check and see if our meal was to our liking, come over and talk with us. Our party had various items from the menu and we all walked away full, happy and so willing to come back again. It may be a chain restaurant, but it really felt like a small, family run business, making sure we felt special the entire time we were there. Thank you for making this birthday party a special one!

The service is fine, I have no complaints there, nor anything negative to say about the facilities themselves. 

The food is bad though. I once ordered a chicken "salad", which was a very thin, chewy, greasy bit of (I am assuming) chicken meat, pounded out to the size of a manhole cover, and served on top of some spinach. It was difficult to cut through, using a very large and sharp knife; eating it made me feel sad. I think there were tomatoes? The soggy, yet somehow hard, chicken-blanket overwhelmed everything else. 

I've tried the food here several times. The only good thing I have had is the bread. If I were Romano, I would be molto triste, but I am pretty sure he isn't real.
Had a GREAT dining experience at this location thanks to Tina!!!!  I didn't feel rushed, the food was hot and Tina was super helpful!!!

Fun story.  Last week Macaroni Grill was running a special for 2 for one express lunches.  Normal cost is $7.00, but with the deal order one entree, get the second one for free.
I work in a large office.  A number of people at the office decided this would be a great day to order lunch at Macaroni Grill and take advantage of the 2 for 1 price.  12-16 people placed orders online.  If you are in the restaurant the express lunch is $7.00 ready in 7 minutes or the order is free.  This is not true of the online ordering.  We were fine with this.  We were told by the online order the time our last order would be ready was about 20 minutes.  We arrived in 25 minutes in hopes our orders would be ready.  Long story short, they were not ready and we ended being at the restaurant 35 minutes waiting.  Lots of the food was cold, some people didn't get what they ordered and overall the initial experience was not good.  I called and asked to speak to the manager on duty.  It was Troy but he was behind the counter cooking to help get orders out.  This I could be believe because the restaurant was really really busy.
I left my name and number and asked for him to call me back.  After the lunch rush he called me back.  He was extremely sincere and apologetic.  He asked where we worked and offered to make things right.  He gave us two choices.  He would provide a family style meal or we could do a "do over".  I choice the "do over" since the whole office didn't order didn't think it would be fair to bring in a family style meal and not share with everyone. Troy give me the direct number to him and told me when he would be in the restaurant.  

Today was "Do Over" day.  I called about 45 minutes before we wanted to pick up the order.
Troy remembered speaking to me ( it was 6 days ago), he asked for the orders no questions asked.  I gave him a list of orders and included each person's name. He asked when I wanted to pick up the order.  I said 11:30.  One of the items we ordered were cookies.  He explained they don't always have cookies but he would see what he could do for us. We got to the restaurant and could see things were much calmer.  Our order was being put together and we were asked to have a seat for a few minutes.  At most we waited 5 minutes and we were handed three bags of food, extra dressings, cheese and utensils.  I asked the two people who presented our food to thank Troy for us.  As we were walking out, he called to us and asked us to wait a minute.  He came up to us with freshly baked chocolate chip cookies still hot and gooey.  You could tell they had just come out of the oven. I thanked him again for making this right and going above and beyond.

Thank you again Troy for turning this around.  We will definitely be back.
Grateful,
Lisa

April 2, 2011 Saturday - Dinner 5:45 PM
2 people (1 kid and me)

Atmosphere - 5 stars
Food - 4 stars
Service - 3 stars

Background - Been here many times in the past but do not remember how long it has been since the last visit, more than a year easily.

Atmosphere - Dimly lit restaurant chain with a rustic "Italian" feel.  The restaurant was full and half of the customers were prom goers.  While waiting to be seated I just my daughter the cart of logs being hauled in, which led to the conversation about the wood oven they have in the corner of the kitchen.

Food
Appetizer - The free bread they provide before the meal was piping hot, the steamed poured out after pulling it apart with my hands.  The second loft served during the meal was the same way.

Dinner - I had order the Roasted Chicken Cannelloni.  The cheese filling was excellent.  The sauce was not too sweet, just right, but there could have been more.  I would have loved to dip my bread into the sauce.  The chicken had little to no flavor; it could have been very firm tofu.  I would have preferred that the cannelloni be served on a plate instead of a flat wide bowl; it just made the use of a fork a little challenging, as the bowl served no purpose to hold anything in.

Dessert - We skipped this as I had planned on another location for this treat.

Service - The hostess indicated that was a small wait as they were cleaning and prepping the table, not an issue as I was expecting a wait.  A minute later she indicated that she was ready.  While walking to the table half way there we had to turn around as the table was not ready.  When we did get there the table was set up for four people, strange.  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.  My daughter received an adult sized beverage, I figured she was getting older, so I was comfortable and did not send it back even though she order from the kids menu.  So the bill arrived and her drink was on the tab, as it should not be as it is part of the kid's meal.  They charge $2.20 for a glass of Sprite, really?  I brought this up to the waitress, she looked at the bill and then the class quickly, and instantly she knew what happened.  She indicated that I was correct, and in less than a minute it was corrected with a new bill.

I have not been here in about 7 years. What I remember being the best bread and best dipping sauce was certainly disappointing. The bread used to be very soft, and the oil for dipping tasted of a better quality and had seasoning in it. Now the bread had a slight crunch on the top and the oil had no seasoning and didn't taste very good. The food was of decent quality for a chain, meaning average. I had their limoncello martini which was excellent and then tried their Bellini. It was way too sweet, I couldn't drink it. Our waiter was excellent, service all around great, fast, and good ambiance.

Came thanksgiving day because no one else was open. THE BEST service I've ever had. Lindsay was so cute and sooooo prompt and on top of things. Food was yummy and they had a thanksgiving meal and great wine deals.

Our Friday night dinner was unforgettable. 

I look my friend our for his first Italian dinner, It was such a great experience, Our waiter was really nice and helpful. 

We ordered the Shrimp Portofino - Angel Hair Pasta with Sauteed Shrimp, Mushrooms, Pine Nuts, and Spinach with a Citrus Butter Sauce and the Pasta Milano- Juicy Grilled Chicken with Mushrooms, Sun-Dried Tomatoes in a Garlic Cream Sauce with Bow Tie Pasta. 

The Shrimp Portofino could have been a larger portion seemed a bit small but was very delicious. The right out of the oven fresh baked bread dipped in Olive Oil & Balsamic was to die for. 

Wonderful experience.

Romano's is usually very consistent and that's a good thing when traveling.. Trying new places in Reno hasn't really been good experiences so we decided to go with what we know. 

Our server (Sinead) was very pleasant, friendly and seemed like she was enjoying her job.. It was a Friday evening a little slow so we had time to talk with her as we were her only table. 

The food was spot on with our favorite dishes. 

One of the hostesses (Megan) stood on a chair and sang a beautiful Italian opera song which was very nice. We've never had experienced this before. 

The place was spotless. I don't know the managers name (mid age white female) and she didn't stop.. She was on the go the whole time doing whatever needed to be done. She stopped by to ask if everything was ok.

Met a friend for dinner last night. She wanted to go here because they were doing a fundraiser for the Humane Society. We were seated right away. Got our iced teas quickly and the bread shortly after. After we finally decided on what we wanted, our waiter informed us they were out of meatballs. Really? That is what we were both wanting. So she went with lasagna and I had the eggplant. Both were good. 

The only low point was we never got any water. This would have been fine except we had to ask for refills on the iced tea.

Several of us had lunch there, the pasta was so under cooked you could use it for tires.  The Alfredo and Pomodoro sauces and the pasta were all but cold, lukewarm would be a stretch.  Very unpleasant, we won't be back.  Not much has changed over the years.  When they first opened years ago they were good, not so much now.

I met a friend for dinner tonight at 6 pm and was greeted by several friendly staff members. We were quickly seated by our server named James who was a delight. I had the Mushroom Ravioli which was perfectly prepared and served within 20 minutes of ordering and my friend ordered the Chicken Marsala and said it too was delicious. Due to last minute Christmas shoppers it wasn't as crowded as most Friday nights.  Perhaps the low ratings were given by people who want to keep the crowds down, but we were very satsfied.
We were seated right away and the food was great as well as the service we received from our server "Tina", we will definitely be back again!

I love the Macaroni Grill, but I had the WORDT service at this location! The server was actually really nice! BUT we NEVER checked on us, gave us water or anything. It talked to a couple, in assuming regulars, at the bar the entire time. When we went the restaurant was dead, there were only 3 tables, and that couple at the bar. But the server just focused and talked to the people at the bar. It was annoying. I just wanted some water. But couldn't get any.

This was always a favorite casual restaurant of mine, but the last few times we've been here have not been so good.  Today was no exception to this new rule.  I ordered the chicken with roasted vegetables and he had a pizza.  After waiting quite awhile for the food, the chicken on my plate was so over-salted it was not edible and had to be sent back.  By the time my new plate came out, he was already finished eating.  So, we each ate alone even though we were at the same table, they offered nothing to him while he waited for me to eat, and not one bit of the check was reduced.  This left such a bad (and salty) taste in my mouth  that I will not spend another penny here.

How's this place still in business? Service was decent but it could not save itself from a one star review. Where do I even start? I guess appetizers... the calamari was the worst I have ever eaten. It's worst than getting it from the frozen section of a dollar store bad! Seriously. My father and brother's steak were so tough, they couldn't cut it. It wasn't just the steaks fault but their steak knifes were dull af. Our seafood pasta dish was over cooked and description was bad. Maybe it's my fault but usually dishes that has the word white wine in it, we assume it was a white sauce dish. Nope. At this point. We were ready to leave. Heck, I'm ready to leave this review because there was so many bad things, I don't feel like talking about it all. My advice, anywhere is better than here and I mean it.

I've gone to this place many times with family (I never get the urge to eat here they for some reason do.) Every single order has been cold it's like they wait to serve the food together but half the plates come out cold the others hot. The staff is very friendly very calm place but I am not there for the staff or atmosphere I am there to eat and unfortunately every dish I've ordered has been cold. Serve the ******* food before it gets cold!
Very disappointed with my experience. I could go into details but I'm too upset to sit here and write about it since it was just a few minutes ago. Would not recommend

My husband and I have decided to have our lunch in this establishment, it's been quite awhile since last visited this restaurant.  The Maitre D welcomed us with swarm smiled and immediately seated us on a nice, cozy window booth.  The restaurant ambiance created a romantic old world feel.  Our friendly server Julian was accommodating and very thoroughly presented us their luncheon specials including their limited time, best flavors of the harvest season menus.  I have tried their Shrimp Portofino and my husband choose their Chicken Alfredo both were very tasty  we accompanied our meal with their raspberry ice tea.  The quick lunch was very refreshing and added more energy for our hectic afternoon errand.  Looking forward to visit them again this coming holiday when families and relatives comes to visit in town. 

So  just right after the holidays , we decided to try their dinner, the service personnel were equally pleasant and friendly.  The food were served quick and as tasty as I remembered.  Just so happens I have also received a $10 off $30 meal promotion on my meal made it even a better experience.  I think we are going to be regulars.

Went in for my wifes birthday and had the worst service. Our server alfredo hardly checked on us. When asked for drinks I asked for a couple of samples of wine and he looked a bit irritated since I wanted to know what bottle I wanted to get for dinner. After he brought the samples with attitude I decided to get a beer. When our food arrived we were offered nothing with our meals and only brought 2 set ups when there was 4 of us. Mid meal one of us asked for cheese and alfredo brought it with a little bit of anger. I would understand if it was busy that he was frustrated and slammed but it was a slow night. The party of 4 behind us sounded like they had great service and even offered us their bread since it took forever for our server to approach us. I don't think we will ever come back since the service was horrid.

I had a gift card, so went with high hopes & we experienced nice service with ok happy hour drinks. I was hoping for good food but it fell short of the mark. The Alfredo sauce was runny & bland. The chicken parm was thin & served with spaghetti, why? If it wasn't for the free bread I might have left hungry. Nothing to brag about, but dont take my word for it, the 2 1/2 stars is fitting.

Ate here with my family in March 2018, and we all enjoyed our experience.  This was one of the better Macaroni Grills we have visited.

The Restaurant has a great traditional classy Italian decor.  The staff and servers were all very nice and attentive.  Really nice and comfortable ambiance.

The food was delicious.  Everyone loved their meal.  The portion size was above average the the quality was great.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food and quality.

We would eat here again, and would encourage our family and friends to do the same.

I honestly have never been so impressed by a restaurant in my whole life. We arrived at about 7pm and were quickly seated. We then had to wait over 15 minutes for someone to even acknowledge us. When our waitress arrived she was frazzled,(not fault of her own). We asked for a manger and quickly Troy, the kitchen manager, arrived. He instantly stated our wait was unacceptable and took our order immediately. He made us laugh and made us feel important. He instantly went and put in our order and consistently came back with our food to ensure our service was prompt and delivered with a smile and friendly attitude. Troy is the definition of what a great manger is. He made sure that the guest was completely satisfied and that the staff was supported. I'd come back for no other reason then Troy. You are doing something right here in Reno and have made a lifetime customer.

Ok, so I'm normally not a fan of chain resturants.  To me it is much more fun to find a local place with ambiance that is unique to where you are.  This way you can support local buisness and try something new.  As far as chain places go though, this one is my favorite.  Here's why...

1.  The cheese raviolis with pesto sauce and grilled mushrooms, basil and broccoli.  YUM!
2.  All the food is pretty good here, and I like that the meat-free options have lots of add on veggie options
3.  They will bring it out to your car when you order to-go
4.  When dining in the ambiance is great...fireplace, nice music, nice lighting

yeah, i gotta go, I am craving Italian now ;-)
Great experience, delicious food. Bailey delivered us the best service imaginable and because of her excellence, we will be back very soon.

Service was excellent. Bailey killed it, great attitude, awesome food but service was what will keep people coming back. Been a server for 12 years, I know good service, and she really made it a good experience.

Meal was good. We came for dinner.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs. I like the way it used to be with two large meatballs. They were hand packed here and made fresh. Now they are small and give you more like 8 little ones. They are frozen and processed. Not even close. I don't like when chains try to cut corners and go cheap. They sacrifice quality. Some damn bean counter came up with this.  I will never order this again.  Not worth it. I can do better at home. When I go out for dinner, I want something I can't get at home.
Everything else was good.

Had dinner last night last night.  I had wanted to try Macaroni Grill for dinner,  after having enjoyed lunch  in Roseville. I don't know if my expectations were too high. But we both ordered the lasagna, and that should of been served warmer than it was, almost cold and lack any seasoning or something. That combined with less than attentive service. Left us both a little surprised and disappointed, simply put, can't recommend this place at all.

I would give 0 stars if I could, took togo person 10 minutes to even acknowledge my existence, 45 minutes to get my order, restaurant was totally dead, customer service is terrible here, always is and always will be

My husband and I went in today for dinner. Server was nice but spoke about how busy and short handed they were. Food was good and so was the wine. But why I give this place a 1 star is because of the bald man with the white jacket. I kid you not, he greeted every single table but ours. Could it be because we are brown??!! If your going to go around and greet your customers, great them all! Not that feelings were hurt, but I observe and Bald Man...YOU were very unprofessional.

Let me tell you, if you are over 65 years of age on a Monday Night, this is the place for you. They've got the old man that only came for dessert and has probably been here for 3 hours. They've got the two older men watching sports and talking too loud because one of them cannot hear and the other has all the things to say. All the things. And last, but not least, we've got the older lady in the bathroom shoving paper towels in her purse.

All and all, it was okay.

I thought they were closing soon because the waiter came back in minute and a half intervals to if we were ready to order. Come to find out she was just super attentive because it is after all a slow Monday night. She was actually really nice. She's the reason this review is a 3 star instead of a two. 

I'm one of those people who look over the menu searching for something new to try and inevitably get what I always get: in this case, chicken fettuccine Alfredo. I give this dish effort for trying. I wasn't creamy, just oily, but it was still flavorful, so that was cool. 

My significant other got the truffle mac n cheese, which he was all about. I wasn't that into it, but as you can see, I'm kind of a turd. 

They had Coca Cola, which made me happy because I dislike Pepsi very much. They also give you a free square loaf of fresh bread... but no butter knife, which pretty much sums up the experience.

This place is where my family celebrates. We come here because we know the staff is friendly, the restaurant is warm and inviting, and the food is delicious. 

I do wish there were a few more vegetarian items, but what they do offer is prepared well.

If you're looking for a place to host a party or a large family gathering, this is the restaurant to go!
Food was good. No wow factor about it. This place doesn't really set itself apart from Applebee's or Chili's etc.. but like I said, no complaints about the food.

The food was good and the appetizers where good also the problems we had were that the hostess was very rude and not polite at all this was on 6 28 19 the service was good but we were told some things on the menu not available on a Friday at 730 pm over all this was just a fair dinner will try one more time but only one more devon.was a good waiter.

Saul did a marvelous job very kind and attentive and patient and recommended dishes and drinks  that were very delicious the food was excellent as well as our drinks this is our first time coming and we will certainly be back!

Good chain gone bad!
We'll never eat here again!
Poor service and bad food

I love this restaurant.  Though I no longer drink, when I did drink I enjoyed the big jug of wine.  This is a funny story about the Restaurant in Denver CO. My client and I, through my bosses urgings I took her out to lunch.  We must have gotten a bit loud, and the waiter came over and nicely told us "we were cut off".  I laughed and said "take it away, you scared me as I was afraid this great Restaurant was out of my all time favorite dish Shrimp Portofino.  I love the bread, dipped in olive oil and fresh vinegar. 
The desert tray.  I better stop as I'm getting hungry.  
It's late so I'll go tomorrow and get my fix.  
I highly recommend this place.

The portions were tiny....everything is extra and the service is weak.
Lobster ravioli was cold. Shrimp on the verge of spoiled.  Diet coke and water were wonderful that is why I give it star. 
Have not been here in awhile....used to be good now it is weak compared to even Olive Garden.
Step it up Romano or call yourself history
Cristina (TINA) made my evening. The food was awesome and the service was outstanding.  This was a great visit.

We went to Macaroni Grill last weekend, and really enjoyed it. 
The bread and peppered oil here is  - 5 stars YUM. 
We started with fried cheese - delish 
I had a Caesar salad - it was awesome 
I had the honey grilled salmon with rice - it was amazing REALLY amazing! The fish was PERFECT.. 

Our server kept our glasses full - love Cate!!! She even wrote her name down on the paper table cloth so we would know her name. 

My friend had the chicken Parmesan - it was SO good, he couldnt stop saying "ummm this is SO good" which takes a lot to get him all excited about his food - I really thought he was gonna go make love to the chef! 

We shared a slice of New York cheese cake at this point my gut was about to bust but I managed to scarf down a bite or two - WOW it was yummy too! 

$65.00 for 2 to eat like a couple of pigs on really good food, with great service ***clapping clapping**** 

I LOVE YOU ROMANOOOOOOOOOO 
*blowing kisses* 

p.s. parking is a bit sucky - but you will need a little walk after you stuff your face so stop complaining just walk the 20 extra steps!!!!

Food okay, Service lousy.

We went on a Thursday night (12/27/18).  Not really busy, but the service was terrible.  We will never go there again.  There are too many other choices that will give good service.

We've been here a few times in the past. It l had always been been enjoyable but things seemed to have moved in a downward direction.  
I ordered the calamari appetizer and a spaghetti with meatballs main.  The calamari was served warm at best, definately not hot right out of the fryer and was a little more chewy than properly prepared squid. It came with two dipping sauces but one was so dense as to be useless.  The pasta dish was just OK, nothing to write home about.  
Wait service was pleasant.
I don' think I'll be returning.

I went to eat lunch at this restaurant two days ago. Knowing  that i forgot my sun glasses after we ate. Then I called and ask if they found my sunglasses they said they don't find any and they cleaned up after we done eating. I have it with me I know for sure because after eating I am planning to go to Meadow Wood  for the maintenance of my sunglasses then My Bf came so we decided to go home instead. Then I remember my sunglasses that I have and it's not in my purse so I called up the restaurant and ask if they find any sunglasses on the bench seat they said they didn't find any  - They are sure that they clean the table and that place where we sat and never find any sunglasses I know I have it with me I never gone anywhere else before and after we ate so somebody had taken my sunglasses and never bring it to the lost and found. It sucks because I don't feel comfortable and and knowing that if you left Something in that place it's all gone. Are you going to tell me that it's all my faultBecause it's my responsibility but sometimes things happens and somebody will take advantage of it.You guys suck

My boyfriend and I went here last night for a last minute date night. We were immediately greeted when we walked in and got served right away. Our hosts were Christina and Jason and they were fantastic! The food was absolutely amazing. It was a lovely experience and I am glad we decided to go here. We give this place a full 5 stars!

Shrimp portofino. If you come to MacGrill, order this and only this. 

Otherwise, you may find yourself disappointed. Notice I didn't say that you WILL find yourself disappointed, it's not sure thing. Which is why, for now, I can only give MG 3 stars. I've given this restaurant more chances than I really should have. And consistency is really the only factor that is just not quite where i'd like it to be. 

Some days the meal is delicious. Some days my entree was somehow never placed with the rest of my table's order. Some days my meal is a disaster. 

As far as chain restaurants go, I'd still pick MG over almost anything else. 

And really, for a server to have to learn how to spell his/her name upside down and in crayon at every table without screwing up? That deserves some props. Not ever server at every restaurant has THAT as a prerequisite. ("heh, well, so uh, actually my name is Antoinette. But f*ck you if you think i'm going to write that on your table cloth. You may call me A. Can I get you all something to drink?"

Shrimp portofino. End.

The spaghetti and meatball dish has been changed since our last visit.  The quantity of meatballs was reduced from eight to three with a dollop of ricotta cheese on each meatball possibly to make up for the lack of protein. The meatballs were dry, crumbly and appeared to have been pre-made and thrown into the spaghetti as a decoration. They were not integrated into the dish. The small side salad had a bitter taste. Won't return.
Missed this place since they closed down my local spot. You still get crayons and a paper table cloth, bread and olive oil and self pour wine by the glass. Food was all good. Service decent.

Tried this for a mid week dinner with the family. Place was dead but service was very slow, bread was very stale. Bathrooms were disgusting, as were the floors and tables. This place was dirty and all furniture could use a good wipe down. Our waiter sucked. We waited nearly 20 minutes for our salad, entrees came much later and 1 was cold...neyver again.
Had never been to the one on Reno.  Went with a friend one evening for dinner.  Service was poor and food wasn't anything spectacular.  I probably won't go back again.

We were told there would be a 30-minute wait, even thought more than half the tables were available.  Once seated, the service was slow, with a disinterested waitress, but I can live with that if the food is really good. Far from it: the minimally-boiled sausage in my pasta was cool to slightly chilled; the overall pasta dish was served barely warm.  This, plus my wife's dish and a couple bottles of water, came to almost $50.  Mediocre, low value food and indifferent service risks your going back into bankruptcy--my wife and I certainly won't be returning anytime soon.
The worst food we have ever had.  Feel sorry for our server, not her fault the food was not edible.  Too bad because we used to live going there. Never again

The service tonight was super slow. Server didn't come back and offer us second bar drinks until our food had arrived so the wine came after dinner was over. Chicken parm was rubbery. New York Style cheesecake was hard and dry.  I seriously thought at first with the fork it was frozen. Nope. Just dry. The bread was good tho but took a while to come to us. And it was expensive even with a discount coupon. We won't be back.

I love this place in different location, but this one on South Virginia has to be the nastiest I have ever ate at. The chef over cooked the food, the waiter never came back to check on us or ask for more water. The food took almost an hour to get to us, the bread was cold and the waiter said they are fresh and coming out the oven, but how is it cold? When it came out the oven The cruton in the salad was so overwhelming with burnt taste. My little brother order the mama trio, and that lasagna with wine, was so overwhelming with the bitterness of the wine, to the point he couldn't eat it, because they did not reduce the wine down.i will never ever go back to this place. Maybe you should hire a real Italian chef who knows the culture food, instead of a sloppy Mexican chef who doesn't care how the food comes out

Generally speaking, my experience at Macaroni Grill has rarely been a disappointment however this time it was all about recovery and genuine great service which prompted this review and hats off to our server (Lura) who did an amazing job!

To elaborate a bit on what I mean with my introduction, it started when I ordered the pollo caprese. According to the menu, this dish is grilled chicken breast, imported buffalo mozzarella, imported pomodorina, capellini but I've been on carb restricted diet so I opted out the capellini pasta and subbed the sautéed spinach. So what arrived from the kitchen was a grilled, tough and dry chicken breast, uncooked (basically raw) spinach and a few clumps of mozzarella (which had a unusual taste I find hard to describe, but not as it should). There was no imported pomodorina nor did the dish look at all appetizing!

I thought to myself after the runner left it on the table that I would never order this dish again even before I tasted it, so when our server Lura stopped shortly there after to check on the meal she could see immediately that I was not pleased and glanced at my plate and understood why. She politely asked me if she could make the matter right and took my plate back to the kitchen.

She returned a short while later with my dinner and brought the pomodorina which really helped the dish and a complete new order of the spinach (but again - was not really any better than the first version I was served). 

My recommendation is with all the other menu options to choose from at Macaroni Grill, keep clear of this particular dish, but do ask for Lura because she is a delight and really tried her best to make this so-so meal a more pleasurable experience!

This was by far the worst dinner we have had in a long time. The portion of Lasagna was not worth the price, just a small piece on a plate with nothing else with it...no salad, had to ask for a slice of bread. The bread tasted like old stale over seasoned shoe leather. The bread came with a small plate of seasoned oil...awful...not olive oil! It was rancid I'm sure of that! Also ordered a bowl to tomato soup. I had one spoonful as well as my husband. Both of us said no way! I told the waiter we can't eat this and sent it back. It looked and tasted like you opened a jar of Spaghetti sauce and poured it in a soup bowl. Just awful! My husband managed to eat the Lasagna. I drank my soda, which was all I had for dinner. I can't even tell you how filthy the restrooms were, especially since everything is to be sanitized these days. The floor under our table was sticky, hadn't been washed after a soda that had been spilled who knows when????  We would  never go back even if it was free.

I'm about giving establishments a second chance so that's what I did recently.  Overpriced mistake.  Rubbery eggplant parmigiana, garbage spaghetti and if you want a salad, oh that's extra.  Save your time and money and go elsewhere.  I just can't figure out how this place is still in business with the garbage they put out.  I hate to be negative but I've tasted better frozen "Italian" food than the pathetic plates this place puts out!!

This place was awful. We were waiting 1 and a half waiting for our food. The waitress would ignore what we were saying and we would then have to ask a different waiter or we would have to repeat what we were saying. She claimed that the"computers weren't working and lots of other excuses. But there was another waiter who served his customers before us when we arrived before them. In conclusion I would not recommend this place one bit, we were so mad that we just walked out of there.

SHOUTS OUT BOBBY 

2nd time out here in Reno, extremely hungry, only thing that sounded appetizing at the time was pasta. Contacted my friend who is a local. He recommended Macaroni Grille and a few others but macaroni grille was the closest and said F it. So I made the 5 minute drive from the Peppermill. It was around 9 pm when I arrived. Parking was accessible. Got inside, unfortunately was not greeted promptly. After asking a bartender if it was open sitting or if someone would seat us she helped us right away and sat us. No biggie. Inside was clean. Host sat us down next to the fire place where we would be warm! Very nice. Our waiter, by the name of Robert, introduced himself and instantly offered us a wine. We had the sausage rigatoni and spaghetti with meatballs. I ordered the sausage rigatoni spicy. Robert offered to bring out a few things to spice up our dish- nice touch! While waiting for our food we were brought the free bread with oil. To be honest, wasn't a big fan of the bread but no big deal! We didn't come here for the bread. While waiting for our pasta we had Sauvignon Blanc. As someone who does not drink wine, the Sauvignon black was the niceyest that I've ever had, (again, I don't drink wine). Our pasta arrived and Robert brought us Parmesan cheese and red pepper flake. To wrap it up, Robert was great because of his personal recommendations and his professionalism as a server, he made the experience really great, he's the man. I'll ask for him whenever I come back one day.

So sad I used to love this place sadly on my last visit I ordered my favorite  eggplant parmesan which is usually a pretty big platter, instead I got 3 golf ball sized pieces of eggplant. I was disappointed in the size and when I took my first bite I tasted a charcoal flaver ALL of them had been burnt to a crisp!!! then flipped over and served!!!!!!! We alerted the waiter who just brought us more eggplant 30mins later by the time I got it everyone in my party had eaten! and it was under cooked this time raw eggplant is not delicious, then they expected me to PAY for that!!! This branch has gone down the drain

AWFUL SERVICE! I don't think I have ever had such bad service in my life. The waitress who only had three tables, yes I counted, kept vanishing for long periods of time. I could tell the other tables that were hers were getting upset as well. And when she was in sight she would be next to the manger laughing it up instead of doing her job. The only reason we came to this place was because we had a gift card but we definitely won't be coming back.

This place is good for people that are having a party they give you a cake for good deeds!! The food is overall REALLY DAMN GOOD the pizza cruft is really soft and cool! We really liked it here but it was my first time going here I thought it was like a really bad place but I was wrong! This is amazing the people are really nice and I hope the get some good luck for 2019-2020! You good customer Jorge I'm from the north east side ok bye! Ok

Can't recommend this restaurant.  I ordered the salmon.  Was dry and on the plate with it is only a few greens.; no rice, no veggies, nothing.  You get a Ceasars salad so you are eating two salads.  20 for a dry piece of salmon is excessive.  I wouldn't even give one star but had to.

Good, not great.  Service a bit slow, bread served in one large hunk so everyone at the table has to put their hands all over it to cut it.  Salad mainly romaine ribs, not leaves and too big for bite size. Now I remember why I haven't been there in years.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Never coming back. Walk in, no host, waiting for a few mins for anyone to even acknowledge us. It is not busy AT ALL. As we were about to leave someone finally came to seat us. Ok fine. Got bread quick but our server never came back. We were SO thirsty. A few other groups who sat AFTER us got their drink & food orders. We just walked out.

My daughter wanted to go to Corino's for her birthday dinner out and we were bummed to find that they had closed the only one in town. She mentioned this as an alternative so we went for it. I was hesitant as the last time we went the service was so terrible, I actually used the crayons they furnish you to create a tip meter. My girls were like "Dad, that's not nice." LOL

I am afraid to say we were disappointed once again. I even got up to refill our water decanter that they furnish you during your meal. Once we finally did get our food it was pretty good, but you could tell it was franchise food if you know what I mean.

So, I guess if you don't mind waiting around for you food all night and enjoy helping yourself, this might not be a bad place for you... :)

Note: don't forget your Costco card, $100 value for $79.99.

My wife decided to bring me here for Father's Day. It was a good choice, I really enjoyed it. It is been over 10 years since I've been here. Couldn't really remember why we didn't return, 

The service was great, the manager sat us and was very friendly. For Father's Day, it was not that busy. However the server did tell us that it was really busy earlier, before we arrived, and they are shortstaffed. We saw none of this.

What we ordered:

Drinks
Top shelf margarita, on the rocks, no salt.
Peach sangria
Lemonade for kids

Dinner
Father's Day menu
Steak & potatoes, medium rare, 
Garden salad
Shrimp Portofino
Kids meatballs with spaghetti
Kids chicken with broccoli

Dessert
Decadent Chocolate cake

The garden salad is a $2.50 ad on, however if it is unlimited refills. It arrived and was very tasty, made with bib/butter leaf lettuce. It was missing tomatoes. I asked her for another salad as it is unlimited, but I asked her to add tomatoes. She came back and said it was a very busy day and there was no tomatoes. So she took it off the bill. The dinner also came with a small loaf of bread, that was tasty. It was topped with fresh butter and Parmesan. A little on the salty side.

The steak was cooked perfectly. It was also very tender. Probably one of the best steaks I've had in the restaurant the last few years. The potatoes were baby red potatoes, roasted with a Parmesan cheese. It was powdered cheese, kind a like the Parmesan shaker you get a pizza joint. They had a nice caramelization, tender, yet a little crunch. Can't ask for better. The broccoli that came with it, had a nice rich flavor, but was a little too al dente for me. I think that's just a matter of preference though. 

My wife's shrimp was also cooked perfectly, it came with angel hair pasta and mushrooms. The flavor was a little bland. I think it was a garlic butter, but just not enough flavor for me. But she didn't complain lol. She did like the pinenuts in it and the green leaf vegetable in it.

The kids dishes had good flavor. I think the chicken was about 2 ounces, as well as two small meatballs for the kids meals at six dollars. Lots of pasta in it and marinara sauce. I do feel the kids were a little bit short changed. Not very much protein at all, tons of pasta for six dollars. I was able to share my steak with them so they were happy. 

The decadent chocolate cake was perfect. It was included in the Father's Day menu, and very large. We were able to share it and still not finish it.

We had a Mother's Day dinner of 8. We had reservations but there was no need since there was no one really in there.  2 of us got our food 10 minutes after everyone else. It took another 5 minutes for the last person to get there food.  The manager or the server never even apologized or offer any type of discount. Horrible customer service.
The service was decent here for lunch and the food is just alright.  I probably would only come back if I was super hungry and nothing else was close by.

I ordered food through Uber eats and it was inedible. The salt content was soooo high, we literally could not eat the food. $60 later and there was no response from the restaurant. Poor customer service and crappy food. It used to be amazing. I guess they've joined the others in microwaving because this was not fresh at all. The Bolognese had no sauce and the big tortellinis were filled with salt like the topping. They've definitely gone downhill, and the fact that they wouldn't credit anything? Unacceptable. I was starving but would not touch it. So I paid for crappy food I couldn't eat but I will NEVER do that again.

Terrible service, this place is just trash.
Probably 10 mistakes, mistake after mistake.
Took too long and made mistakes with the soup and salad. Like shit. Some Mother's Day dinner, no wonder why there is no one here. Probably at cheese cake.. 

Where is the manager when you need him?
Haha soup was delayed and salad looked like some McDonald salad. 

Some unlimited soup when there isn't any.. akward

Not happy.


Food is okay 


The best server was the African American lady and a lady with glasses. Knew service was lacking and tried to fix it

Been here many times in the past, had forgotten why it had been so long since our last visit. Love the ambiance, the smells of Italy as you open the door. We ordered our entree and a dinner salad each. We waited and waited and waited. Finally had to ask for the salads, it's a salad, not too time consuming. We look presentable, had showered and are great tippers, however, seems our waitress felt others far more deserving of her time and attention. So disappointing and suddenly I recalled what had kept us away for so long. Their poor customer service.  I always want to have a great dining experience and go in with a positive attitude but will be some time before I forget.

Fail. Went in for my girls birthday.  I've never been before.  Service was ok I guess lots of going back and forth for food. My place setting had old food stuck on it and when I got my salad it came with the wrong dressing I asked for balsamic I'm pretty sure it was rasberry or something definitely not balsamic.  I think our server  was amie. I got the osso buco. Was hesitant because it was 28 dollars.  It was cold. Not appetizing at all to eat cold mush potatoes and beef.  Portion was small and looked like cafeteria food kind of slopped on the plate. Held my tongue so my girl could enjoy her  piping hot steaming chicken parmesan. Went to use the restroom.  I'm serious it was like 50 degrees in there. Sitting on the toilet was cold and uncomfortable and the lock was broken. And the topper was as we were walking out one of the cooks was standing right in the open kitchen eating food of the line with his bare hands.  How disgusting. Just knowing he probably made my "food" made me feel sick. I cook for a living almost 16 years. I'm not a fan of bad Yelp reviews being in the industry my self but I will never go there again. This is the first bad Yelp I've written in a looooong time. I do get the fact it is macaroni grill but come on. Fail...

I went there with my 2-year-old daughter for lunch. The waiter was very friendly and helpful. What a great customer service! And freshly baked bread and choose-your-own pasta were delicious!! We're vegan so it's so nice to be able to choose what we like in the pasta. I chose seasonal veggies with fresh mushrooms and sun-dried tomatoes. Yum!! I ordered grilled asparagus as a side. I'll try roasted brussels sprouts next time. Food also came out so fast! It was a wonderful experience.

My hubby took me out for my birthday and I couldn't be more impressed with everything. The portions of food for the price. The ambiance, the Italian singers in the background. I ordered the butternut pasta dish soooooo good! My husband order shrimp scampi and was very shocked to count 8 jumbo prawns in his dish. Normally he get 5-6 at other restaurants we have been to for that same order. When it was time for dessert, the waiter had been told it was my birthday so he came by with a plate of goodies and had me pick one. I chose the tiramisu. On point! A man sung me happy birthday in italian and my tiramisu had a candle in it. Overall experience was awesome, staff was extremely friendly!!!! Way better than my experiences in the past at olive garden. A++++ I am one happy customer.

Absolutely not! Walk away from this overpriced, disgusting place! The poor service set the tone for a lack luster lunch service. There are reasons this restaurant was nearly empty. Issues:

-Server brought three dinner rolls for all ten people to share, then dripped balsamic vinegar from the broken container all over the table and menus.
-Kitchen was extremely slow  with over a half hour wait
-Server informed me my meal was not available, just a minute or two before bring the remainder of the meals to the table. One person finished their meal before mine arrived.
-Others noticed their plates of pasta were not hot, just lukewarm
-Spaghetti noodles mixed into a plate of fettuccini
-One of the mussels in my meal was so undercooked the shell had not even opened - SERIOUS HEALTH HAZZARD
-The restroom had a dirty diaper and a religious brochure in the stall; from the horrid smell, it's clear the diaper had been in the bathroom many, many hours. Possibly overnight

There are far too many disappointing facets of this restaurant to consider returning.

This place has gone so downhill it is awful.
We went there for a birthday dinner last evening and the service was horrible  we waited for our order to be taken at least a half hour!  We never got our water refilled and were not asked if we wanted dessert but all we wanted was to get out of there!  The food was also horrible !
We remembered this as being a good place for quick Italian !  Never will we go there again! 
Should of known by all the empty tables !
Christina is absolutely amazing. I go here all the time, but this was definitely my favorite visit. She is so sweet and on top of it.
Love love love this place! Staff is super friendly and food is delicious every time we go here. So many favorites but everyone has to try the mushroom ravioli

My girlfriend and I used to love going to this Macaroni Grill. We hadn't been there in a year and it has definitely gone downhill. Last Sunday I decided to order the dish pictured (the mushroom ravioli) via Doordash. Ordering went fin, but when it arrived, it seemed a little light for a dish that might resemble the dish featured on their menu, especially one costing $21. I opened it up and I saw this monstrosity. Only a few pieces of ravioli, burnt to the point of being inedible with a dash of (also burnt) mushroom gravy. I immediately called up the restaurant and demanded an explanation. I was told that the General Manager cooked this particular dish and that I would be getting a refund in a week. 
Well, it's been a week. I called and was told it might be another couple of weeks before I get my refund because the folks in the corporate office are only occasionally in the main office anymore. I did get an offer for them to remake my order. No thanks. Fool me once . . . 
I will never be eating here again and I don't recommend anyone else do until they either hire new management or, at least, banish the GM from the kitchen. They clearly don't know how to cook or about appropriate portion sizing.

Visited this place with my 2 nieces to catch up and buy them lunch since they drove all the way up from Fernley to visit and were excited to check this place out and were pleasantly surprised to not only see how empty it was but also how the decor seemed to be on the "fancier" side for a chain restaurant and we actually felt underdressed. Our waiters name was Alfredo, I believe it was. His demeanor was pretty strange whenever he would come up to the table he would interrupt the conversation, make a strange joke and then before leaving he would take my nieces empty specialty drink glasses and bring refills without asking so throughout the entire meal we assumed that the refills were free. They both ordered the Alfredo with chicken added and I was told they were pretty underwhelmed by the under salted Alfredo and the dry chicken; for $14-17 per plate Its safe to say I expect a proper Alfredo. I ordered their "signature" truffle Mac and cheese and I didn't find it to be good at all; too much truffle oil, not enough salt, pepper or cheese.  When i was given the bill i was unpleasantly surprised to see we were charged for SIX specialty kid drinks for each time our waiter so kindly refilled their glasses without asking or informing that refills were full price or else I would have verbally declined. For 1 appetizer, 3 entrees, 6 specialty kid drinks and a water for myself was just under $95 after tax not including a tip....Woulda spent less if we went to Texas Roadhouse and all got 2lb steaks. Keep your options open when suggesting this place to take your friends or family

This used to be my favorite restaurant for Italian food. Unfortunately though, over the past few years, the price has gone up and the food quality and service has gone down. Way down. 

The last two times I've been there the waiters have been absolutely terrible. The first guy was on speed or something and made it obvious that he was annoyed when we asked for bread and other simple requests. During this same trip we waited there for over an hour for two simple salads. 

During our next visit, it was clear that the waiter was hung over. In fact I think he may have been still drunk from the night before. He even knocked over a couple of glasses at different tables. He would constantly repeat his introduction even though he had already been by to take our order. Finally after 30 minutes our salads and soup came. The soup was ok, but the salad was old and the croutons were so disgusting that my girl friend spit them out. They were beyond stale. Our eggplant Parmesan took over 1 hour and 45 minutes to make. We literally were getting up to walk out when it arrived. To make matters worse, the red sauce was so cold that parts of it were still frozen. The eggplant was disgusting as well, we needed a steak knife to cut it. Then the manager came by as she could tell we weren't happy. Her attitude from the very beginning was very defensive. We explained our frustration with the salad, wait time, staff, and entree. She immediately tried to justify the wait time by saying eggplant takes at least an hour to cook. She then claimed that the croutons were made about an hour ago - clearly a bunch of BS. She concluded with "I'm not supposed to tell you this but our eggplant is very earthy". Whatever that means. I've had eggplant at other fine restaurants and it never takes longer than 30 minutes to cook nor does it take much effort to cut. Bottom line is the manager needs to go and maybe Mac grill can be saved. Otherwise this business will not survive with her at the helm. She simply isn't manager material, has little to no people skills, and really is a disgrace to the reputation of Mac grill.

"Because you had a bad day" will be the theme of this review. It all started on a Wednesday, I was craving my usual, chicken Parmesan sub fettuccine Alfredo, extra sauce, extra dressing. I know what I want and what makes the fat kid inside of me go "weeee!" 
I'd placed the order via grub hub, the driver was a delinquent to say the least and made my seemless delivery seem endless as the driver couldn't read a standard GPS, but that's neither here nor there. After a mere 1 hour 45 minutes my food landed, but there was an issue...the order was incorrect...AFTER the long wait, the numbers didn't add up, I was hangry and on one,...so I called macaroni grill, I was greeted by a sweet young voice who then transferred me to a sweeter baritone, the GM. Troy Crisco, who said he would make it right and personally drop it off..., in which he did, and WOW. Thank you Troy! For not only ensuring the satisfaction of your customer base but for also doubling the Alfredo and throwing in a chocolate cake, my inner fatty lept for joy. 
That's the type of service you that'll stop you dead in your tracks, and makes your heart melt. #worldclass

We used to come quite often. The kids menu has changed.  They don't give the kids ice cream anymore after their meal.They used to have the best honey mustard. They don't have that anymore either. The portions have gotten smaller.  The servers wear jeans now instead of black pants. Service is not as good.  Alfredo is a good server. Hopefully you get him. If not, good luck! Food is good. I recommend the Parmesan crusted sole.

Been here a few times now. Every single experience has been wonderful!

The food and service has been exceptional each time. This last visit we enjoyed live Italian style opera singing. It was very unexpected and fun, definitely not something you typically see at a restaurant chain. 

Every time we've come we couldn't leave less than a 20% tip, these waiters and waitresses are not just nice they are truly genuine. They aren't over the top, with a cheesy "hello and how may I help you's" only to scurry from the table as quickly as possible. They genuinely smile and make conversation, have impeccable timing and attentiveness even on a busy Friday night, and know how to make recommendations from the menu. Really wish we could note all their names individually to give them props. 

The food is fully flavorful, not just salty. The bread is warm a loaded with rosemary flavor, I always request balsamic with my dipping Olive oil. Each dish has a unique flavor profile not just your typical Italian style chain where the only options are salty cheesy or salty tomato. People have complained about portion size/cost ratio on other reviews but honestly, I have never left here anything less than STUFFED with left overs for lunch the next day. We typically spend $55-$60 on two specialty drinks, two appetizers, and two entrees (my choice usually being a seafood/lobster dish) at dinner, not shabby at all when you consider the customer service, atmosphere, quality, AND quantity at that price. 

If you suffered a bad experience here, I am strongly advising you give it a second/third shot and even mention your last experience to your waiter when you come in, I'm positive a place like this will make it up to you. This is probably my favorite restaurant of the moment. Totally worth the five star review I'm giving it.

I work at a restaurant and would never treat my costumers the way I was treated here.  There were multiple issues, but most notably my food was undercooked.  Rather then believing me, the waiter had another worker taste it... unacceptable.

We went there yesterday at 1pm. There was 4 of us. Bailey was our server. The place was quiet. There was one large table that had been served. Our waters came fast. It took 30 minutes to place an appetizer order. Our salads came quick. The soup, I ordered tomato basil. It was bland. Our food took an hour to get. The pasta sat under the heat lamp so long it was dry and crispy. We asked for more sauce. Our waitress never came back. My sister got upset and found the manager. The final straw was when we decided we were going to just take our order to go and Bailey came over with our containers, dropped them on the table, with attitude and said, "Here you go." And walked off. She never refilled our waters or asked how we were. The manager, Troy apologized. He told us he gave her a big table before us and she was overwhelmed. She could've communicated that. He could've also stepped up and helped her, but he didn't, based on his odor, he was out back smoking cigarettes. He comped our meals and told us to smile. My mom looked like she was going to cry. I felt like I wanted to cry. We have always loved this place. We will never be back. If Bailey would've been apologetic it would have been better. But, she finished off our loyalty.

Great place for a romantic date.

Was able to get some one-on-one time with my girl. The woman singing opera was amazing. I was really not expecting the dimmed lighting but was very impressed with everything. Outdoor seating would have also been great since they have heaters.

The bread was so good. I really enjoyed the Pasta Milano but saw some other great choices on the menu.
40 plus min wait still no food wasn't even that busy... server was great but kitchen was super slow
Food took forever soup was cold. Manager was touching people's food bare handed. Food receipts on top of salad while waiting to be served. Waited forever for food that was cold
It shouldn't take an hour to get a check, especially when you have two waitresses assigned to your table.

Server was nice however they have a chunky bald chef  that walks around to talk to each of the guest and the two to three times we have came here he has never once stopped at our table? First time it happened my husband suggested it might have something to do with race but I disagreed but now I'm in total agreement. It's not a coincidence that this has happened to us each time

Terrible service and food was bad.  They sat us in the lounge and table was far from booth seats. Ordered the prosciutto grilled cheese. The prosciutto was hard and crunchy and barely one bite of cheese

We had made arrangements for a birthday celebration at another restaurant (The Cheesecake Factory) but when we arrived at that restaurant this afternoon we were told that there was no record of the arrangement, which had been confirmed with the manager several days ago, and that we had to suffer through a two and one half hour wait.  Fed up with that restaurant, we contacted The Macaroni Grill.  On very short notice they agreed to immediately seat our group of more than a dozen persons.  In addition, we were seated in a private room for our birthday celebration.  The servers were very pleasant, our meals were served promptly, and the food was outstanding.  The birthday celebrant was even treated to the happy birthday song in Italian and a free dessert. The kind of treatment provided by The Macaroni Grill is how a restaurant gains and retains customers.  The Cheesecake Factory lost many customers this afternoon and forever.   The Macaroni Grill gained a loyal following.

Was very disappointed in our dinner tonight.   Chopped salad way too spicy and not very good.   I wish the waitress had removed the charge from our bill after she asked why I didn't eat much.   Took a very long time to get our meal with no apology.   Will not be going back    Plenty of other choices in town.   We are sad this one has gone downhill so much as it used to be one of our go to places.

What has happen to this place? I should have opened a jar of spaghetti sauce at home and bought Trader Joe's meatballs. It was awful. My lobster bisque soup tasted like it was cheese soup. Our waitress forgot our ice tea, forgot I wanted more olive oil for the bread, and never offered parm cheese for my husbands spaghetti. I was so disappointed in the food, I use to really like this place
Warning stay away from this establishment, average service mediocre food and unresponsive management. Attempted contact nervous times and NO reponse.!!! Enter at your own risk!!!

Don't waste your money here! Take it to Olive Garden where their food is actually worth the money! About 20 bucks for the most bland pasta I've ever had and absolutely like 3 pieces of chicken, also bland and My fries were cold and soggy. I was super excited to try this place and I should've just burned my money instead. $28 down the drain for the worst "Italian food" I've honestly ever had. Olive Garden is slightly cheaper and taste delicious.
Slowest service ever, two hour to get diner half a hour to get water with only half the restaurant full. Manager was not helpful food was below average and orders were forgotten.
The food was great and fast service. Jayme was my server, she was very funny and a attentive.
Calamari burned, Bibb salad contained rancid walnuts. Spaghetti not tasty. Terrible food. Won't return.

Amanda was fantastic! I'm from the restraint industry and can find flaws pretty quickly but this visit was great. Part of the atmosphere is an Italian song performed a capella by one the three hostesses. And I was told they come sing at your table if you ask.

We usually love this place. Sunday night, not so much. Not many people in to eat but plenty of staff. 
Several things on the menu were either not available or the wait person came much later to tell me they ran out of something. They put Italian dressing on my husband's salad along with a side of Ranch (which is what he asked for.) My daughter's order was wrong so they comp'd us on that. The food was not as good as we are used to. Keep trying guys, we'll see you in a few months.

After getting a less than desirable meal last week I was sent a message from a Google review.......when I went to macaroni grill website and submitted a survey ........I have not heard a thing and will not EVER give them any of my business again!!  Can't respond to a complaint and I won't frequent this establishment???

The menu offers a variety of dishes, as well as the wine menu. Our dinners were delicious (I ordered the shrimp scampi.), very flavorful.  The entire meal from the appetizer to dessert was delizioso. Staff was friendly.

I almost let the bad reviews keep me away from this place, but I had a craving for mushroom ravioli and decided to try it anyway. Most of these bad reviews revolve around poor service, and I was feeling exceptionally patient yesterday so my husband and I gave it a go. 
When we arrived (Wednesday night 8:45 p.m.) it was very slow, I counted two other tables inside the restaurant when we entered but several people dining at the bar area. 
The guy who sat us (Zack) was also our server, so we were able to order drinks right away. This place makes a fantastic Shirley temple. I'm normally not a soda drinker and I finished my glass. 
Zach was courteous and competent. He brought us bread and even came back by with balsamic vinegar per our request. We ordered the mac and cheese bites appetizer with truffle sauce. So delicious (you can't go wrong with fried macaroni and cheese!) We also ordered mushroom ravioli. This has always been my favorite dish from Romanos, and it did not disappoint. In fact my husband mentioned he thought they added more mushrooms than usual and we love mushrooms. 
Our entrees came with Caesar salad. This is new or newer, in the past you always had to add a salad if you wanted salad with your entree. We were surprised when it came to the table since we had not ordered them, but Zack let us know they come with our entree. I'm not a huge fan of Caesar dressing but this salad was so delicious, the lettuce was crisp and cold, the dressing was creamy and it had the perfect amount of Parmesan cheese on top. We really enjoyed our meal here. Zack came by to check on us, offereing us dessert before bringing the check. We were so full after the bread, appetizer, salad and entree we had to decline on the dessert but based on how wonderful the rest of the meal was, next time I will save room! 

Don't let the bad reviews keep you from eating here! It is a chain restaurant but if you've eaten at Romanos before you know what to expect and they definitely meet the expectations at this location. 

I give this restaurant 4 stars because it is a little on the pricy side, dinner for two with tip cost us around $56 but it was delicious and our service was great!

This is one of our favorite places to go in Reno for lunch when we're there. Our last experience there was lacking though. Service was pretty slow and the waiter never asked whether we wanted the soup or salad with our meal so we go neither. If James is working make sure you sit in his section because our experience at this Macaroni Grill has always been awesome when he's waited on us.

I've never eaten anything here I didn't love. The food is fantastic.
We ordered on uber eats and it was awful. They didn't send us our entire order, it was overpriced, and the food was terrible. 10/10 recommend finding somewhere else to eat.

Staff was nice, but the food was overpriced for what you get, the serving sizes were great but the presentation was pretty bad and all the food was soggy covered in what tasted like stewed tomatoes in can. Couldn't cut through my Eggplant Parmesan and the bottom was soaked in juice... appetizers were yummy though. I just feel like for the price it was a let down. Very nice and classy atmosphere though. They just need to step up the food a little bit. Even Olive Garden tastes way better.

Always a disappointment. Keep coming here because my dad used to like to eat here.
