But I've been coming in sporadically for the last year, trying something different each time and every time I'm more disappointed. This was the last straw. Ordered a steak cooked medium (in the hopes it might come med rare)  with veggies and potatoes. The steak is charged in one side, soggy on the under side and rare in the middle. Veggies are beyond over cooked and soggy. Potatoes were hit with a hot pan for color and undercooked. I have not eaten more than one bite of each. 20 min into dinner and I had to flag the waitress down for a refill on my iced tea. Does she ask why my dinner is in touched? Nope! My kid finishes her ravioli and I'm asked if I want a to-go box. No thank you. Then she notices. Service lacking and food to match. Manager comped the meal and offered to be our server and cook next time. Sorry, my time is Lee joys to me and I do t think I'm willing to give it another go. But I will spend it writing this review to save you all the disappointment.

I filled out the form like you asked and no response or credit for my missing food. Great customer service!!! Everyone should see how low your restaurant scores and hopefully they don't make the mistake I did and order from you. I'm going to tell all my friends, family, and social media followers about my experience and how you handled it afterwards.

I've always loved the Macaroni Grill and their food. My most recent experience there was extremely sub-par. I was grabbing food togo and the manager came up to me saying that because they were short staffed, "they were not really concerned with those things."  (Meaning to-go orders)
I understand Takeout orders might not be as important as guests dining in, but all customers should be treated the same if we are expected to return. 
Didn't enjoy my experience here and I felt I was a burden because I was picking up rather than dining in.

This is only my second time here. The food service took an hour and 10 minutes. When my food did get here my girlfriend didn't get hers so by the time I ate my food it was cold. Service manager Teresa took care of everything and apologized for their service tonight. Andrew at the bar was great and took good care of us. Due to the customer service by Andrew and Teresa, we will be return customers.
This is my second time at this location and it was really good.  I had Megan and she rocked.  So happy to see service to such a high level.  She was awesome and I will be back because of her.

Today I finally get to experience Romano's Macaroni Grill! And it was yummy-good! Our server was super sweet and nice; she made us feel very welcomed (Sam).
Usually when I feel like having pasta, Olive Garden was quickly my go-to, but this place is pretty different so I'll definitely come try this place again!

I went in this restaurant with my family of five I was in back of a party of two that was sat down immediately and then the host turned me and my family away and said we don't have any room for you he was very unprofessional and rude it's no wonder I never eat at this place do yourself and favor and skip that place to eat go to Cheesecake Factory or Olive Garden  they treated me and my family disgusting very unacceptable

I have went to the link that u asked me to go to

***avoid this place 0 stars*****

Ate here today ordered pasta salad and an appetizer. Our waitress was amazing her name is Katie she is very attentive kind and helpful.

Ordered pasta to go with Italian sausage the cook forgot the sausage then we asked for it to be added and the cook added the sausage on cold almost a frozen cold we complained and the manager was extremely rude explained they're busy. Busy and slow is one thing throwing cold sausages on a warm to go dish is unforgivable.

Manager needs to go she can't manage and has a very bad attitude. People behind us were complaining because of slow service etc.


The vibe in the place from workers was no one wanted to work there we watched the cook grab her stuff and run out.

Avoid this place not worth it!

The manager comped our entire meal and still I don't feel that was even good enough it was such a disappointment in so many ways.

Katie is the best thing at that place and I hooe they appreciate her! 

Do not waste your tome or money going here unless they get better help and an new manger

We were with a party of 11, five people got there food within 20 minutes the other people had to wait 30 additional minutes for the food to arrive and then 2 dinners had to go back as they were cold. After dinner was over we asked why there was such a delay, the waitress said sorry the tickets got mixed up and that happens sometimes, ok. We paid our bill including dessert for 6 of the people, when the manager asked how everything was we explained what happened her response was well you have already paid so I can't refund anything now, but I can give you dessert. Everyone that was eating dessert had already paid for their dessert. Horrible service horrible managers, would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
This was the worst dinner I've ever gotten from a restaurant. It was like all they did was pour tomato juice over some vegetables and spaghetti. Never going back here.

First off let me say , thank you for being open ! The night was perfect from the warm bread to our great service. Alex our server greeted us the minute we walked in and made us feel welcome the whole time. This 5 star review is for the service , don't  get me wrong the food is very good but Alex went above and beyond . Thank you and we will be back .
We have enjoyed every meal we've had at Macaroni Grill. Our servers are always great! Our most recent waiter Travis was wonderful.

If you like bland tasting & looking food with terrible service this is the place for you. We had a group of 13 adults with a week or 2 reservation at 3 PM on a Sat. (we were basically the only people there) so it wasn't like they were swamped, & they only had one server there to do everything. John our waiter tried his best, but with no staff to help him at all, our meal was served in different shifts, so everyone was eating at different times. I had the lamb shank & was the 1st to be served & it was Luke warm at best, & instead of mashed potato's, I got potato soup. No salt\pepper on our table because at one time supposedly some kid threw & broke 8 salt shakers, so I guess everyone must be punished. We had to wait for desert because they said they had to wash our dishes for our desert (which by the way was very good) for the 1 star. This is all because of bad management. When I tried to talk to them, they seamed very uncaring, but they did give me a 25% discount coupon for 1 entree lunch, WOW how generous of them. Now I know why they only get a over rated 2.5 star rating. I will never go back there.

We haven't ate at this restaurant in a while and thought we would give it a try. It was a very disappointing pick up order for sure. We were giving a meal with an oil cup that leaked all over the place because the lid wasn't secured properly. The Mushroom ravioli was over cooked and difficult to cut, not standard for sure. My wife's soup came in a child's to go cup and not near the portion you would get at the restaurant. The Mac and cheese balls were over cooked and burnt on some areas. I'm so disappointed in what I wanted to be a nice Italian meal.

Not a great experience. The food is mediocre, the service is maybe a 3 star but on a  night with only 7 table of people in a large restaurant the service should have been great. When waiters come to the table ask a question and star walking away before you have time to get the answer out it may be an indication that they know the food is not great and have no answers. Bread set RVers in an Italian restaurant with olive oii l and no Balsamic vinegar unless you walk down waiter and ask for it is different. Overall it just felt like an Italian food experience at a mall or airport Food court. Macaroni Grill used to be so much better.

Great food. Awful service. 
I came in at 6ish December 18th and sat in the bar area with Jayme. The host and food runner were polite but the server never checked in on us besides when she got our drinks and gave us the check. She forgot an order and our bread and never came back for a refill. Good food however not worth going to with the inadequate service and price.

What a great break from eating at home! I stopped here this afternoon in between (annoying & surprisingly crowded!) errands. I think there was only one server for the whole restaurant so the poor guy was running all afternoon, but I think everyone understands that most restaurants cannot afford to keep a full staff for a small customer base.  Food, as always, was wonderful! James was a great server. Thank you James.
If you are looking for yummy comfort food in a great location, I highly recommend Macaroni Grill!

Fine for what it is. A chain. Had very limited time, so chose this because we were already in the parking lot. Seated immediately. Kind and engaged waitress, Jennifer. Bread warm, a little overcooked, but rosemary flavor was nice.  Took longer than expected for a lunch order which was too bad. Thank goodness for the bread. Half order of butternut squash pasta with quite good if too rich. The calzone substitute was something I will not order again, not offensive though. My partner's soup and salad were definitely adequate. And bottomless.  No IPA. Overall a decent mass market American restaurant experience. Under $30

Took over 45 minutes to bring our food out. My boyfriend's pasta looked like it was under the heat lamp for a while it wasn't even that hot when it arrived. Asked for the steak to be well done and still had pink in the middle after a bite. They could have just brought my boyfriend's food when it was done and notified us that the steak was going to take a little longer. When we got our food my boyfriend and I had lost appetite from waiting so long. Plus not to mention there was no more than 6 tables being used with three serves and 2-3 cooks.

Meh experience and food. Something has changed about Romano's in the past couple of years and the food made me regret the visit.  

The spicy meatball appetizer arrived about 5 minutes after ordering and was in a bowl with some bland meatballs hiding under crushed tomatoes.  It was not spicy by any standard.  The entrees arrived 5 minutes after the appetizer.  The penne rustica was ok but the prosciutto was without flavor besides a little saltiness, a gray color like anchovies, and dry and chewy like beef jerky.  My wife gave her mama's trio a 5 of 10 with the chicken the best of the 3 choices.

The waitress visited 4 times: at the beginning to take the appetizer order, to take the entree and drink order, to ask about boxes at the end, and to leave the card receipt.

When the itemized bill left the table, it didn't come back.

No bread ever came.
The Brussels sprout sautéed perfectly, with the surprised sweet and salty twist. The amount of the vinegar fulfilled the taste buds, will definitely recommends.

Avoid this place......no customer service. Will not respond toy concerns. If they cared they would be responding to my correspondence. Food was mediocre at best and service was average at visit. But the the lack of response to my feedback is disconcerting!!!?

We just had lunch for 3 and it came to $78! My kid had lobster bisque and french fries. I had the mom's ricotta meatballs with spaghetti bolognese and a salad. And my husband had pasta milano with broccolini. And we ordered bruschetta for the whole family. My spaghetti was oily and had basically no meat sauce and the meatballs just tasted like oregano and nothing else. It was disgusting and inedible. My husband's pasta was flavorless. You could not taste garlic, cream, mushrooms or tomatoes. Again all you could taste was oregano! The pasta was very al dente and overall it was just Bland and disappointing. The broccolini were raw and had no seasoning on them whatsoever not even salt or butter or anyting! The only thing I actually liked was the bruschetta which I added a balsamic glaze to. The fries were fine nothing special, the lobster bisque was okay. Save your money there's way better food elsewhere! I've never had spaghetti that was inedible before.

We've had good meals here in the past. Tonight doing curbside was a disaster, which is a shame because so many other restaurants have gone out of their way to do a good job and be thankful to those who are keeping them open. Tonight, our calamari appetizer for which we were definitely charged was not included. When called about it the response was "oh we don't have any calamari". Ok, but why is it still on your menu? Why did you charge me for it? Why was there no explanation that it was not included? And why did I have to call back and ask what happened? Then my wife's vegetables were not included and she was given a caesar salad instead, which she can't eat because she is lactose intolerant. And then my build your own pasta did not have the bolognese sauce it was supposed to have nor any sauce for that matter. The explanation when I called back was that I could drive back 15 minutes to the restaurant to get sauce if I wanted. No thanks! I won't be back! You lost a good customer that you've had for 15 years. Poor product, poor service, poor handling of a disastrous experience.

This place has become mediocre at best. I cannot comment on the restaurant as we did delivery but the food did arrive hot. The chicken Alfredo had almost no sauce and the chicken was so dry we couldn't even eat half of it. The grilled pork chop had good flavor but the sauce was flavorless and the risotto was dry and over cooked. This used to be a great place on a Saturday night but now it just feels and taste like Italian "fast food." Sad really.

I've ordered takeout twice from here in the past few months. The first time I called, I placed my order with a woman. After I read my order, she asked if there'd be anything else, I said it would be all, then she hung up on me. Hmm.. weird, I thought. So I go in to pick up my order, which (my fault) I didn't double check, and come home to find multiple items missing. I call back to make sure I wasn't charged, since I didn't receive an itemized receipt, and the same lady answers. "Okay well I didn't hear you," she says after I explained the situation, and hangs up on me...AGAIN. Thankfully I wasn't charged. So, I figure, she had a bad night, whatever. 

So then last night, I decide to order takeout again. I recognize the woman's voice immediately, so I go ahead and place my order, once again she gives me the total, I say okay, she hangs up on me without reading back the order or telling me how long it'll be. So I call back asking how long it'll be, "I don't know, 20 minutes?" HANGS UP. At this point I'm wondering if I even go pick up the food, but I think to myself whatever, the Mac is good. So I go down to pick up my food, and a woman brings it out to me. Low and behold, it's the same woman that on the phone, AND she's the manager! I felt less crazy after reading the other reviews, it seems her attitude and knack for being unprofessional is a normal thing. Good pasta, doesn't make up for the bad service.
Miss these restaurants on the east coast! Had a great meal and enjoyed the food again! Thanks!

Best dinner we had since we have been intown this week . From The rosemary bread and olive oil, to the best chicken parmigiana I have had in a really long time and we ended with chocolate chip cannolis. Kudos to Travis our food server that tied it all together and made it a great evening!
My 1st time coming here. Not great. Don't think I'll be back. Slow service, food was just ok.

My husband and I had to provide a family dinner for 18 people yesterday.  We are between houses and staying in an AirB&B, so we decided to have the meal catered.  This was an amazing and wonderful experience!  I ordered the catering online (https://macaronigrillcatering.olo.com/) but then was able to call and speak to the manager a few hours later to confirm everything.  The food was ready when we arrived to pick it up, all packed in a sturdy box for transport.  The salads were cold as they should be, and the entrees were hot!  The food was delicious and got rave reviews from everyone.  The staff at this Macaroni Grill are exceptional.  Thank you!!

I got take out here the other day and was helped by Jaclynn who was really busy and still managed to help me in good time. The food was great and I appreciated Jaclynn's hospitality. Will be back for sure

I normally wouldn't review a chain, but after returning to this concept after years it's wild to me that there's enough of a following to keep this place going. We came in on Memorial Day to a dead restaurant, which was surprising. 

Our service was exceptional, but the food was forgettable and overpriced. I ordered the spaghetti and house-made meatballs and the better half got some rigatoni dish with a cream sauce and chicken. The fresh bread that used to be good absolutely sucked, and the calamari was whatever. Had it not been for the gift card I'd have had no reason to come in, and I certainly have no reason to come back. Butternut squash ravioli for $21?! That's hilarious.

For the prices they're charging, you can get far better quality food from local establishments.

A chain Italian... yes 4 stars. I pretty much only get the Shrimp Portofino here, and its like $16 with tax. I like it, I crave it, I normally get it to-go. But the set up of ordering can be a PITA. They give you a time for when it is ready, you don't have a choice. I called at lunch one day, it was going to be over an hour before it was ready, umm no thanks. 

I will take this over Olive Garden any day though. 

Pro Tip: you can watch your order being made if you order it to-go at the restaurant, which is kind of fun.

A friend and myself decided to have an early dinner here about a week ago. The place was fairly empty on a Monday afternoon so we thought perfect, quick and easy service but no. Service was slow and the meal itself just wasn't good. Personally I ordered a create your own pasta with Alfredo sauce chicken and sausage while my friend had something very similar with chicken as well. Later on that same night we both had excruciating stomach pain which lasted another day. We called and told them this and they said sorry and that they'd do something special the next time we came in. Why would we return to a place that gave us possible food poisoning and all they could say is sorry?

My girlfriend and I used to love going to this Macaroni Grill. We hadn't been there in a year and it has definitely gone downhill. Last Sunday I decided to order the dish pictured (the mushroom ravioli) via Doordash. Ordering went fin, but when it arrived, it seemed a little light for a dish that might resemble the dish featured on their menu, especially one costing $21. I opened it up and I saw this monstrosity. Only a few pieces of ravioli, burnt to the point of being inedible with a dash of (also burnt) mushroom gravy. I immediately called up the restaurant and demanded an explanation. I was told that the General Manager cooked this particular dish and that I would be getting a refund in a week. 
Well, it's been a week. I called and was told it might be another couple of weeks before I get my refund because the folks in the corporate office are only occasionally in the main office anymore. I did get an offer for them to remake my order. No thanks. Fool me once . . . 
I will never be eating here again and I don't recommend anyone else do until they either hire new management or, at least, banish the GM from the kitchen. They clearly don't know how to cook or about appropriate portions

Update: even though they told me to contact them on their website, I did and have yet to get any sort of response whatsoever. I even called the restaurant again. No call back. Two weeks from the original incident. Still no refund.

I ordered Christmas dinner to be delivered at 4:00.  Order was over 30 minutes late and half the order was missing. Called the restaurant only to have a very rude lady tell me she could remake what was missing but I would have to pick it up. Nice customer service. I understand she is away from her family, but I have to leave mine during Christmas dinner to pickup what they forgot. Never again will I order from them. ZERO stars!!!!

To the manager or owner whoever reads this I love your restaurant it's absolutely fabulous but when there are customers in the restaurant trying to eat do not paint inside it was so nauseating I threw up my food and had to leave please be considerate towards customers and don't do this again thank you so much

I am giving this restaurant an excellent rating: because of our exceptional  meal service.  Solely: in our opinion because of our waiter:  Colyn, who
was attentive, in his close attention to details.  Gave us information about the menu, that in all these years, was our best dinner at RM Grill.  He made it very clear.  Our food was excellent!  He was so impressive and is one of they're main assets. Very sharp.....   {We did miss the fire roaring in the fireplace and the pizza oven burning away, which truly adds to the atmosphere of the whole dynamic.}  However, truly understand the possible financial overhead dilemma for restaurants going through all in the past couple of years.   We were looking for the G. Manager Torre'. Anyone know what happened to him?

We booked our company Christmas party here last Saturday, December 8th. Huge mistake. Our party was for 20 people. They had our table set up in a separate room with another group which was fine, plenty of room. The first mistake they made was allowing us to order direct from the menu. In our past experience at other restaurants, we have been given a limited menu which allows the kitchen a better opportunity to get everyone's food out in a timely manner. When we arrived our table was set up but had no menus on the table and no waters. Our waiter came over to take drink orders and everything seemed like it might start to be normal. He left with our drink orders and drinks slowly made their way to our table, still no waters or menus. Everyone immediately ordered a second drink because the first drink took so long. Finally, menus arrived...still no water and no one asked if we wanted water. I noticed that our waiter was basically by himself to handle our entire table. Again, at other restaurants, we are used to having 2 or 3 servers handle our large group. We ordered appetizers, again they slowly made their way to the table. We ordered our main courses. Entrees started to make their way to the table and it quickly became apparent that only half the table received their main course. The waiter came over and stated he messed up and lost half our orders, he took the orders a second time for those of us that did not receive any food. Again, these orders slowly made their way to the table and they were still missing 5 people. We sat down at 6pm it is now 8pm, two hours in a 5 people didn't have their food. The waiter and manager came over this time to ask once again what we were missing. 3 of the 5 ordered again, myself and one other guest decided not to re-order. I have worked in the food & beverage industry and have had many group gatherings at restaurants over the years and I have to say that Macaroni Grill was the least prepared to handle a group I have ever seen. When companies like ours plan these parties it is usually once a year and it is an important event to show our appreciation to our employees, to have it go so painfully wrong is not only upsetting but unacceptable for a restaurant like Macaroni Grill. One server assigned to our table, no menus on the table, no waters on the table, our guests having to go to the bar to get their own water and drinks, missing food orders, 2 hours into the party and guests still without food. This says to me very clearly that Macaroni Grill is improperly managed and they do not have a clue as to how to handle a group party. The manager ultimately took 25% off the bill and the waiter removed a couple of wines and coffee, none of which made the evening any less intolerable. As poorly as our group was handled they should be embarrassed that they charged us at all.

We went to Macaroni Grill in Seattle and we had an unpleasant experience. We figured we would give the one in Reno a shot and it was just as awful. Seems like it's Macaroni lost their customer service values. When I called to make the reservation the man who answered the phone was unenthusiastic you could tell he did not want to be there and did not want to help. When we got to the restaurant we were seated. Our server got to our table and nothing special she asked what we wanted to drink and if we were ready to order. We asked for some bread and she said that it wasn't ready. She then came back 10 minutes left and said someone beat her to the bread so she had to wait for more. We finally got out bread about 5 minutes after that. We ordered Fettuccine Alfredo with Shrimp and Buffalo Chicken Parmesan. It took quite some time to get our food. It wasn't busy or anything either. The food was okay. Definitely not a $20 plate, you can get similar options at Olive Garden that taste better and cost less. When we were done we gave the server our form of payment and she took and came back with it 10 minutes later. Which is a long time when someone has something as sensitive as a card. She came and said sorry for the wait and said that she forgot our boxes  because she ran into a friend who was giving her a hard time. We received our boxes and left. Honestly, I wouldn't go back. Menu isn't the same, taste is okay, and most importantly the service is terrible there.

We stopped in for dinner at around 5:40 pm on a Thursday night. We were relieved to see that most of the tables were empty so we assumed there'd be no wait.
NOPE!
The un-enthusiastic host stated the wait would be forty-five (!!) minutes because they were expecting two large parties.
I said, "oh. So they have reservations?"
Him: "no."
Okay so we went into the "bar" to regroup, and apparently said bar is not open despite two employees behind the bar doing SOMETHING all while desperately if not frenetically trying to avoid making eye contact with us.
What a miserable experience at a restaurant I USED TO enjoy a lot.
We took our business to an adorable little Italian spot called Pasta Fresca (6135 Lakeside Drive) where we were treated like valued guests, not annoying inconveniences. And the food is INCREDIBLE! (Review to follow!)

4.5 stars for this chain Italian restaurant. Sign up to be on their email list and they have many generous take-out and dine-in offers.

Large, clean restaurant making Covid standards easy to adhere to. The servers, though, need to walk far for their drinks and plate pick ups.

Large square rosemary bread given with EVOO. 

Got the chicken parmesan and it was thick and huge. Mild on the sauce, good on the melty cheese! All the tables took home leftovers!

This location does a lot of curb-side and to-go orders.

Super friendly and generous service.

I took my 14 year old daughter there the other day, Bailey was our server and she was awesome !!!! The child is picky and Bailey was super patient even though they were busy allowing her to ask questions and get answers. We definitely will be back!!!!!

We had not been out to a restaurant in some time, and decided to try Macaroni Grill. we were nervous, but our server, John, was the best. He told us what they were doing for our safety and was patient with us. I so appreciate that he was this attentive to us and made our first experience out a very enjoyable one. John is a true asset, an on-point, professional waiter. Bravo.

We liked this place because it is comfortable, decent service, consistent dishes and great ice tea. We also like the salads because they have lots of goodies in them. Except today, both our chicken salads arrived with no chicken, the chicken was brought out later  for us to mix in. The other ingredients were in such scant portions that we couldn't taste them and had to hunt to even see traces of them. Very boring salads, very disappointing. We complained to the  waitress who was apologetic and  went into great detail about training a new person in the kitchen. Not the customer's problem. 
Did not offer to take anything off the bill either. We left feeling cheated.

It has been a year since i went back to this place because of poor service. Tonight was beyond words. Our waitress Christina (tina) was one of the best i have had in a long time. From the minute she came over to our table she had us laughing, talking and just having a great time. She took her time with us snd treated us as though we had been friends for a long time. So refreshing, I will come back again and ask for her. Keep up the great service. You deserve a raise.

Food was good but there were greasy  finger prints on everything,  including my plate and my martini glasses.  Nice waitress,  but it's disgusting to have greasy finger prints on the glass I drink from and on my plate of food. 
Don't think we will be back.

We had eaten here years ago when it first opened and in a moment of weakness thought it would be a safe quick choice . It was a Tuesday night and maybe a 1/4 full if that . We waited a few minutes to be seated , that was ok . The hostess seated us , presented the menus mentioned some specials , all fine and normal . After a awhile a waiter showed up , not sure if it was his first night or he just sucked as a waiter . He fumbled through trying to sell us wine then needed to collect the glasses on the table and take them away all before taking our drink order . Later he came back took our drink and food order . After awhile he brought the drinks , super watery weak ice tea , said he'd be back with the bread . Later he brought the bread . Much later the bread was gone the weak tea was gone , no sign of the waiter or the food . I was fumbling in my wallet to leave some cash for the tea so we could go find some food somewhere else when the food came . The food was hot but unremarkable . Eventually, the waiter came by again , we had stacked all our dishes on the table and were ready to see if the hostess could get our check . He took the dishes and asked if we wanted dessert - we aren't young and don't want to waste the time we have left waiting,  we said no and asked for the check . He left and didn't bring the check but started serving the booth behind us . I heard a raised voice and turned to see an attractive young woman reading him the riot act "......to go box , unacceptable service , manager " . We started walking to the front to see if the hostess could help , he quickly brought our check . We stood while he ran our card . Another waiter asked if everything was ok , my husband said no the service sucked . That waiter wanted to get us a manager but we just wanted it to be over . We won't be back and I have such buyers remorse , wish we had just gone to Del Taco across the street.
My favorite Italian restaurant so far. Big portions, delicious(for my taste) food. Even My picky son enjoyed it. Very friendly ambient. Service was spot on.

I have been here before and it was good. Great experience.


Last night my family & I went out to eat, 
First we got served bread that tasted/ felt like it had been sitting out for 3 days.. next we ordered the spinach artichoke dip that was served cold..
We had the mushroom arancini crispy on the outside frozen in the middle...
I had ordered for my main meal mashed potatoes asparagus and broccolini, the only thing not cold was the asparagus... I'm extremely disappointed with this experience.  
The cheesecake even had a weird taste to it, somewhat of a  metal flavor... 
never going to this place again...
Tyla and Teresa were so awesome tonight, so nice and the food was super yummy! Will be returning!

Last night me and my wife ate there and the food was very bland, no taste. Wife ate the mama trio and I had the chicken parmesan . Sorry that's the second time we been there over a 10 year period. The only good thing about our experience was we had 2 mai tai's and they were great. Our waiters were great also. For $80.00 we can get way better food.

Having never been here before, my family decided to check this place out. We walked in at 7:15pm on a Thursday night and there were maybe 5 full tables in the whole place. After ordering we didn't get our food until 8:30. 
And between that the guy dropped off salads, and went away again. No words, no drink refills, nothing. 
After an hour and fifteen minutes of waiting for our food we finally got it. It was decent, but definitely not worth the wait. We then waited for him to come back and take our dessert order, which took another 30 minutes for "eh" dessert. But since it was my step grandma's b-day. her dessert was free, which was nice. 
During this 2 hour meal we were sitting on the worlds most uncomfortable chairs. Everyone's body ached after sitting in them for so long. 
Long story short, the wait is long. It's nice to linger when you're having dinner with family, but AFTER I eat! I was so hungry, and the wait was just terrible. There's no reason it should have taken so long on a quiet night. I'd hate to see it on the weekend!

I have always liked Macaroni Grill. I know COVID has taken a toll on the staffing, but the excuse is getting old. It took 10 minutes to get a hostess to take our name.  She told us it would be 10 minutes. Well, after 30 minutes we were seated. Our server was pleasant and quick to take our order. She was attentive.  She was good, especially since it was only her 2nd day working here. As you can see from the picture, the edge of the table was damaged. I wouldn't have mentioned it, but I  kept catching my sleeve on the jagged edge.

We've been a month away but the crew remembered us (haha we are hard to forget). I asked our waitress why the crowds were small with pandemic lifted. The food is great, prices in line, staff is exceptional (that crack got me a free bowl of soup!!!). She didn't know. She was thinking the same thing. Within minutes 20 people walked in the place. 

It's obviously not a secret. We all know it's huddled in with barnes and noble but I never see them jammed to capacity. Thank you. I hate to wait and this has been our best experience in Italian since coming to north Nevada!
06/01
Survey and review has been filled out at your website.  We will see what happens from here. Hopefully it gets better there.

I'm a fan of Macaroni Grill.  I frequented it more in my pre-Yelp days, mainly because I once had a credit card that would give me points and I would trade all of my points in on restaurant gift cards.  Conveniently located on South McCarran and South Virginia, there is plenty of parking.

My "go to" dish is Shrimp Portofino: sautéed jumbo shrimp, capellini, spinach, mushrooms, garlic, pine nuts, lemon butter  It is actually quite good and the bread that they serve is really good.  The service here is great - people are very friendly and they will keep loaves and loaves of bread coming if you ask.

I usually eat during the "off hours".  I eat dinner pretty early if it's going to be a large meal, so I have encountered the restaurant when there were a few patrons, but not when it was overly crowded.

Tip:  Regarding the Steak & Greens salad: 5 oz. sliced sirloin, baby kale, spinach, radicchio, arugula, crispy prosciutto, gorgonzola, crispy onions, balsamic herb dressing.  The balsamic herb dressing can be overbearing, I usually order it on the side.

Good chain type restaurant that modernizes and brings up the economy in Reno!

Very disappointed last night. We ordered the mama's trio. The chicken parmigiana was Burt through and through. It was a charcoal brick with some sauce on it.  They weren't that busy to not check before it went out of the kitchen

Greats to go food. Even made sure the packaging was secure with special labels and individual utensil and napkin packs. Thanks for keeping me safe! Just a hint, chicken Alfredo but with the Parmesan chicken instead of the roasted chicken... DELICIOUS!
Terrible service. Ordered artichokes and calamari which was very hard a bunched together a fried. Our Server waited on us and served others that came later, theirs first! First time and the last

While in town on Thanksgiving, we had underestimated the wait times at the casino buffets.  Around 6 PM on Thanksgiving Day driving down S. Virginia, we saw Macaroni Grill was open for business.  No wait and the restaurant was about 50% full.  Scored a table and ordered fried calamari, pizza, chicken marsala and several pastas.  Food was great but we did not receive the calamari appetizer.  Our waiter heard us mention this to another server and he jumped into action!  He found out another table was delivered the appetizer and they ate it!  By then, we were not as interested in the appetizer.  Our waiter took the appetizer off of our bill and then scored us two free desserts.  It was a cool gesture and really ended our dinner on an up note.   I had some hesitation in the past about going to a chain restaurant, but this really turned me around.

Not the Romano's Macaroni Grill that we used to come to?  It has changed over or the chef left.  We got seated and waited....Finally, another waiter noticed us and came over and asked if we had been helped?  Of course we hadn't!!  A waiter came over and asked if we were ready to order we said yes since we had been waiting quite some time!  We ordered an appetizer and our meals and drinks all at once.  No bread came, waiting for our appetizer, I finally asked our waiter if our appetizer was coming out?  He left and came back and said it would come out with our meal, if that was ok????  NO, it's called an appetizer.  Food comes out, meatballs are missing from the create your own pasta, we pointed it out, asked again for bread.  He brought the check and we weren't even done with our meals, he was quick for that!  I told him, please get our meatballs, reluctantly he brought back 4 meatballs in a side dish???  The food was not as I remembered and not as tasty.  The service was awful!  Unless you feel like asking for everything twice, don't bother going here.  I don't know what the problem was with this place???  Won't be going back for awhile.  Oh, the manager said I'll take care of the appetizer for you, no he didn't, the full price was on our bill.  For the money we paid it wasn't worth it.  REALLY DISAPPOINTED at the whole thing.

My family and I had Macaroni Grill yesterday for lunch. I highly recommend the chicken parmigiana. I substituted angel hair pasta with Alfredo instead of the spaghetti that normally comes with it, and it was fantastic. The calamari appetizer was cooked perfectly. The customer service was excellent, even though we got our food for carry out, there was no shortage of bread and dipping sauce. The manager on duty personally delivered the food to us and she herself made sure that we got everything we ordered before we left. I recommend macaroni grill on south Virginia to everyone. 7 out of 5 stars. We will be back.

My daughter and son stopped by for dinner and loved their waitress and dessert! They say that Tina, their waitress tried to fix the problems and very nice! My daughter's soup wasn't even hot and my son's pizza wasn't cooked or made correctly!  I guess they will go to Olive garden! They might go back for Tina!

Reno location-- poor ...It's not the food, it's the service and management.  Last time I went there on July 10, 2021, I walked in at 3:30pm -there was no hostess, just one female waiter. The place had two customers. The rest of the place empty like 50 open tables--yet she informed me it would be a 45 minute wait!! What? She said "we are understaffed and one of the chefs just quit!"   Ok I said then put a closed sign on the door and reopen when you get your S... together!  For a well known chain, this is just horrible management!

Me and my girlfriend came here for a romantic dinner and it was an okay experience.

Firstly, the server forgot to bring the soups out. I only got to ask where the soups were after she had placed the entrees down. She had mentioned to us that she was serving many tables. Maybe our server was in a bad mood or she was being overworked. However, my seating area was near the kitchen and I watched as servers either stood around or complained to each other. I got the vibe that no one working there wanted to be there or be bothered to give a good eating experience. 

Another example of the service was when I had asked the server if she could put my gift card code into the check. She said she would ask. After desert, when the check was given, she completely forgot to ask about the gift card. The matter was resolved but it does make me question if anyone working is paying attention. 

For the food, it was pretty tasty. The bread was good and I appreciated the olive oil and balsamic vinegar mix. For an appetizer, we ordered the caprese salad which was the nice ratio of tomato to mozzarella. For my entrée I ordered the Cafe Milano which was also yummy. The ingredients such as the mushrooms tasted fresh and the chicken was well seasoned. The tiramisu was really good  and I'd come back here only to eat that. 

I want to mention that you are paying for the ambience of the establishment. The food is marked up by a lot which I would not mind if it weren't for the sub par service and atmosphere as mentioned earlier. I do not recommend this place unless you are really craving an expensive tiramisu. If so, get it to-go.

My first time visiting the location but Not my first time at Macaroni Grill, I think Macaroni Grill use to be great but I understand now why so many of there locations have closed now. 

Wine...
I had a glass of the house red and it was not very good, there are many inexpensive wines that taste decent but this was definitely not it. I ordered the Italian Chianti for my second glass.  

Food...
Ordered the Pollo Caprice and was disappointed. First it was salty, the mozzarella was salty, the arugula salad (was very very small portion, about 1/4) was salty & the grilled chicken breast was not only salty but rubbery, it was obviously cooked from frozen and had fake grill marks. Definitely not worth $17, go through any drive through for a better piece of chicken for 25% the price!

Service...
Was quick and friendly, I only have positive comments for the service. 

My wife and I use to love Macaroni Grill and I wondered why I've seen so many locations shutting down, I was in Reno and saw this location was open and decided to stop in for a nice meal but was disappointed and feel like I was ripped-off in the process, so now I understand why there're going out of business, and why I'll no longer be a patron. 
I recommend going to Carrabba's Italian Grill instead!

Good chain food and giant portions.  Thats what makes it great for a birthday party and a large group.

Its pretty much like all the other Macaroni Grills I've been to across the country, but this one is in Reno.

Sup Everybody..,Soooo Yeah...Today's Experience at macaroni grill was...Meh! First we waited 15 mins to be seated when there was 3 tables open and no one else was waiting ok no biggie it happens..we get seated our waitress comes takes our drink order brings us bread so far all good right..she comes backs to takes our order all good once again everything is good....THEN....15 mins past..all we get is our refills..then our waitress comes back and asked me what I ordered? ...she said I just wanted to make sure..so I said Chicken paramsan..so at this point am think A she forgot what I ordered B she didn't take down my order considering she took my order first..what ever I let that go as well it happens they were busy..now 25 mins have gone no food yet...the table behind us party of 6 got sat after us a good 10 mins after us..got their food before us..now am starting to get irritated not cool..so a good 35-40 mins later we get our food and it's luke warm..at this point am done I don't even want to eat nor did my niece and sister in law..I took a few bites and I was done same with my niece and sister in law..now we are home and having Actual dinner...That's all folks
Nothing serious, just a super rude attitude infested wrist-tattooed manager with no regard for customers.

I was given a Gift Certificate to Romano's Macaroni Grill and decided to do take out. The whole experience was sort of a let down.... While the online ordering process was easy enough, when I arrived there was no marking or indication of where I needed to go to do my pickup and the whole process of waiting and paying for my pickup took over 10 minutes (I showed up a few minutes after their website said my order would of been ready). 

The food was also disappointing. I had ordered a pasta with creamy Alfredo Sauce and there was NO sauce on my dish at all - just oily noodles; which was a shame because the noddles and veggies were cooked well and I was thrilled with their create your own pasta idea! Moreover, the Caesar Salad was suppose to come with crotons and there was no crotons - a small thing, but the salad I got was a pile of lettuce with a weird tasting - super thick cream sauce, it was rather off-putting.  

I think that they need to work on their customer service and perfecting fine details e.g. getting orders correct - I would of been far less disappointed if my pasta would of had sauce on it!

With the other options in town for Italian Food, I most likely will not return.

First off let me say , thank you for being open ! The night was perfect from the warm bread to our great service. Alex our server greeted us the minute we walked in and made us feel welcome the whole time. This 5 star review is for the service , don't  get me wrong the food is very good but Alex went above and beyond . Thank you and we will be back .

Macaroni Grill lost our business because of the poor customer service from the manager on staff, which is sad because this restaurant was our go to for our date night.  Got an order to go and when I got home the alfredo sauce was completely dried up.  I called and asked to speak to the manager and when I spoke to her and told her how our order was she said well I spoke to the server and all I can do is give you a discount next time you are here because she said your order was good when you picked it up.  She told me don't you know that the sauce soaks in to the noodles, which for a to go order they should add extra then for their customer to have a good meal.  At that point I was really upset because I literally had to throw away the food that I just spent over $50 on and when I asked to speak to her manager she said I am the only manager.  I asked to have the regional manager call me and then proceeded to hang up on me.  Such poor customer service telling your customer they are lying not only once but twice.

My complaint drew a wonderful, gracious response from the general manager.  A good apology and a willingness to correct the problem means a lot. Everyone has a bad night. Thanks for being attentive to this customer.

I wish I would've read the overall rating before deciding to get take out. 
Just to get to the point. I ordered curbside and my calamari was cold, rubbery and most prices were BRICK hard. So I threw it away. I also order shrimp Alfredo.. and they didn't give me any utensils. 
I also REALLY like how a tip is included in the total price, unless you opt out. A TIP FOR WHAT? COVID has mad customer service even worse. What am I tipping for?! I paid $34 dollars for an entree and appetizer and it was BS! You also aren't serving me. I will not go back!

Granted that it's Thanksgiving, I understand that today's a pretty busy day for restaurants that are open. My family and I were missing mashed potatoes for our dinner so we decided to just pick some up. We googled what restaurants were open and decided to order from here. Since we were already on it, we were able to order through google but apparently that's not the preferred way to order considering the attitudes of the staff helping us when picking up. They demanded a name and when we said that our order only had a number and showed them the order, they said "who orders on google? nobody does that." and continued to ask for a name. After continued rude comments and cold attitudes (almost as if they thought we made up the order when we showed them our mobile orders), they finally gave us our order. We wanted to ask for some bread and butter but were so turned off by the staff that we just wanted to immediately leave. For first time customers, we could have definitely done without the rude service and will not expect to come back.

This has been one of our favorite restaurants for years. We have always sat in the bar area and enjoyed food and staff. We stopped by to try a meal after this horrible pandemic. The first disappointment was to see the entire bar area and outside seating is not available. The second disappointment was at the hostess stand. After standing there and being ignored for several minutes I believe it was a busser who came up to help. Being as we did not have reservations, he shook his head and tried to survey the restaurant. When asked what he was doing he replied trying to space tables and account for being short staffed, and then announced a 45 minute wait. No thanks. We all know how hard it is to run a restaurant in normal times and now it's harder. This ship needs a captain to run it efficiently or it will sink. Why would you not have the bar and the outside tables open? Obviously you needed space and to run efficiently.  Why book all available tables, you need to satisfy all customers. We have always just walked in, unless we book for a birthday party. The pandemic can't be blamed for poor planning. Get management on the floor running things.

Went for a late lunch. Husband ordered a salad. He didn't like the dressing that came with it but the portion was huge. I ordered the lobster bisque. The portion for this was small but tasted good. Their bread today was so good. We had 2. Their appetizers of Brussels sprouts is my favorite. Our waitress Katie was amazing!! Drinks never went empty and she checked on us often. One of the best service we've had.

I have had several experiences with this spot and none of them were this horrible but I don't think I will ever return. I had dinner there with friends and family to celebrate a birthday. We had a reservation at 7 for ten people and we were not sat until 7:30. They didn't seem super busy but I have worked in the industry before and I know that sometimes parties take longer than usual and things come up. Not a huge problem. HOWEVER, when we were seated we got our menus ordered a bottle of wine (that came out very promptly, thank goodness) and two appetizers: bruschetta and artichoke dip. We didn't get our appetizers until 8:19pm. After waiting forty minutes for our appetizers we were finally able to order our entrees which also took forever. I don't remember when we ended up leaving but it was way too late and after 9:15pm and several of us were not satisfied with our meals and didn't even eat them but at that point we just wanted to get out of the restaurant and never return. 
Throughout our meal there was a lot of apologizing and blaming the kitchen and the chefs but with all of that blame I was surprised that a manager didn't come check to see if everyone was okay. That wouldn't have helped the experience because I won't go back but usually if there is that much wrong with the kitchen someone will come out and apologize or comp an appetizer or SOMETHING. 

Anyway, long story short, the whole thing was really weird and way too long. The food is way too expensive and mediocre to justify the price and wait when you can just get some pasta roni for $1 at the grocery store.

I shall now make a list of things that the Macaroni Grill is not:
Little Italy
Worth the Money
Fine Dining
Enjoyable

I shall now make a list of things that the Macaroni Grill is:
A good place to wait too long to be seated
A place with friendly wait staff once seated
A place that offers good food albeit overpriced 
Boring and a prime example of what happens when a restaurant stops trying

We went to the Macaroni Grill about two weeks ago for lunch.  I hadn't been there for the better part of a decade.  The place was vacant.  Maybe 4 other tables were full.  We stood at the podium for a good three for four minutes before we were even greeted.  

Once greeted we were sat quickly and orders were taken.  The food was very good (especially the deep fried macaroni balls and the fry appetizer).  Drinks were never empty and our waiter never let us get to low on bread.  

They really are way too expensive now for what they are and that's the deal breaker.  When the Macaroni Grill first opened they offered something that Reno didn't have.  Reno has grown and new restaurants have far surpassed this chain.  They really need to either lower prices or close up shop.

I won't go back.  It was my last visit.  If I'm craving expensive Italian, I will go to a multitude of places that now call Reno home.  If I'm craving less than expensive Italian, I will go to The Olive Garden and bring my own crayons and paper for the table.

Had a lovely anniversary dinner here with my fiancé Saturday night. Perfect atmosphere, amazing food and great service! The chicken Marsala and grilled salmon was delicious! The manager Jaclynn was wonderful and so attentive. She made us feel so special on a special day for us. We will most definitely be back!
Wonderful atmosphere, social distancing in use. Great food. Had the cheese stuffed raviolis with butternut squash topping. Friends loved there cheesecake deserts. Our waitress Tina was fabulous!

Tyla is amazing! Made our first time such a great experience.the food was delicious! The lobster bisque. With a hit of Tabasco and salt n pepper. You have to try it! Tyla service is phenomenal. Recommend great wine! Her service as a whole was above and beyond. I'll be definitely be having her as my waitress next time.

My family has been eating at this Restaurant for at least 8 yrs and loved it up til the last time we ate there in January 2012. The portions were smaller, more expensive, and not satisfying like we are accustom to. We felt like we had gone to a different restaurant under new management. Service was ok and the food was luke warm to cold when served after 40 minutes. The focus here was lite and not service. This Restaurant will not be on our list of Lunch or Dinner in the future.
If I could give it zero stars I would give them zero stars. Walked in waited for about 10-15 minutes to just be told that they don't have enough people to serve us, so we were refused service.
My kids and I love to have date night at macaroni grill, friendly staff and management always makes our visit top notch! Peppadew peppers and chicken parmigiana are a must have for me!

What happened?  

It's been at least 5 years since I've eaten here, and while it was never my favorite it was decent to occasionally very good.  I only went back because it was a lunch date with my little sister and she picked it out (even though I suggested other places, she likes "italian" food and wanted to try this)

I realize everyone is cutting back these days, so I wasn't surprised to see they no longer had fresh cut flowers but other than that the interior was as I remembered it.  Still cozy and lovely with the dim lighting and spacious seating.  

The menu looked different from what I remembered, and they were featuring a promotional tapas for 2 menu.  1 tapa (appetizer) and 1 entree pp.  These were generally the cheaper menu items, but still a savings of $2-$6 pp if you were to order an app and entree each.  I think there was a selection of about 6 different items on each section.  They were out of the only entree that appealed to me and would not make a comparable substitution.  I wanted the chicken and mushroom cannelloni but ended up with a grilled chicken breast with angel hair pasta caprese.  My sister chose a creamy rigatoni dish with chicken.  We shared the goat cheese stuffed peppers and the zucchini fritto.  

The portions were large but the food was disgusting.  The zucchini fritto was paperthin slices of zucchini breaded and fried.  There were burned bits and other bits that were doughy and clumped together.  It lacked flavor and was greasy.  The peppers were interesting, tangy pickled peppers stuffed with cream cheese and heated then topped with fried bread crumbs and balsamic glaze drizzle.  I think they would have been much better served cold.  My sisters pasta was a giant bowl of rigatoni in a watery sauce and slices of chicken breast that look like the type of pressed chicken you get in school lunches.  Even with a lot of added parmesean cheese it was very bland.  My dish was a tough black charred chicken breast (again, tasted like formed chicken)  a glob of solidified angel hair pasta with a few cubes of mozzerella all melted together with wilted basil (I'm guessing my dish sat under a heater for a while).  The arugula salad it was served with was mostly spinach, again wilted with a dab of garlicky pesto.  I had literally two bites of food before I pushed my plate away. The chicken was dry and tough and tasted of salt and char, the pasta tasted of salt and old tomatoes.  I did enjoy the warm bread.  

Aside from terrible food, my final gripe is a petty one.  My sister ordered a peach lemonade and I ordered an "italian soda" which was soda water plus the same peach syrup in my sister's lemonade.  These beverages were listed together on the menu (no price listed so I assumed they were overpriced).  They were $3 each, but what annoyed me was that I asked for a refill and was told the soda did not have refills, but the lemonade did.  My soda came in a tall narrow glass packed with ice and could not have held more than 4 oz of liquid in all.  My sister's lemonade was a 20oz glass with about 1/4 full of ice.  I could understand if they opened a fresh bottle of pellegrino per soda, but this was just soda water from a soda gun so I don't see why it would cost more for refills?  Or why it wasn't listed separate from the free refill drinks like tea and lemonade?
This was my first time coming, the food was well prepared and nice and fresh. I was surprised at how good this restaurant is.

I'm not a big fan on chain restaurants but I have to say their 5 for $25 is an amazing deal. It really should be called $25 for 2 fat guys or 5 teen age girls for $25 .. Although the later is probably not appropriate for obvious reasons.

Two small loaves of bread, a heaping serving of Caesar (which was actually invented in Tijuana, but that's another story) and a big thing of pasta.. For $25? How can you go wrong?

My location in Reno uses Doordash and was here in less than 40 min. 

It's filling and enough for a leftover lunch the next day. 

Is the food 'authentic' Italian? No. Is it delicious? I thought so.

The deal is only valid Mon-Thur but your lazy butts should be cooking on the weekend during the pandemic anyway so no excuse.

And for you Karen idiots that reviewed this place during lock down I say.. 'Idiots have a way of getting what they deserve'.. I'm pretty sure Buddha would have said that had he known a Karen.

I went here for a late lunch with a friend there was one other table when we arrived. Our waitress was slow with everything from the condiments to responding to our questions. I worked in food service when I was younger and I get that its not the most glamorous job and requies long hours on your feet. However she was just abrupt and dismissive from the start. If you are out of a menu item fine make a suggestion or move on. Please do not go here it's not okay to pay for that kind of service. The food was fine but we did not finish it and packed up the meal after we were given all the materials and a bag this bothered my friend  because I guess they usually pack up your orders for you for me not a big deal. This place was her suggestion a favorite for her but I think she was upset by the experience we did not ask for the manger because we did want to argue  or complain we just wanted to enjoy a meal and catch up and she technically did her job just poorly. I give it two stars because the food was pretty good the service no thank you!!

Teresa and Alfredo were such a joy to be around tonight. Their service was phenomenal and we couldn't be happier with the wonderful conversations and food we shared tonight! I highly recommend coming here for a nice dinner! 
Request Teresa and Alfredo to wait your next meal!
I love this place, the food was great we came in for lunch and Troy is awesome as ever. Every time we dine In they treat us like family.

We love it soo much here the food is always  delicious and the food never disappoints. the manager Troy is always delightful and keeps us laughing we feel like we're at home. When my family and I come in they know the food/ drinks that we like. Also when you sign up you get a coupon every week so that also keeps us coming back

You don't deserve any stars!

I ordered the mamas trio, chicken parmesan, lasagna bolognese, fettuccine alfredo.

It came in one container all smashed up and since it was smashed in together, the alfredo sauce was mixed in with the red sauce from the parmesan chicken and lasagna. No alfredo sauce at all!!! Nor did I get any bread or utensils to eat with. Wtf do you think I would eat with my fingers???? Just because you're taking an order to be delivered don't assume that the place has a table etc, especially if you ask on your menu if we needed utensils, and bread to be included with the order. We also asked for extra alfredo sauce and red sauce. Who made this order??? 
For $35 plus delivery fee and tip. Reallyyy and all smashed together, your cooks and you don't care obviously about people who are not dinning in. Did it ever occur to you maybe someone just got out of the hospital and wanted, what they thought would be a good meal after eating hardly nothing in the hospital and we picked you out of many many restaurants to order from!! We were very wrong. Your cook and food preparer just put the food in like it was a trash can and mixed everything together to save you plastic containerd & to go ware. What kind of restaurant are you? None. Was the food good? NOOOOO, not even by taste. How could it be. It was shoved all smashed up in one container. 

Zero
I just drove across town to eat here and the restaurant is almost empty at 6:14 on this Monday evening.  They said it will be an hour wait because there are only 2 cooks in the kitchen.

While I can't complain about service. As we had very good service, and being Thanksgiving evening,  I felt a little badly for the people working. Food was ok, chicken scallopine was a little dry. But flavorful. Moms rigatoni tasted really sweet which didn't settle well for her. Calamari was forgotten and nephews pizza was late due to overcooking. When you really look at it,  this was the best alternative to not having reservations on Thanksgiving and coming from out of town with a large group. For that we're grateful. We left with full stomachs and happy that we were together for the holiday.

Terrible experience. Do not book a party or make a reservation at this Macaroni Grill. My daughter booked a college graduation  the party for her daughter and they gave the room away to another party that walked in off the street the day of the party.  Several people  had come in from across the country people to attend what was supposed to be a joyous occasion turned out to be sad and disappointing. They put at separate tables by the front door. The servers did their best to make it a good moment but management should be fired!

Wish there was a no star option. This "establishment" has the worst service in town.. it was maybe 1/3rd occupied and we had to wait 10 minutes for the hostess to show up just to tell us there is a waiting list. With only 2 names ahead of us on the list, we were assured we'd be seated in 10 minutes. Of course that became 25 minutes. The server couldn't have cared  less whether we were there or not. Our beverages arrived AFTER the entree. How this place stays open is a true mystery ..

Awful Service!
Went on a Saturday evening, sat at the bar to have drinks and two apps. Finished our first round of drinks took 15 minutes for the bartenders to ask if we needed another round (there were 5 people at the bar) ordered two appetizers and it took 40 minutes to bring one out and then be told that they were out of the other appetizer...will never go back this was the second chance at the restaurant.

7-22-2021 1:30 pm lunch.  Entrées and desert excellent, portions big, ambiance nice , service was great.  Parking lot was empty, we were not sure they were open.  Had eaten last month back at the Olli G - (you know where) at Legends, and we were very unimpressed.  By comparison,  Macaroni Grill hit it out of the park.  They even offered seconds on salad and focaccia bread, but the initial serving was plenty large enough.  Very pleased.

This place is on a level with Olive Garden or eastern TGIFridays in terms of menu, atmosphere, and quality. The prices are even in line with what you should expect from the Fridays/O.G. Big difference is here they give you crayons so you can doodle on the table while you wait on the next round. I don't doodle. I take colouring very seriously. Don't seat me without a minimum of five colours. Joking of course; I bring my own.

The wait staff is friendly and very efficient. They should crayon their name upside down on your butcher paper. If not, ask them to. It's different and fun.

The wine selection appears to be pretty decent, but I'm not really a wine guy. They see me coming and immediately pull the alcohol glasses from the table. They have a killer ice tea, however!

One disadvantage of aging is limited income. It makes dining out a challenge. The Macaroni Grill folks send us email coupons twice a week. Many times a BOGO. It's a great way to try different dishes and not pay full price. 

Personally, I think they have an exceptional Chicken Parm. The Spaghetti is great, too. The meatballs are a bit spicy so I don't order it very often. I absolutely refuse to come here and not split the Crispy Brussels Sprouts with Mrs. E. I think they add some secret concoction to make you crave them. A-D-D-I-C-T-I-N-G!!!!!! 

It's Italian and that means you're paying more. But they provide a gorgeous atmosphere and very hospitable people. John is one of the best and of course Troy, the big dawg whose name is on the door, is happy to meet you, anytime. 11/19

My husband and I have decided to have our lunch in this establishment, it's been quite awhile since last visited this restaurant.  The Maitre D welcomed us with swarm smiled and immediately seated us on a nice, cozy window booth.  The restaurant ambiance created a romantic old world feel.  Our friendly server Julian was accommodating and very thoroughly presented us their luncheon specials including their limited time, best flavors of the harvest season menus.  I have tried their Shrimp Portofino and my husband choose their Chicken Alfredo both were very tasty  we accompanied our meal with their raspberry ice tea.  The quick lunch was very refreshing and added more energy for our hectic afternoon errand.  Looking forward to visit them again this coming holiday when families and relatives comes to visit in town.

In 2002 when I was in high school I came here with my family and the service and food was the worst experience I had in my short life.  I hadn't been back due to my dad swearing he'd never go back and I followed suit.  Since then I have traveled and eaten all over this earth and experiencing MRE's that were better quality than the food.  Today 07/01/2020 a friend offered to buy me some food from here with some gift cards she had.  The food turned out about as good as it was in 2002 and I would still prefer a pork sausage and gravy MRE to the food at this restaurant if the food was free it would still be over priced.  I have had frozen chicken fries and expired beef jerky that was better than the steak they made.
Had high hope's and hungry for pasta, but alas it disappointed, mediocre dry pasta, weird tasting tomato basil soup but the kicker was this tiny dessert for 7.50

If you are looking  fir a good place to eat, go somewhere  else. The new manager is very rude and doesn't  know what she is talking  about. She should not even be working.  She tells lies to the customers and her employees.  This place  is heading  for there doors to close with her in it. I work in a preschool  I will tell ALL the family's  to go somewhere  else. You just lost most of Reno.

The restaurant was very slow, 2:00 in the afternoon. Only 3 table was occupied, and  still we, (8 of us) with reservation, had to to wait 18 minutes to be seated.
The food was coming out very late,  by 2 plates,  at the time and long wait in between. Grated cheese wasn't offered at all.
Very disappointing, since I thought they need business but not showing any appreciation.
The food was tasty though.

Had a wonderful dinner here this evening with family. Even though it was a little busy, we were greeted and seated within minutes for a party of 6. Other then plates being dropped on the floor around us and lighting being a little on the dark side; the service was pretty good...thanks Devin (server)! 

The chicken parmesan dish was really good although the angel hair spaghetti had a little spice to it which is due to the onion powder, black pepper and cayenne pepper. If your not in to spice then you may want to substitute this with something else. 

On the drink venue, the pomegranate and rasberry ice tea was really good but I will skip the black berry ice tea next time due to it's lack in flavor. 

And last but not least, the New York cheese was amazing in taste but the slice size was surprisingly a little on the small side in comparison to our dinner portion size but that slice didn't stand a chance :) The tiramisu was also amazing in taste and it's portion size was impressive compared to it's cheesecake neighbor... I've tasted quite a few of these cakes and this one is by far on of the best... Until next time...

Denise went out of her way for our Aspie. The food is pipping hot and fresh. I missed this place because I used to go in the Bay Area.

We went on Wednesday and Saturday for a double birthday bash before the rush. There was no wait time and I love the ambiance.

After weeks of waiting I did get a credit for my meal. Unexpectedly they gave me a FULL refund. I was only expecting half the money for the food that was missing. Thanks. The management stepped up and did a good job. Hopefully this error doesn't happen again.

Thank you for accommodating our party of 12 last minute! Our waitress Tyla was wonderful. Despite being understaffed (and the restaurant was practically empty on a Saturday night, which was eerie), food was mostly served in a timely manner.

My husband and I have eaten here twice. We Love the food!!!! You walk in and it smells amazing. Food and service is great! Both times I'm amazed at the price!! Compared to olive grader this place is a no brainier!

After a 6 hour flight from Chicago, Colyn has shown exceptional customer service skills. He was an absolute delight and treat. He was informative about my vegetarian tomato bisque, and everything else the table has ordered. I am blown away by his kindness and care towards his customers. Amazing, recommend this place 10/10. 
If you are lucky enough to get him as a server, then treat him the same way he treats you. 
Thank you so much 
#firsttimeinreno #colynisthebest

The food was great there are so many great options with the build your own pasta. Also pass me more of that fresh bread with the olive oil.

Don't sleep on the chocolate cake, there is no better way to finish off an amazing dinner.

This place could only be 5 stars with the help of Teresa and Tyla! Yes of course the food was great but Teresa sat us down and made us feel like old friends right away. Made our dining experience top notch! Tyla was the best server I think I've ever encountered in Reno! She was so patient with my questions and gave great imput on her favorite dishes. She was quick and so friendly and even though she had a mask on I could tell she was smiling. My night was made, food was delicious, and I felt as if I made new friends! Definitely definitely will return!!

I went to Macaroni Grill at about one-o'clock. The place was not busy at all. Our waitress  Jayme , helped us with all of our questions. We had a BOGO coupon for the three-course lunch. She gladly accepted our coupon and then we placed our order. I ordered the sausage and pepper rigatoni and my daughter ordered the fettuccini gorgonzola. The bread was delivered promptly and was delicious and warm. The waitress  made us the olive oil and pepper dip which was delicious as well. Our first course was a mozzarella frita with marinara sauce. The cheese was warm and crunchy. The next course was a Caesar salad with croutons and cheese. The salad was very delicious as well. Next came our main course. The rigatoni was better than the fettuccini, but both were delicious. The service was fast, they accepted all our coupons, and the food was delicious and in big servings. I would recommend coming here and trying the three-course lunch!

A group of us came in last night to celebrate my wife's birthday. Our waitress Christina was wounderful. She gave us a great experience. There was a delay in the kitchen, but she was on top of everything. I would recommend her section, she has a welcoming personality. The food was delicious and we enjoyed the happy hour at the bar.

Saul our server - great job - ran us through the specials - was informed on the wine list. Split a Caesar with no complaints ( you know sometimes servers roll their eyes ).
Order a simple Tormaresca Puglia for dinner a fruity white wine - perfect slightly chilled but not served in an ice bucket.
Entree was a shrimp portofino - light sauce, pine nuts with little button mushrooms and shredded Parmesan. Delicious shared by two and a Tiramisu for dessert , sorry it was empty, but our service was fantastic!!
We will return!

We had delivery from here and was not really impressed. The negatives were the fact that the dinners did not come with salad or bread. Average pricing for dinner is about $20 per person and just includes main course. We also ordered caprese salad which was good but only came with 3 small sliced tomatoes. Chicken parm was good but nothing really special. Too many other good Italian restaurants in Reno and probably would not eat here again.

I love their food here. The indoor service is great and the curbside has thrown me a few curve balls but still has been great. I will say that there were a couple of things that have gone wrong and it wasn't me being a Karen it was actual things that went wrong but both times they apologized profusely. One of the times they actually called me and I hadn't even really complained that they called and apologized like crazy. So this is what I think. We are in 2021 and right now people just prefer to throw each other under the bus and walk away and think as long as they blamed it on somebody else that it's going to be all right. They don't do that here. They fix it. And like I said I wasn't being at Karen and trying to get them to do something that wasn't correct or anything. I actually left and just was accepting things the way they were both times but they made them right without me complaining

THAT is the kind of business that I appreciate and will continue to solicit

I'm kind of surprised at all the bad reviews here. We went last Friday night, and it was not very crowded. I would guess that has something to do with the bad reviews?  The service that we received was top-notch , warm bread right away to go with the house red wine. I love the fact that they leave the bottle on your table and you drink on the honor system. We ordered an appetizer which came quickly along with more bread. To be fair yes it is a chain restaurant and the food was fair not amazing but everything tasted great and was served hot. We gave Mitch over 20% gratuity because the service was so good and he seemed happy to be at work. The tiramisu for dessert was a huge portion and tasted great.

Absolutely love their mozzarella sticks I go there just for that LOL I went there recently for outdoor dining and it was really nice the server was amazing food was served hot and it was nice to have a little bit of normalcy in our crazy world right now

Came for a 50th birthday party on Saturday evening. This place used to be great!  Had high expectations for this place, how ever those went out the window. 
We came in at 630, they said the bread was not ready yet. How is there no bread ready at 630 on a Saturday night?  The bread came out after my meal arrived. The people bringing the meals out looked less than happy to be working that night. 

It took forever to get salads out to our table. I had to ask for fresh ground pepper and parmesan cheese.  I asked for a second salad it took 20 minutes to get a salad? The waitress said they were behind. 

The cheese was not even fresh grated, she brought a plastic container out with cheese that looked like it was pre packaged.  The waitress said I guess this is how we are doing it.  They used to grate fresh Parmesan cheese for your meal. 

When my spaghetti came out it was lukewarm not even hot.  The meatballs were ok, but lukewarm inside. 
My wife's pasta arrabbiata sauce I could have feed to my 18 month old daughter no flavor or spice whatsoever. 
Then on to the chocolate cake. It used to be so good here! Wrong! It was dry and cold. 

Our waitress was great, but you could tell the place was severely short staffed.  It was hard to get water filled and ask for cheese and pepper on my pasta.  

We will not return again and the 8 people with us agree it was a bad experience.

I have had pretty good experiences here. I love the bread they bring you at the beginning of the meal. Mmmmm it trumps Olive Gardens breadsticks completely!
Personally I like to do the "Create your own pasta" option. I feel like I am pretty damn good and putting flavors together, and basically I just know what I like. But if I don't get this I go for the pasta milano, which is quite tasty.
My friends and I have used this place for group meals a lot and it works out very well for that. Everyone can munch on bread and sip on a drink while waiting for the others to join.

I had the most lovely time at the Macaroni Grill because of our wonderful server he was a tall young gentlemen with blonde hair. However it was obvious to me that the older female manager named Trena was terrible toward her employees and guests, I have never seen such terrible management! Although I thought it was a pleasant time due to our service, the management will never make me come back ever again! The gentlemen in the suit walks around like he owns the place aswell! Terrible!
