Made some last-minute reservations to eat here with my wife. We like a Friday night date with the kids off skating. We had Purchased the gift card for Costco so it's like having a 20% discount. Macaroni Grill is a bit expensive, however the food quality has a high standard. 

When we arrived, it was kind of strange because the place was deserted. The waitress/hostess that greeted us was very friendly and sat us immediately. She was friendly and professional. The only concern I have is that she wore an extreme amount of perfume. It made me gag when she came by the table to ask us for drinks. Also, when she brought the bread and olive oil, the bottom of the bread was rockhard. The top was soft however we could not cut through the bottom without a saw. Our server care of this immediately. It was kind of hard to taste the bread with the perfume wafting around us. 

The price has definitely increased as the bottle of wine was quoted at $48. I remember just before Covid being here and the bottle is $32. So I asked for a wine list. She said they did not have one but she knew everything about the wines. Luckily I had an old picture of the wine menu and showed it to her. She went to check the prices and then quoted me $38 for a bottle and apologized. It is somewhat difficult to not have the ability to look at the list of wines and their prices. Especially when you were quoted $16 more than the last time you visited.

What we ordered:

Drinks: went with a bottle of wine. My wife likes sweeter wines so I ordered a bottle of Reisling (Chateau St. Michelle) 

Lamb Shank 
Steak and mash
Grilled asparagus 

The food is extremely good. The lamb shank pulled apart with a fork. The steak was cooked perfectly and had a great flavor. My wife really loved the style of mashed potatoes. For a side of asparagus, it seemed a bit small. But it was definitely cooked nicely.

I do hope the waitress reads this review and adjust her perfume. With a sidenote, if you wear the same perfume over and over, sometimes you get desensitized to the smell and you have to apply more so you can smell it. Overtime this builds up and the result is suffocating for others. 

Other than this, it was a nice visit and we will return.

We don't eat at a lot of chain restaurants, but we were dropping the truck off at Best Buy for an install, and Romano's is in the same parking lot so...
Seating was plentiful and spaced out well. Our server was really friendly and suggested the current wine special which was a bottle of cab for $10! Okay, it was a deal we couldn't pass up and the wine was actually pretty decent. 
A kind of ciabatta bread with balsamic and olive oil was brought to us and we tore up pieces to enjoy. Soft, tasty and went nice with the dipping oil and vinegar. 
We ordered Mac n cheese balls and bruschetta to share as a starter. We enjoyed both but I particularly enjoyed the bruschetta. A bowl of sauced chopped tomatoes to dump on some really soft delicious slices of baguette. Yum. Mac n cheese bites were good as well with a nice crunchy exterior.
My wife and I shared the shrimp portofino and both the shrimp and pasta was cooked well. My son ordered calamari and it had a nice light crisp and was a good portion for being a starter dish. All in all, we really enjoyed our visit!

Tried going here today. Looked up hours and updated information in multiple areas on the web and all give hours indicating theirs open. Drive from Fernley and there's essentially no cars in the parking lot. Tried calling to no avail. The answering system offers take out or reservations and no one answered that either. Finally went in and it's empty aside from two staff who say they open at 4pm. Would have been nice for a more upper scale restaurant to update their online information or voice recorded message indicating they don't open until 4pm. Brewery next door is popping.

I wanted to take the opportunity to thank Troy Crisco and the good folks at Romano's Macaroni Grill. They did their level best to deliver a quality product this past year of pandemic. 

Quarantine carry out only, reduced seating and delivery shortages are just a few of the many challenges they had to overcome. But they managed and are walking tall as a result. 

A great menu, a beautiful atmosphere and a fabulous support staff that takes care of all our needs! Hell, you can even learn a little Italian speak while you wash up! I just wish we lived closer so we could visit more often. 04/21

Went in during a weekday right after the lunch hour (about 2p) The place had about 3 tables occupied by customers. We were told it would be a 15min wait. Puzzled at why the wait if there was barely anyone in the restaurant we started calling around to other restaurants to check their wait time. The hostess heard us and offered us complimentary drinks while we waited (that was nice) We were finally seated and the waiter informed us that they were short staffed and that he had to give his cooks some time to catch up. Fine. We ordered fettuccini with creamy garlic sauce and the butternut squash tortellacci dish. My fettuccine was ok. Sauce was a bit too thick and clumpy, under seasoned, and it was room temperature.  The tortellacci dish and it was not good. As you can tell by the picture, it looked like the dish was cooked in a pound of butter. It was greasy. The butternut was undercooked and it lacked salt. We were starving so we were really looking forward to eating these tasty dishes that we had there a few months back. We were very disappointed this time around. I shared with the waiter our disappointment with the butternut dish and he took it off the tab even though my husband ate half of it (he was very hungry). We appreciated the waiters willingness to listen and try to make things right but we will not be returning to this place.

Called to make a reservation and ended up being kept on hold for so long I eventually just hung up. Decided to just walk in and was able to be seated. Took almost an hour to get our food (three meals). Two of the meals (both pasta Milano) had almost NO chicken, both dishes were about 98% pasta, 1 percent mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes, and 1 percent chicken. Almost $80 for three meals and one appetizer. Really disappointing. We are trying to support restaurants during the pandemic but won't be back here anytime soon

cute ambience that would be great for date night or even girl's night. i went for a small birthday dinner for a girlfriend, we ordered several plates & shared. sadly i don't remember many of the plates but the only thing that stood out in taste was the crab noodles, they were great. everything else didn't really catch my attention on taste besides the broccolini (spelling?) being salty. the cocktails were great & we ordered plenty of hot sake to enjoy our evening. the main reason why I am giving it 3 stars is because the menu is a little pricey (location is downtown nashville off 3rd) & nothing spectacular stood out for it being a new spot in nashville.

I've been for both lunch and dinner and The Green Pheasant was exceptional both times. The interior decor of the restaurant is really well done with a unique, modern vibe. The food was excellent. Loved the udon noodles with pork and an egg for lunch as well as the mushrooms and the salmon for dinner!

Lets start with the pros : valet parking, cute atmosphere, server very attentive. Perhaps I went on a off day . Lets go, the pheasant dumplings and chicken k ( I forgot the name ) had absolutely no flavor their was no salt on table which made it harder to rehabilitate, ordered the spicy crab noodle first order came out cold ,informed server who was very apologetic, no problem stuff happens. Second order arrived hot but no flavor or spice asked for spicy oil and that made it palatable.

Exceeded my expectations. Bring a small group son you can sample the most. I tried so many things it was all great: tebasaki goyza (stuffed chicken wing), sui goyza (steamed dumplings), chahan (fried rice with egg), spice crab noodles (watch out they are spicy), and a pancake thing that I couldn't  find on the online menu to try to remember what it was. The Ambience was trendy and cool. I really enjoyed it.

We were pretty disappointed in this meal. The staff was friendly but unhelpful in trying to pick dishes to fit our tastes. Though I'm not sure it would have helped. We tried 6 dishes. The first was basically cold potato salad, pretty much the same as I could pick up at Kroger. The dumplings were bland and flavorless, the curry udon was basically a bowl of mush, and while the trout was good, it could have been trout from any southern restaurant and didn't ring of Japanese flavors at all. The only dish that we enjoyed that had the expected flavoring was the Broccolini with rock shrimp, which was pretty good. 1 for 6 isn't great.

The drinks were fine but not particularly special at 14 bucks each. The waitress described the atmosphere as a neighborhood Japanese pub but it's just another upscale dining establishment in a town full of them. The ambience or atmosphere is the same as any other in town.

Overall, it was not a terrible meal, but not really a good meal either. Just kind of a dud (and an expensive dud at that) in a town full of much better restaurants. We probably wont return.

I work in the neighborhood and have had the opportunity to stop by the Green Pheasant 3x for dinner and 2x for lunch since it opened a few weeks ago.  These guys are hitting on all cylinders right out of the gate.  I had the Tomago (Japanese egg salad, yes the eggs are FedEx'd from Japan) for lunch one day and Hambuga (hamburger) the next.  These would both appeal to someone who has never had Japanese food to the most serious Japanese food fan.  One of my co-workers had the karate (fried chicken) and it too was incredible.

Dinner, the Waloo, A5 Waygu, and King Salmon are my favorites so far. 

I will be back again and again and again.
Terrific Japanese cuisine with great service. Lovely ambience in super location. Excellent value too. Will upgrade to 5 upon next visit I'm sure, couldn't stay long this visit.

Positives: Different menu, not southern or american food, great atmosphere, good happy hour special, a few good dishes, great sake

Negatives: Average service, high prices, food is not consistent

We went to The Green Pheasant for the first time on January 5. We knew we were in for a treat when we heard the Two Ten Jack was branching out to a new restaurant concept, and boy, were we not disappointed! I personally think that we were so excited that we ordered too much food, but it was worth it. We ordered a wide variety of foods from their rotating menu and loved every one! In particular, we ordered a selection of raw fish on a bed of sushi rice first. This was the most expensive item we ordered, but it was worth it! Next, we ordered the dandan shishito, the friend rice, the shrimp and asparagus, and the stuffed friend chicken. Everything was phenomenal.  This is definitely a pricey meal - we spent $100 without buying drinks, but it was well worth it for a fancy night out.
Great portion size for shared plates. Wonderful atmosphere to go along with it. Flavorful food paired with good service

Dinner at Green Pheasant.  Both enjoyed our meal.  I had sui gyoza and shumai (small plates).  My wife had the whole wok fried trout.  The food was well prepared and good presentation.  Liked both of my dishes and the trout was firm but not overcooked.  My wife felt that it needed more flavor and asked for salt which helped.  The trout dish needs some type of side sauce (hate to say tartar but perhaps an Asian version with wasabi/ginger) to dip. Would return.  Menu is a little confusing and does not describe certain dishes as "small plate" but the menu is arranged from low to high price with about $19 being the dividing line.  The server explained this.  

Could not find the $5 parking lot.  Valet parked for $11 and $4 tip.  Call ahead to get directions to the parking lot that the restaurant will pay for part of cost.

This place is great - a bit pricey- but well worth it. Everything we tried was amazing. We tried fried oysters, tuna tartare, gyoza, shumai, wagyu and toki highball drink. It was all amazing! Great atmosphere, great food.

We ordered the Chahan fried rice, spicy crab noodles, fried trout, and the chicken wing dumplings. The wings were amazing and must-try if you like wings. Fried rice is a little on the salty side but was very satisfying. Spicy crab noodles had really good noodle texture. Fried trout came with steamed bun but to be honest the fish was a little bland by itself and the combo of bun and cole slaw with fish was a little strange to our tastes. Bill came to 140 after tips so a little pricy, but it's a nice place to try Asian fusion food in SoBro.

The Green Pheasant came highly recommended by some colleagues, so I made a point to visit. I sat at the large wrap around bar and ordered the Dan Dan Shishitos (spicy!) as well as the Broccolini with shrimp and cornbread. Both dishes were packed with flavor and enough food for a night for me. I was so tempted by the jidori chicken and salmon, so I'll have to go back to try those!

we were pleasing pleased with the Green Pheasant.  good restaurant design. interesting menu.   its a dining experience. shared plates allow you to navigate the many wonderful plates.  Kinoko-mushrooms,  chahan-fried rice, curry udon-noodles  , chirashi-sushi, pheasant dumpling, tsukemono cucumber and wagyu.   absolutely try as many as you can, because its delicious.  parking next door ..........
Devine!  The atmosphere and decor is exceptionally gorgeous. The food we ordered was just as beautiful, interesting, and tasty.

Very disappointing.  We went there for our anniversary and left early.  We were not impressed with anything we ordered.  Very mundane:( . We left and went to re-eat dinner for half the price and enjoyed it a lot more.

Decided to come to try this newly opened restaurant with friends when saw it on instagram the first time. We came in with reservation on pre-Thanksgiving night and there were many people. They have valet parking, and you can also park at the garage nearby and get validated from the front desk. The inside is cute! Our wine is awesome, I really like the cute glass. We ordered a bunch of food just because we'd love to try everything that sounds delicious. The broccoli appetizer is delicious. Was really surprised to find Japanese A5 wagyu in Nashville the first time. It's quite oily and tasty with medium-rare. 6 oz is a good portion for share. The biggest win I would say is the curry udon, so so amazingly good, simple looking but awesome. Love the sausage in the fried rice! The shishito peppers are great with pork! End up having no room for dessert lol. Overall, there's one thing that's a little bothering, every dish is too salty for us. Our waiter explained that it's their first time cooking Asian meals and they did not know if soy sauce is being used, no more salt is needed, and said they will improve next time. Except for that, everything is awesome.

We had an amazing holiday dinner for my company here. The food was amazing, but what sets the Green Pheasant apart is the vibe, the service and the cool places to hang throughout the evening. Their bar was great and the private dining rooms accommodate a variety of meeting/dining needs.

A wonderful experience all around. The quality and execution of both food and drink was excellent and the interior is absolutely lovely. The wait staff felt a little green (no pun intended) but were friendly and professional. My table enjoyed sampling the entire cold menu and several of the hot menu items. Everything ranged from good to fantastic, which is a difficult feat to achieve. If you are looking for a contemporary izakaya experience in Nashville, I highly recommend The Green Pheasant above all of the other similar restaurant concepts that have popped up in town.
The food was amazing! Highly recommend the Lobster and Corn Dumplings, Spicy Crab Noodle, and the Ni-San cocktail.

I enjoyed my dining experience here. I will say, it's a bit pretentious inside, but the wait staff and bartenders were friendly and our meal was good. I went with 2 other people and we ordered 7 things to split so we were able to get a good sampling of the menu. I'd highly encourage sharing here. I will be back for my favorites (below) for sure. Of note, their bathroom had a bidet and heated toilet seats! #fancy

-ikinari steak - amazing! I would come back here just for this
-Dan Dan shishitos 
-Okonomiyaki - very tasty
-sunomono - for the fish lovers (very fresh)
-mochi - not nearly as chewy as others I have had; I could tell they were much better quality and the flavors were pronounced
-The Japanese-Japanese drink was so good! I would definitely recommend that as well. 

Whatever you do, do not order the ohitashi. It was a veggie dish that tasted fishy. Non of us liked it. Also, the sui gyoza are very bland and not worth it.

My husband and I went to The Green Pheasant for dinner before attending the symphony this past Saturday, and we were both impressed! 

We had a reservation and were seated in the upstairs area of the restaurant after we walked in. Our waitress was LOVELY. She walked us through pretty much the whole menu as well as explaining some of the drink options as well. 

I started with a sake that the restaurant had on tap, which was wonderful. my husband tried one of their cocktails and then stuck with his favorite Manhattan after that. 

We started with the okonomiyaki (a Japanese pancake, at Green Pheasant made with ham, bacon, scallops, potatoes, and various traditional okonomi toppings). It was good, but not my favorite thing we ate. Next we tried the shumai (at Green Pheasant, made with lobster and spot prawn - and served with clover ponzu) - these were okay, but definitely my least favorite thing we ordered (they had a slightly strange flavor to me, but that may be because I'm so used to shumai made with shrimp only). 

Next we had the spicy crab noodles (with crab butter, sweet red crab, and tobanjan), which were very good. Lots of crab on the dish, and it was just the right amount of heat! 

But the Ikinari steak was my favorite of the appetizers or entrees we ordered! The steak was American skirt steak with corn and onion and miso brown butter and j sauce, served in a hot hot hot sizzle plate like is traditional at the Japanese steak restaurant chain Ikinari (picture a fajita platter at a Tex Mex restaurant). The steak was great (perfectly cooked); the corn and onions were charred where they had touched the hot sizzle plate; and the miso brown butter was just the right richness for the steak. I'd come back to Green Pheasant just to eat this again. A great dish.

But we didn't stop there. We ordered two of the desserts as well. I ordered the ginger creme brulee which was SENSATIONAL (I might be back at Green Pheasant again soon - I want to sit at the bar, order some sake or shochu, and eat the Ikinari steak and the ginger creme brulee. Quite simply one of the best desserts I've had recently. The ginger flavor was amazing, and the creme brulee was so smooth. I LOVED IT. My husband has about 10x the sweet tooth I do and he ordered the tempura fried slice of chocolate cake. I tried a teeny tiny bite, and it's just WAAAAAAY too rich and sweet for me, but he enjoyed it (definitely for people who love sweet, rich desserts only). 

We had a couple more drinks (including a shochu cocktail that was DELICIOUS). The service was excellent, and the restaurant pretty nice (I do think sitting downstairs is probably nicer, because upstairs is pretty sparse compared to the decor on the main level). We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. I think we'll be back.

Beyond words. 

Awesome venue close to the sky bridge. 

We came for happy hour and stayed for an amazing meal--and called our friends to join!

The wedge salad is fresh, light and crunchy, the seaweed salad is highly recommended for those who like REAL seaweed plucked fresh from the ocean with a light dressing. 

We then had the shrimp stuffed chicken wings and spicy homemade crab pasta, ramen and it was delish. Our friends got sushi and loved it. 

The staff here are amazing--our bartender was so sweet when she heard that the concert we wanted to go to was sold out she tried to make some calls to see if she could get us extra tickets!

You will not regret coming here :) 

Also they have quite a Japanese whisky selection

Have been here a couple of times now and have been blown both times. Service has been quick and attentive, and I love that the servers offer suggestions and let you order throughout the meal. 

Every single item I've tried here has been amazing. The crab noodles are my personal favorite with the chicken gyoza coming in at a close second. 

Also, highly suggest one of the cocktails with the Japanese vodka. They are delicious.

With tall ceilings, long wide windows, and green velvet furniture, The Green Pheasant is a good looking place. On a cool and rainy winter night it felt kind of drafty and chilly. But we were excited to check out this new place. 
The menu is simple and split up into two sections: cold and hot. Since it was so chilly we only got one thing from the cold menu: the Tsukemono. I think of Tsukemono as pickled vegetables and was expecting such, but instead got a mixed greens salad with some chunks of raw fish in it. The chunks of raw fish were quite good, and though it seemed like scraps from other raw fish plates, we enjoyed it. I love scraps and not wasting!
We then moved onto our hot plates. When we asked our waitress about the order and timing she promised all of our dishes would not arrive at the same time and she was right. They all arrived at the same time except for the one larger dish we had ordered. Eh, a few kinks to a new restaurant.  I understand. 
The dishes:
Dan Dan shishito. I love Dan dan Mian the spicy Sichuan noodle dish and I like shishito peppers so we got this. It was a competition on the plate: the shishito vs the dan dan. There is not room in the bowl for two such strong flavors! Neither won. 
We then got the kinoko: warm mushrooms with finely grated cheese on top. A salty warm cheesy dish which felt good on a drafty evening. A small bowl for $13 or so but who's counting?
The star of the night was the stuffed chicken wings: the tebasaki gyoza. The bone removed from the meaty half of the wing and a shrimp toast mixture stuffed in, it was warm, savory and my favorite. Three wings on a plate if you were wondering how many to order for a table. 
Finally we got the trout: a good idea of a whole trout lightly fried with cold slaw and three little steamed bread pieces to make your own little baozi
of fish and slaw. Fish was a little overdone and slaw was a little mayo-naisey for our taste. I think we would have preferred a sharper crisper more vinegar heavy slaw. 
Overall, I think it has potential, but needs to work on some execution and pricing. I mean $22 for a bowl for potato udon? Oy!

This is a great place for a date night or group dinner. 

The concept is Japanese small plates that should be shared. We got to sit in this awesome red believer half booth and people watch everyone going by outside. Our waiter gave great recommendations for both food and drinks. 

We started with chilled sake and pheasant dumplings. They were perfectly crispy and floral and had a little spice to them. Next was lobster and corn dumplings which were very much my favorite dish. Next was mushrooms with miso, which I also recommend getting. We got the spicy crab noodles as our main dish. These were great and very rich. For dessert we got the mochi. I love mochi and I've had better mochi at other places. I'd try something else. 

The atmosphere was cool, the service was amazing, I'd definitely go back.

Favorite restaurant in Nashville for date night. I dream about the spicy crab noodles sometimes. The bar is perfect for a drink with friends and the place itself is beautiful. And for dessert get the chocolate cake thing (can't remember what it's called). It's SO TASTY and unique! Keep doing what you're doing because y'all are killing it!

We ate upstairs and it was a serene and lovely respite from the wild honky tonk of Broadway. The food was very good. I had swordfish and ate every bite. The creamed spinach was the star of the show. The wedge salad was fresh and good. I would recommend this if you are needing a delicious meal and some quiet time.

We have eaten a lot of food in our lives, but this meal is right up there with the most amazing food ever to enter my pie hole. Wow. We tried the tuna tartare, broccolini, crab noodles, king salmon and wagyu beef. Every dish was its own culinary adventure. I never imagined beef could be like this, and I'm a Nebraska girl!!  The salmon, too, was melt-in-your-mouth. We may have to stop in again sometime to see what else is awesome.

If half stars were allowed I'd give it 3 1/2. Brought the family here for dinner after reading the reviews. It's a Japanese restaurant with a tapas type menu. Saw a ton of things we were interested in trying so ordered about 10 dishes or so. 

It was odd because each time we tried something we'd all look at each other and say "interesting!"  The tuna tartare was not my favorite. Though an interesting presentation, it honestly lost the actual tuna in the dish!  The chirashi was also underwhelming. The lobster shumai was just average. 

On the positive side we really liked the Japanese pancake dish a lot. It had potato, ham and a nice little crunch/sauce. Quite tasty. The spicy crab noodles were also good. I think our favorite was the whole trout. It comes with a great little slaw and some steamed buns (though only 3 buns and 4 ppl!) 

Overall we decided that we were glad we came but probably wouldn't make it a regular in our rotation.

Excellent staff here!! Everyone from the valet staff, the host, the restaurant manager, the servers were all nice! Our waiter had a great knowledge of the menu! The restaurant is beautiful with modern decor! We were lucky to be seated in a private room. The staff helped us get set up and I can't thank them enough. We all loved the stuffed chicken wings. The drinks were delish!!

The entrees are really not shareable because most items are bite sizes like the 4 dumplings you can eat in 2 bites. 
The only complaint I have is about the pricing on the Japanese wagyu which is very misleading. It was Amazing but absolutely not worth the price. It's $26 per oz for a minimum of 4oz in very small print!!! We had a party of 10 and all of us read the menu wrong. That adds up to $104. We had 3 to share in our table so imagine the shock when we got the bill. $416 for 1lb of wagyu is highway robbery!! If we return I'd like to try the American wagyu. 

PS If you visit be sure to use the restrooms. I know silly but I was so tickled by the Toto high tech toilets lol.

Best new restaurant in Nashville, hands down. The food we had was solid but we just went with a bunch of small plates that we shared. Looking forward to having some main dishes next time! Details, Details, Details.... everything about the dining experience and ambience was very well done. The service was excellent- looking forward to coming back again.

First time I visited I wasn't impressed. The service nor the food was impressive. But gave it another try and glad I did and my opinion has changed. 

I believe they changed the menu and for the better. The food was amazing. Something for everyone. And the service was great. Desiree was amazing!  She was patient with our group of 6!  

Food service was prompt. Everyone loved it. Will definitely be back!

So delicious!! Everything we ordered was amazing except the calamari (ika karaage), which was unfortunately very bland.

Keep in mind that this is a tapas style restaurant so be mindful that you'll be sharing and ordering small plates. 

Also, they have a cake fee. I think it was $25 to have them store the cake in the back and also cut and serve the cake for you.

Meh. Valet parking is $12. Not a big deal, but nearly every quality dining establishment has free valet these days. The space is definitely beautiful. The food was pretty okay-nothing special. I found it a bit annoying that they refuse to serve any beef dish at any temperature other than medium rare. I'm a medium rare girl myself, but this temperature isn't everyone's cup of tea, and I see no reason why there is zero flexibility on this one. Anyway, the experience was fine, but with all the top-notch competition in town, I don't really see the need to return.

Y'all, this place is the BOMB! We ate here for the second time. The food is amazing! The spicy crab noodles, chicken wings, Caesar wedge salad, mushrooms, the skirt steak with miso butter, WOW! Nothing like it, plus the atmosphere is amazing! We visit lots of Nashville restaurants and all I can think about is when I'm going back!

Keeping in mind that it was lunch and my friend and I had small plates, the score is based on everything from ambiance to presentation to service. I will be returning for dinner and for other samplings. 
Sui Gyoza, perfect beginning. The tuna tartar was elegantly presented and spicy special. We also enjoyed the wedge salad with hibachi dressing and the (very yummy) japanese fried chicken. 
Our server, Alex was top notch and steered us correctly to a dessert to share. We went with the tempura style chocolate cake with both leche and chocolate sauce,  dangerously delicious, but honestly, best shared. Special food, special company. Time well spent.

We really enjoyed our meal but I was incredibly surprised to see a $2 charge for WASABI when we ordered the chirashi (raw fish).  I understand charging for "extra" wasabi with dumplings or noodles or something but it's pretty standard for wasabi to be included with chirashi.  Lol wtf

I appreciated the atmosphere of this restaurant, and visiting from out of town, I was happy to see an asian food option. 

The bartender really saved me from rating this restaurant one star down, here's why:

I ordered a Chirashi bowl, and when I asked for wasabi, I was upcharged $5 for wasabi that wasn't even good - the wasabi was tasteless. Consider being upcharged for wasabi with your sushi - that's like getting charged for ketchup with your fries, or getting charged for butter with your toast. Just doesn't make sense. I also had to wait an extra amount of time to get the wasabi and soy sauce. Since I didn't know about this charge while ordering, I passed the $ threshold in my bill where I now have to go submit an expense report. What an annoyance! The rice was on the stiffer side, and the fish was cut into small cubes, which is not ideal. 

The bartender apologized for having to upcharge me, and his kindness made up for it. Otherwise I would've left the restaurant sort of pissed.

Overall though, I appreciated the restaurant's vibe and the staff's courtesy. The cucumber appetizer I had was delicious.

To call this place a Japanese restaurant may be one of the bigger insults. I am a fan of Two Ten Jack and was excited about trying Green Pheasant. Boy was I let down. When we walked in the music was positively blaring. When we said something to our server he told us that we were not the first, but the fourth person to complain. When they turned it down, it hardly made any difference. I started with the tuna tartare with crispy rice. We thought they brought out the wrong dish because the tuna was unrecognizable, looking like chopped liver on rice. (See photo). They charged for soy sauce and for wasabi which I have never seen before at a Japanese restaurant. They are trying to get rid of the American influences so did not have the American whiskies on the menu. The food was doused in butter and you could hardly taste the Japanese flavors in any of the dishes. My lips were puckered because the food is so over salted. And to seal the deal, we found a hair mixed into the rice of our chirashi. I will not be coming back. At the end of our meal, the a server came out and let us know he saw our review. Rather than apologizing for the poor service and our bad experience, he could not have been more unkind. One of the wait staff walked us out of the restaurant telling us how pathetic we are. To call one pathetic is incredibly rude, especially to customers in the service industry who simply voiced their opinions of a bad experience on yelp.

We had a really great experience here. First, the whole vibe and decor of the place is just so cool and really thought through. If we hadn't had a table I would've been totally fine with sitting at the bar even. They also had a really slick little lounge area too. The food was delicious and different, even the sides were fun to try. Can't wait to go back!

One of my favorite restaurants in Nashville. Located across the street from Ascend, The Green Pheasant has a mix of classiness with a good modern vibe. A lot of Japanese inspired dishes and entrees that will make you head spin. Service was excellent!! 

Looking forward to many more visits

I eat out in nashville restaurants 4-5 week for lunch and dinner. The GP is new on the scene and as i understand it also own TwoTenJack. The food is really good especially the American Waygu and sashimi platter. Tough to get really good sushi and they did it. But what I cannot stand is for a restaurant to be so pretentious that is ruins a meal. 1)Sitting all the older couples in one section of the restaurant 2) pretending its very busy when half the tables are full. 3) saying that we should preorder when they haven't taken out drink order 4) the server not know what a gin martini is 5) server telling us that the meal will be served at a leisurely pace and everything come out with 15 minutes of each other. 6) charging 12 dollars for valet parking. 

The server was nice enough but obviously the staff was at the direction of Managment to turn over tables on a Saturday night when it was slow. 

You got the impression they want to be the hip version of two ten jack from the east side in a downtown environment. 

Not sure that attitude will work very long.

The waitress was very nice and knowledgeable.  The dishes were very heavy and overly greasy.  We ordered the chicken wings gyoza which was ok but greasy.  The hash browns we drenched in BBQ sauce which was overwhelming.  The fried rice was ok, but again with the sausage.  It was just greasy and heavy.  We really wanted to like it.

Some of the best food I've had in Nashville! Same owners as Two Ten Jack and they are geniuses with their menu. All small plates so be prepared to order multiple plates. We tried the lobster gyoza, pork fried rice, steak, salmon, and mushrooms. All were delicious. We did order the spicy crab noodles and reminded the waiter multiple times but they never came. He did take them off our check but we're still craving those darn noodles so wish we would've got them. Only reason they get 4 stars.

Three of us stopped in and had an amazing dining experience! The hostess, Megan, greeted is joyfully and seated us quickly. The menu was different than I'd ever seen before. Each item we ordered served four people and it was so delicious! The tomatoes, mushrooms, lobster... It was all so yummy. Our waiter Michael explained all the dishes well and made great suggestions! We will definitely be back. We do recommend making a reservation to guarantee a table! You will not be disappointed!

Everything about The Green Pheasant impressed me. The brass hardware paired with bright teal chairs and elevated ceilings gave an upscale, opulent ambiance that I love and is the perfect setting for a fantastic Friday night meal. We met some friends here for the first time and decided to order a lot of things and share. We ordered cocktails, mine was a lemongrass drink with gin that was delicious and the rest of the table had cold sake. For our cold starter we had the wedges which typically I'm not a big fan of a giant stalk of lettuce as a general rule, but this one was cut up into smaller pieces with a hibachi dressing and crispy onions which were delicious. For the warm courses we ordered two kinds of gyozas, one being the stuffed chicken wings which were unlike anything I've ever had and incredibly interesting. They were warm and flavorful and stuffed with a blend of what I think was shrimp and other seasonings. It's hard to describe, but just get them. We also had the dan dan shishito peppers which I have to order whenever they are on a menu and were very good. I think my favorite dish of the night was the spicy crab noodles. They were good because they were actually spicy for a spice lover, and rich but not too heavy unlike other crab noodles I've had. They were incredible and melted in my mouth. I completely hogged the dish and was not as generous with them as I normally am when ordering shared plates. We also sampled a pork special that was great and had a really good sashimi which I think was the walu on the cold menu. 
The Green Pheasant had it all, ambiance, service and most importantly delicious, interesting food.

The family has a great time at The Green Pheasant. Asian food is a crowd pleaser and all the different dishes let us experiment. Our server even said the  restaurant is modeled after an izakaya, a Japanese pub.

We enjoyed all the dishes (i.e. the plates were empty when they left the table.) but the fried oysters and pheasant dumplings were the favorites. We probably could have eaten those all night. Most interesting/new experience was the bok choy salad.

It is always good to know a place where you can sit and talk while eating top quality dishes. Enjoy.

Amazing on all fronts. 

Guys, park in the self park garage and get it validated for free. Don't pay $12 for valet, silly!

We were seated immediately by a friendly hostess and given warm eucalyptus towels which were SO nice on a cold night. What a nice touch. 

We had the sonomono, shumai, chahan w/american wagyu, and the ora king salmon. Each dish was flavorful and delicious. The sonomono is like ceviche but better. For dessert, we had the tempura chocolate cake - my husbands choice because I usually don't love cake but this was excellent.

The japanese old fashioned was probably one of the best I've ever had. My husband enjoyed his cocktail too - the green chartreuse gave it a complex flavor. 

I'm looking forward to trying more items on the menu next time.

Awesome unique and tasty food, beautifully presented. Crab noodles, beef dish, and chicken gyoza and ginger creams brûlée were excellent. Brocollini was a bit too salty. Choc cake tempura cake was ok.

This was my fiancé and Is first stop in Nashville. We were not disappointed! The food presentation was exceptional and the food it's self was full of flavor. Each ingredient truly shined through each dish we had. We stoped for lunch and definitely plan to go back for dinner to try out the full menu.

I never write reviews but the ramen was the BEST ramen i have ever had in my life !!! The broth was so flavorful and silky in texture. (Wonder how long it took to prepare) The pork belly was tender and there was a whole egg in there!! Oh my god AMAZING. Service at the bar was fantastic too. I'm going every week.
Place is so good. Highly recommend. Went with a large group and every loved what they ordered which is rare.
Fantastic dining experience.  Knowledgeable staff helped us make menu choices.  Everything we had was outstanding.  We need to come back so we can try more.  Great atmosphere.  Highly recommend

Excellent spot! Definitely get the menu run down!! 

We tried a few small plates!
karaage (fried chicken- small plate- so yummy!)
sui gyoza (pheasant dumplings- when in Rome)

spicy crab noodles- spicy and super delicious! 

kaisendon was my main dish! It was very tasty but needed a balance with some crunch. 

Overall great experience- SUPER friendly staff and not a big wait time in food. Definitely check it out if you are in the area!!

One of the most delicious dinners I've had in Nashville, and I've had some amazing ones. 

You must get the chicken wings stuffed with shrimp. They were so good we ordered 2. 

The salmon, spicy crab noodles and broccolini were out of this world. 

I didn't immediately think this place would have a worthwhile dessert to splurge on, but we ordered the tempura chocolate cake and it was unbelievable. 

Must go.

Absolutely delicious and a welcome reprieve from the bachelorette insanity that downtown now caters to. The roasted cauliflower had amazing flavor with the perfect amount of crispy bits and a hint of heat. The lobster shumai are other worldly, melt in your mouth, dumpling treats. We also loved the roast pork and cabbage dish. The space is beautifully designed and their bar program on point with excellent cocktails and a robust sake collection. Highly recommend a visit.

This place has been on my list to try. Finally got downtown and I'm definitely going to be back. We started with some great Japanese Whiskey cocktails.  Shared the Wedge Salad and the Yaki Gyoza. Both were so perfect; amazing flavor and visual presentation was perfect. Then for dinner we shared the Okonomiyaki and the Spicy Crab Noodle. Again... the taste just made us want to savor each bite. We will be back!!! Sooooooo Delicious. Thank you!!!
Great food! This atmosphere is nice and the service was not overwhelming. I highly recommend the chicken/shrimp gyoza. It wasn't what I would've expected but was delicious.

Amazing decor. Excellent food. However, this brings new meaning to the phrase "small plates." Was with a group of eight for a business dinner and it was impossible to maintain a fun vibe with everyone on the hunt for food. If plates are meant for sharing, then they should not be small - in fact, they should be on the large side. These servings were teeny-tiny and it became such a distraction to keep ordering over and over again, so we gave up. That's a shame, because I did try some amazing things and enjoyed flavors I hadn't known before. Perfect for a date, but groups of 3+ stay away!

This place is gorgeous inside! We ordered the ora king salmon with the teriyaki glaze and bok choy, the spicy crab noodles, the okonomiyaki with ham, bacon, scallops, and potatoes, and finally the broccolini accompanied with hot rock shrimp, cornbread, sudachi, and shoyu. The noodles were our favorite followed closely by the broccolini. The service is great and the flavors will impress you at every turn. Pairing it with cold sake really brought everything together. I would love to come again!
Absolutely incredible!!!!!!!!! We tried one of everything on the menu and not a single thing disappointed!!! I'd give 10 stars if I  could

Food is good, but overpriced. Disappointed that they only serve their ramen dishes at lunch, not dinner. For such an expensive place, the fact they refused to split checks was ridiculous and infuriating as we had a party of four and had to spend ten minutes trying to figure out which dish was whose and how much each person owed (the dishes are small so you order multiple ones which adds to the confusion). When the waiter told me they don't split checks, I thought he was joking and I literally said "are you serious??" out loud to the dismay of my poor husband. Service is also poor and they only check on you once or twice. When we went for lunch, the place was empty, yet we had to get up and find our waiter just to get our check and get out of there.

My friend and I arrived to a near empty restaurant around 5PM. As soon as we walked in we were asked if we had a reservation to which we stated no. We were told by the hostess to sit at the bar since we did not have a reservation. We were a little confused but obliged. The bar was extremely sticky and uncomfortable to be at. We were sitting near the entrance of the restaurant and another group of people walked in and stated that they did not have a reservation, however they were quickly seated at a table. My friend and I went on to order a drink and start with a small plate. The small plate we had was the lobster dumplings and they were extremely salty, we could hardly taste the lobster meat. We ended our dining experience at that and left quite unsatisfied. The customer service here is extremely subpar. I felt as if the staff didn't really want us here. Save your money and explore the many other amazing options Nashville has to offer.

This was the best overall dining experience I've had in Nashville in years. The staff was kind from when we were greeted at the door, to when our awesome waiter walked us through the menus and took great care of us. The vibe inside is modern and stylish, the food was delicious, they have tons of sake options, and the prices were decent! Two Ten Jack is owned by the same people, and both restaurants know what's up!

First off holy shit, this place is amazing from the start the hostess gives you oshiburi's (hot towels to wash your hands) the cocktail's menus are decorated with awesome Japanese inspired art. The spirits and sake list is located under the table in a secret pocket. They have a sake somm. Who is very knowledgeable about her selection and it's not small by any means, the Japanese whisky list is also very impressive I got to try a few whisky's I haven't tried yet.

We started with a few cold items the wedges which were awesome very light crisp and full of flavor, first off everything is full of flavor. The tsukemono was perfectly seasoned and fresh, the chirashi was also very fresh and had walu, oprah, and ora king salmon. I definitely reccomend starting with the cold before the hot because the dishes come out as ready. After chatting with the sake somm. And ordering a bottle of the otokoyama we ordered from the hot list. Jesse our waiter was very helpful with our questions and very attentive to our table. We ordered the (pics available) Dan Dan shishitos, the brocolini with rock shrimp (order this please) the kinoko which is a mushroom miso flavor bomb, the ika karaage which is basically tempura squid, the spicy crab noodle is a must every noodle is covered in great sauce the noodles al dente (another please order)the shuman came next and they didn't disappoint either but now I'm starting to think I ordered too much oops... on to the Jidori chicken a never ever chicken and I don't mean not to order it, it was fried to perfection came with a kewpie mayo and a sweet and spicy sauce. I just meant it's a strain of chicken that's DNA has never been tampered with by humans and is raised in completely open pens not the kind PETA shows in those tapes and fed an organic Vegan diet. On to the beef I'm dying a happy death at this point... the first two to show up was the mishima ranch American wagyu and the A5 miyazaki prefecture wagyu both very tender and cooked to perfection the American wagyu has more bite to it but the A5 is like seared foie gras melt in your mouth yummy goodness. Last but not least the American skirt steak showed up ... truly a sizzling flavor bomb the corn the onions the miso butter and the j sauce make sure to get everything in one bite for the perfect bite. I've been writing so much I forgot to talk about the trout just check the pictures ... kudos to chef Kynsey and her amazing staff the GM Michael seale for coming to the table and chatting with us Kristin breringson for the awesome recommendations and most of all Jesse for taking care of us and making sure put needs were met. I will definitely be back just make sure you try it too the place is awesome. Best culinary experience in Nashville.

The atmosphere and decor really set this restaurant apart.  It is cozy but modern with big teal booths and modern Asian decor throughout.

Service is top notch.  Our server was willing to give us a complete run-down of the menu, noting all of his favorites and specials along the way.  He also gave us some recommendations on saki to try, since it was my first time ever tasting it.  

The saki was good, but not quite my thing, so I ended up with the 'bad sleep well' as my cocktail of choice for the night.  It was so refreshing and delicious.

As far as food goes, I definitely recommend getting a few small plates and entrees to split amongst the table, so you can get a taste of everything.  There were just two of us, so we started with the shishito peppers and the tebasaki gyoza (which is a really cool play on chicken wings and gyozas).  Those gyozas were definitely our favorite!  For our main course we split a pork belly ramen special that was delicious! This is not your typical ramen, it had thick noodles with a thick sauce, which I actually preferred to the more traditional "soupy" ramen dishes.

Look everyone comes to Nashville for the BBQ and Hot Chicken however, after a few days of that your mouth needs a different flavor.  We had a great meal at the Green Pheasant.  Authentic and modern, the dishes were all hits except the chicken gyoza.  Didnt love those.  Nice drinks and great asian flavors

Loved Green Pheasant. We went with another couple and it was about $100 per couple, food and drinks included. This is great for Nashville. Every plate we tried was great - mushrooms, sausage fried rice, ikinari steak, SPICY CRAB NOODLES, and all of the sashimi. Recommend for lunch or dinner!

This place was not inexpensive, but I was prepared for that after seeing a very helpful picture of their menu. I enjoyed my visit, I ate at the bar and the bartenders were great, both giving me space to eat, and also not neglecting me. I ordered a "cold" item and a "hot" item. I felt that the Hamachi was a day or so older than it should have been, with a slightly fishy taste, but nevertheless the food was very tasty. Great combination of apple, jalapeno and a crunchy item which I'm too unsophisticated to identify. The salmon "hot"item was great and exactly what I was looking for. The food combined with the locally brewed Proper  Sake made for a great meal.
I would return.

I had been looking forward to eating here for several weeks. My expectations were met in every way. The service was excellent; the cocktails were excellent; and the food was outstanding. 

The Sunomono was a real stand out as were the Spicy Crab Noodles, Ora King Salmon and Broccolini. The absolute star of the show was the Japanese Wagyu. Pricey? Yes, but it was simply excellent. 

The Japanese inspired cocktails were outstanding and our server was excellent in recommending various sakes to try.

For dessert our party tried pistachio mochi, ginger creme brûlée, and tempura chocolate cake.

This place is not cheap. You are ordering small plates that are meant to be shared, so you can run up a pretty expensive tab really quick. The food that you receive however is top shelf all the way. This is now one of my favorite spots in Nashville.

Amazing, inventive cuisine. The salmon is mind blowing, literally best salmon I've ever had. Another of my favorites is the crab noodles. Super comforting in this cold weather (but I'm sure I'll eat it when it's sweltering out too)! The American waygu is amazing- almost melt in your mouth. The sake on tap is nicely rice-y and feels like it has the tiniest effervescence. And then for dessert, don't miss out on the strawberry chocolate chip mochi if they have it!

A fun food fine for lunch or dinner. A well curated environment with an equally well designed menu and plate presentation. 
Friendly staff and attentive service.
This place is amazing!! I love the environment of this restaurant. The food was incredible. I had the spicy crab noodles - will definitely come back if I come back in town!

This is a really great place to go with a lot of people. Amazing dishes to split and great service. The sashimi is great, and the gyoza is really amazing. No problems with the food, great location, amazing servers, just great all around

I had a wonderful Galentine's dinner here and our server Lauren was amazing. She shared which ones were her favorite and what she recommend according to our likes. All the dishes were yummy and flavorful. I will go back soon but this time with the hubby since he was a little jealous of our meal :)

A beautifully decorated restaurant...downstairs...around the bar. We sat upstairs and unfortunately it could have been a room.... anywhere. 

Our server was excellent and the menu quite attractive.  We decided to do as the server suggested and enjoy a shared menu.  I love the Japanese style fusion options and there were quite a variety.  

Started off with the wedge and this I can not recommend highly enough. Who would have ever thought a "wedge" could be done uniquely on a stick? Crunchy onions on top and that dressing.... I have decided to try to imitate that one at home - it won't be the same, but just the presentation - yum. The cauliflower was highly recommended and we all decided it was the least impressive of the evening. The ikineri steak was amazing - large portion and quite tender. And the spicy crab noodles - wow.  A hint of spice - not too much. With butter... yep. What a bowl of heaven. 

Try to sit downstairs and have a great sampling of the wonderful options.

I went here for a celebratory dinner with my stepmom and this place was absolutely amazing. 

The ambiance and decor is unparalleled. Lush green velvet everywhere, high ceilings, origami centerpieces hanging above the bar. 

The food was absolutely marvelous and subtly balanced Southern and Japanese influence. We had the mushroom dish, the walu, the spicy crab noodles, and the whole trout. 

The mushrooms were divine. The walu was so delicate with just a little spice. The spicy crab noodles had the best slightly chewy texture, the crab itself was a very fine texture and flavored the noodles, and it had just the right amount of heat in the back of your throat. The trout was amazing because of the salted crust, the meat just fell off the bones. We made little buns with their upscale cole slaw and it was jaw dropping. 

Such a delicious evening that I will cherish always.
We tried several of the dishes.  Nothing great.  Very bland.  If you just need some overpriced, untasty, sustenance, this will do.

We came here on a reference assuming there was sushi....there is not. But we grabbed some happy hour apps for a late lunch and those were pretty tasty but nothing to write home about. The noodle dish was my favorite -- like a ramen basically. The decor was modern with some velvet old fashioned touches. The staff was nice as well.

The restaurant was basically empty but it looked like they do small group get togethers and take you through food tastings. Also - bathrooms have fancy toilet seat attachments with heat and all sorts of settings if you're into that!

My wife and I had 7 items. Next time it'll be 14. So dang good. Server Sam was most gracious, especially when my card was declined because it was deactivated. That's skill! Jess and Trey are doing exciting things in this town and my tummy is thankful.

Great restaurant right in the heart of downtown Nashville! Perfect as a date-night spot or for drinks & dinner with friends! The service was wonderful and I loved that we were able to book the reservation the day before using the OpenTable app.

I kept hearing about this place and oh my goodness, it lived up to the hype. Tried it for the first time Tuesday night and it was so good I had to bring back more friends for dinner Wednesday! First of all, the location directly across from ascend can't be beat. The ambience is super chic and exotic. The signature cocktails are inventive and completely out of the ordinary. But the food--my goodness, the food! The walu appetizer made with escarole sashimi and fresh jalepeño was just delightful. The kinoko mushrooms are exotic and flavorful. The biggest surprise was the chahan--this is not your usual fried rice! It is so incredibly rich and creamy and indulgent! They call them small plates but the portions are quite generous...you'll want to share so you can order a little of everything! And, the servers were so knowledgeable about the ingredients and the origins of the dishes. Our dining experience was simply ideal...twice! Ready to book a third time!

A great place, BUT the service was absolutely appalling. I was looking for a fun place to go out and celebrate and a lot of my friends recommended this place. The atmosphere was super cute, food was good our server, Matthew was atrocious. We had to ask him repeatedly for multiple things and one of the most important things was water. Water is one thing you shouldn't let run out with customers. 
It took them a significantly (20 mins) longer time to bring out my friends food and she ordered the same thing. Then when it was brought out, wrong might I add, he had an attitude about it and did not offer another option or apologize about the issue. 
Overall I'm not sure if I'll come back to this restaurant let alone recommend this place to anyone else. Now when people ask me about it, the first thing that comes out is food was good, but the service is terrible and that's such a turn off. Very dissatisfied. 
I gave this place one star because the food was good but all the other stars get taken off for the poor service. Come on Nashville get it together!!

Went to Green Pheasant last week to entertain clients in from Minnesota.  I had been prepped by a couple of my colleagues that the food was "life changing" and, I am pleased to say, that they did not disappoint.  Between the 5 of us, we ordered probably 15 different small plates and **every** one was exceptional.  In particular, the Spicy Crab Noodles, Wagyu Steak, and Gyoza were excellent.  Our server was outstanding and very informative.
This was by far one of my favorite restaurants in Nash! The atmosphere and food were amazing. Will be returning on my next trip.

The worst $140 (for two), I've ever spent in a restaurant. Small plates indeed. The website makes the place look glamorous and beautiful, but we were shown to an area, upstairs, that reminded me of an employee break room. The $28 sushi was good, everything else was tiny, bland, or just plain not as it was described. A $16 plate described as pork was actually peppers. Pretentious, underachieving and overpriced.

Loved it! This place isn't just a restaurant, it's an experience. They have Toto toilets! They seriously thought this through in every way imaginable. 

We stopped in for lunch and I got yakisoba; wok fired noodles, pork, vegetables with a sunny egg and my husband ordered a sando set, a la bento box-esque with pork katsu. His meal came with miso soup, side of the day, rice, and pickled veggies. The veggies in my dish were super fresh and bright. The chopped asparagus was a nice touch. To round it out we ordered two house sakes (cold) with our meal for $6 a glass.The food was on point and we were very satisfied. I wasn't too full, it was just the right amount. 

The decor is fantastic and romantic. They used a lot of deep jewel tones in the fabrics. The booths were microfiber in a deep burnt orange color and others were a deep blue. The chairs were a little mod and the bar open. The booths were tucked away where you could get some privacy. The tables evoked more of a traditional dining experience. 

To say I was surprised would be incorrect, this team knows what they are doing and consistently delivers top notch food. Two Ten is one of my favorite restaurants in town! I can't wait to come back to the Green Pheasant and try more of their food. There are at least 10 more items I need to eat. This is a must try downtown. It's really opened up the dining scene and filled a much needed void.

Stopped here Saturday November 10 prior to the Mavericks concert.     Very trendy decor, staff very pleasant, and really interesting cocktails.     The food was great, we had the Wedges for a starter, nice dish with the added carrots and onions.   We shared 4 entrees, all were excellent.  We'll be back, a really nice experience.

What an epic bummer! Such a devastating let down to be given dish after dish of tasteless uninspiring dishes. It's actually quite a feat to make six dishes in a row taste like nothing. I mean nothing. No taste, no flavor, nothing. 
How sad. The interior is beautiful and our server Josh was lovely however to pay top price for probably the most tasteless meal I've had all year was the most epic bummer of 2018.

Talk about a fresh, modern, and most importantly delicious take on Japanese cuisine. I was very surprised to find such a gem so close to the heart of Honky Tonk, Nashville, Tennessee. The interior and service were astounding. We were promptly seated and given warm, damp towels to wash our hands at the table. That's something I've never seen before but apparently it's a custom at legitimate Japanese establishments, especially higher budget ones. Our server was very polite and the whole place gave off a formal vibe. I definitely wouldn't come here on a whim in your Wednesday Worst but don't feel pressured to come in a suit or dress. Anyways, the menu items were expectantly  priced for the type of venue Green Pheasant was. I don't think anything was below $10 and one of their entrees was around $25 per ounce (minimum of 4 ounces per order) for examples. Even though the price can be a bit steep, the food was well worth it and tasted delicious. You get an adequate and satisfying portion unlike some more higher end places so you don't feel like you paid for one little piece of meat or lettuce. I recommend the Jidori Chicken and Fried Chocolate Cake. Overall, this is a great place for a casual-formal date or nice family dinner!

My wife and I had a great meal with friends Friday night- delicious, interesting food at a very fair price. Cool vibe and friendly staff! Highlights were the shishitos, broccolini, spicy crab pasta, and the ikinari steak. Look forward to our next visit!

Amazing experience at this beautiful new addition to the downtown dining scene. The host was warm and seated us immediately, manager checked in to make sure all was great, and our server Lauren V was one of the best we've had in town. Extremely knowledgeable, and every single recommendation she gave was fantastic. The spicy crab noodle dish was the highlight, and the broccolini and chicken gyoza were fantastic as well. For a refreshing, light dessert, the blueberry mochi was delicious, and the tempura fried chocolate cake was rich and indulgent. Drinks were thoughtful and unique and a perfect compliment to the meal. The gin and ginger cocktail (golden boy, maybe?) was my favorite. Can't wait to return and try more!

This place was just ok. We started with  tsukemono 
(seasonal japanese pickles) and they were ok at best, really more vinegar taste than anything else. Next, yaki gyoza (grilled pheasant dumpling) was subpar and I actually asked for sriracha to give it some sort of flavor. We ordered the kinoko (mushrooms) and these were the best thing of the meal in my opinion. Lastly, we decided to stop at the spicy crab noodles. I was really looking forward to this dish and I was let down again. It was basically Alfredo sauce with crab meat and hint of heat. Overall the food was underwhelming. The service was great and our server really talked up the fusion of izakaya and Tennessee charm but in my opinion they missed the  mark.
Such a cool Asian fusion restaurant. Pretty great deals at happy hour, and a really lovely staff. I had the Wagyu beef brisket, and it was really delicious

Best things about this place are the toilet seats and ambiance. The toilet seats are heated and are Japanese luxury seats with duvets and such. Service was slow. The table wasn't greeted until maybe 15 minutes later, & I asked where our server was. Server seemed annoyed by me when I would ask for something. Guess I was deemed needy, but she was away for long periods at a time. I added lobster tails to our dinner for $10 each. They were the size of a shriveled shrimp. I guess I got what I paid for, but I can get a full lobster tail somewhere else for like $25. The NYE dinner was alright. Wouldn't pay $85 a person here again though. Wagyu wasn't that great, & dessert was just a bunch of mochi that I didn't care for. Serving sizes are tapa sized portions. Even for the entree. My boyfriend was still hungry so I ordered a pizza from Gino's East to be delivered to the house when we left here. I'd go back here for drinks and the fancy toilet seats, but that might just be it.

My wife and I spent three days in Nashville in a food and booze coma and we both agreed that our dinner at the Green Pheasant was far and away our best meal. Things got off to an inauspicious start as we barely made our reservation and the host staff gave my wife a hard time about being alone as I refused to pay the going rate for parking nearby or the posted valet price ($5 self park is available, oops missed that). Once we finally got settled in, our server took over and he was outstanding. 

We ordered a bottle of wine and a number of dishes to share. Everyone raves about the spicy crab noodles and for good reason. Ours could have been a touch hotter in my opinion but once I had that first butter savory umami bite I couldn't part with it. I would come back here often just for this dish alone. We also fell in love with the Tebasaki gyoza. At first when they brought it to our table we were confused as we expected some traditional dumplings, but when our waiter explained how the dumpling filling is stuffed into the chicken wing we raised our eyebrows a bit, took a bite and were astounded at the taste and experience of such an innovative concept. It's hard to surprise me with food and yet this did. My wife still talks about this dish and for good reason. Mindblowingly amazing! We had the broccolini and shrimp dish as well which was fantastic, but compared to the other dishes we ordered, was not in the same stratosphere. Great but not innovative or life-changing. We had the cheapest steak on their menu, which in hindsight I wish I would have insisted on the wagyu or something, but my wife devoured the american steak and claimed it as her favorite steak for some time (I assume that excludes my weekly sous vide offerings). I found the steak befitting of the other dishes and the exquisite ambiance. As much as I enjoyed it, I would def order the crab noodles and gyoza again, but would be interested in trying a different steak next time. 

The restaurant is gorgeous, elegant and stately without being pretentious or overstated. We would definitely return regularly and I know if I were ever in the doghouse, a visit to the Green Pheasant would be just the ticket to get me back in my wife's good graces. Highly recommend.

We have been three times....the food has been perfectly prepared.   the flavors have been perfect with each dish.
The Steamed Pheasant was bland for us.
Last night the daily fish sashimi, crab noodles, mushrooms, & skirt steak were all perfect.
The wait service has been perfect for each visit....
Thank you for an incredible addition to dining in BNA.

This was such a fun experience! Our server was awesome, the food was fantastic. I have a shellfish allergy, told the server, and the chef went out of their way to accommodate me and make sure i was alright. The ambience was awesome. It was a great chill place with a really cool vibe. Also the saki was fantastic.

This place was great when it first opened. And it still has decent food. But the old menu had Japanese sando's with egg salad, katsu, and even a Wagyu burger. It was awesome and different. However, they quickly changed the menu to bentos and ramen - which is exactly what everyone else is doing. The shokupan was amazing and they really had something special I thought. I also think the parking situation is awful. Kind of a pretentious location.

Totally, 100% worth every single penny.  I planned a surprise birthday dinner for my best friend here, and everything from the moment I called to inquire about availability was flawless and above average customer service.  Karah, the manager I spoke with, worked closely with me to make sure all details were handled, down to prepping the hostesses not to mention a party when I arrived with the birthday girl.  Karah not only helped me the day I called (a week or so before the party), but reached out the day of to go over final details.  She was enthusiastic and thorough.  In fact, she even came by to wish the birthday girl a happy birthday and stopped back a few times to ask if everything was going well. 

Our server, Duane was flawless!  He gave us an enthusiastic overview of the restaurant, it's food and suggestions.  He explained everything extremely well and made our experience personal and exceptional.  He always had a smile on his face and gave wonderful suggestions, i.e. the onset egg on the wagyu steak!  

The FOOD!  THE FOOD THE FOOD!  We spent roughly $1200 for a group of 13 and there wasn't a crumb left on any of the plates!  People made NOISE while eating.  The food is so well prepared, came out in waves (never allowing anything to get cold, it came out immediately when ready), very well presented and perfect for a large group to share.  The cocktails were delicious as well.

Overall, the wait staff, the managers and every single thing about our experience was top notch and well worth every penny.  I highly recommend The Green Pheasant!  Thank you so very much for making a special occasion even more special and completely positive.  Cheers!

We had a wonderful meal here with attentive service. The food was all really flavorful--my favorites were the spicy crab noodles and the broccolini. A great place to come and share plates with everyone. We will absolutely come back.

in town from SA, TX and DAMN! in my best Kendrick Lamar voice. 

Waygu!
Stuffed wing!
tuna tartare!
Karaage! 
Gold can Sake!
Tremendous waitress!
Great Lunch!  
Better Dinner!

My tastebuds thank you very much!

My friend and I originally came here to attend a "Ramen Off" but after seeing that "cheeseburger ramen" was being served we decided to skip it and just eat at the restaurant. The event was held upstairs, and there were plenty of open tables on the dining room floor.

We got there at 5:10 and were put on the waitlist for the Ramen off. At around 5:25 we went up to the hostess stand (there were 3 hostesses) and asked if we could be taken off the list for the event and just dine in downstairs. The hostess asked us to hold on a "moment" and she would seat us. 20 minutes rolls by and it looks like she has no intention to seat us. I asked another hostess who said she couldn't seat us until the person who controlled the seating was back and she was currently on the phone. Again, at least half or more of the tables are open. Another 10-15 minutes till around and that second hostess seats us, in the back of the dining hall, without any apology or care we had to wait for over 30 minutes to sit. I also didn't understand why we were seated in the back when there were plenty of open tables in the front of the restaurant. 

Our service was decent but I felt like she was in a rush. I understand it might have been stressful because an event was taking place upstairs.

The cocktails are good depending on what you get, but I don't know if they're "$14 good." 

The food we ordered was the Tuna Tartare (it was excellent, and my favorite), the Shumai dumplings (my friend liked these, I didn't care for them), the hash browns (these were also very delicious and a nice spin on a traditional American food), and the spicy crab noodles (also pretty good).

All in all, the food is good, the restaurant is beautiful, but for me I appreciate an overall experience and if I feel like a burden to the staff I guarantee you I won't come back no matter how good the food can be. 

Also the heated toilet seats were nice...

Oh and we left the restaurant at 7:00 pm and got a phone call that our table for the Ramen Off was available. We would have had to wait 2 hours and we got there 10 minutes after it started!

I am baffled to read all the 5 star reviews, if I could I wouldn't even give it a 1 start. This place is very nice inside and reading the reviews I expected a good meal. 
First, we ordered Gyoza for appetizer and it was awful. It was like eating a day old gooey pocket of fish. I told the waitress I was in the mood for ramen and she recommend the "most traditional" which was the shio wontonmen. I can't even describe how tasteless this ramen was, it had no flavor at all. It was cold noodles in a watered down wonton soup. I didn't finish either one, got our checks and left. 
The host gave us a "parking validation" that took off .54 cents from the price of the parking. 
Will I go back?
No thanks.

Disappointed

I made my reservation for a party of 6 two months ago after hearing incredible reviews from co-workers and friends. I was eagerly anticipating a first class experience, an upscale version of another local favorite,Two-Ten Jack. Unfortunately, due to the restaurant management's incompetence and extremely rude and unprofessional attitudes, I left this establishment very disappointed. 

Our reservation was at 7:30pm, and when we arrived, the hostess informed us that our table "was being cleared now" and to take a seat at the bar for a few minutes. After a quick bathroom break, our party ordered a round of drinks from the bar to help us maintain our patience as the minutes melted off of the clock. After 20 minutes of waiting; I approached the host to inquire about the delay in seating. The response was gruff, he rudely informed me that a previous party was still closing out at the table and we would have to continue to wait. I then asked if he would comp our first round of drinks; and again the response was rude and unprofessional- "It's out of my control....Sir!" the manager exclaimed as he shook his head and walked towards the kitchen. 

My party and I continued to wait; ordering a second round of drinks while the waitstaff struggled to get their act together. 50 minutes later, at 8:20pm, the manager finally moped back to the bar; mumbling as he led us upstairs to a completely different section of the restaurant. Before we headed upstairs, I asked him what he would do to help rectify the situation. "The first round of drinks is on me, but I will NOT cover the second." Ridiculous.... 

Once we were seated, I must confess that the remainder of our time was quite enjoyable. From our friendly waiter, Spencer, delicious small plates, and smooth Japanese Whiskey- the second act of the night met my expectations. The heated toilet seats were also a big hit with the ladies. However, none of these positives could cleanse my palate of the sour taste left over from the management's poor demeanor. We shook our heads as we departed; disheartened. I truly believe that the Green Pheasant could fly high with the best of them, as long as it's management stopped clipping it's own wings.

I literally came here twice in one week because I wanted to try more things on the menu. Everything is DELICIOUS. My personal favorites are the Walu and the Tuna appetizer. Expect to spend some money on this food but it will be worth it!

Food is good and portions are decent, but drinks and food are pricey. $15 for a cocktail full of ice? And glass sizes are small. Waste of money. We're nashville, not New York. Chill on the price hikes.

This place is wonderful date spot! The decor is well thought out with a sense of modern elegance that can be fun and also intimate. I came here for lunch to try out the menu. Although I was craving for dinner menu items, I could only order the lunch menu at the time. The staff is patient and helpful throughout the dining experience from being greeted at the door to the end. I tried the tuna tartare, teishoku kushiyaki set, and also a drink. The tuna tartare came with crispy rice on the bottom and was a bit pricey for the amount and quality/flavor. It wasn't what I had imagined besides two little bites for this dish. I enjoyed the teishoku sets because I like variety. It came with a warm little cup of miso soup, a daily side, rice, and tsukemono. I wasn't very fond of the pickled cucumbers, but the grilled shiitake mushrooms and eggplant were my favorite. The presentation was great, service was great, drinks were refreshing, but I definitely have to come again to try more items. I would definitely come with a group of friends and order a bunch of small dishes to share and just enjoy the night with the amazing decor.

Was recommended to visit this fine establishment from a local we met at LA Jackson while having an afternoon cocktail. Booked our reservation on Opentable for 8:30....

Upon arrival the restaurant was dimly lit and smelled delicious. We were seated at a table by the window. Our server, Jason, promptly brought hot towels. I thought it was a nice touch.

After reviewing the wine menu we decided to go with a bottle of Italian red. 

For an appetizer we ordered the pheasant dumplings. These things were AMAZING. Tangy and not to filling, we absolutely destroyed them instantly.

For the entree we decided to go with the Japanese wagyu with a side of roasted cauliflower. I highly recommend these delicious cuts of beef if you decide to come here. It arrived on a slate platter with 4 optional topics. We sprinkled the salt and pepper over the top and began to enjoy. The wagyu was everything I hoped and dreamed for it to be. Thinly sliced with a charred exterior, we went with rare plus, every piece was savory and delicious. It was like candy. The pictures do not do it justice!

Would go again next time we're in Nashville.

JM

We went to The Green Pheasant with plans to eat ramen. It turns out they only do ramen at lunch. We mentioned to our sever that we would plan to go to Two Ten Jack for ramen and he went out of his way to call over and get us in line, saving over an hour of time for us. This was unbelievably kind and clutch - shout out server Jason. We didn't get to eat at Green Pheasant and but they have earned lIfelong customers with this kind gesture. 12/10 would recommend. If the owner reads this - please pay your man Jason (dinner from 1/25/2020)

After reading the reviews, I knew I had to stop at The Green Pheasant while in Nashville. Fortunately, my flight back to New York got cancelled allowing me one extra night to dine in the Music City. My girlfriend and I got seated without a problem on a cold Sunday January night. We didn't have a reservation, and the restaurant was almost empty. Maybe it was due to the weather? We both commenced with old fashioneds to warm us up, and that was one of the better things we had. To start, we ordered the broccolini appetizer with hot rock shrimp, cornbread, sudachi, shoyu. The fusion didn't work well for me at all. For our main, we shared the spicy crab noodle with crab butter, sweet red crab, tobanjan. And again, nothing to write home about. The creme brule definitely takes the cake here. All in all, it was okay but a little disappointing after having such high hopes.

Fantastic Japanese restaurant downtown. Lovely atmosphere, great drinks and the food was lovely. Try the crab noodle dish. Wait staff is excellent, knowledgeable, and helpful in guiding you through the menu. We'll be back!

Hard not to give this place 5 stars.  Service was excellent.  All the food was full of flavor and presented very well.  We thought we would leave hungry but that wasn't the case.  Very filling food.  Pricing was of that of top quality food and service in downtown Nashville.
