There was a good amount of other customers in the restaurant , so I'm not really sure why there would be old fries unless they cooked huge batches of them in advance (maybe to keep up with their promise of "endless french fried potatoes"?). The sweet potato chips we had as an app were fresh and also a favorite with my family, so I'd suggest getting the chips instead of the fries. 

From the prices on the menu (around $9 for burgers), you'd think that the food would be good or at least a notch higher than "decent". Not so at Cheeseburger in Paradise.

P.S. I had to change a diaper while there and the changing table was inside the handicapped stall. The door on the stall must have been installed improperly because the latch was on the outside of the stall and didn't actually lock. The sink counters were also completely wet. Everything else seemed okay to me.

I really like the design of this place. Very tropical, very beachy which I love. You walk in and painted all over the walls is fish, and birds, and palm trees. Very beachy type drinks and food. Food is excellent I usually get some sort of fish. Very fresh and tasty. The amount of TVs help you keep up with sports if you need to, but if not it's just a nice place to go hang out for a little

I am currently sitting in a booth with a red face , because this place has made me FURIOUS!  From the moment we came in, things have been rotten. We used call-ahead seating and still waited over 20 minutes to get a table. The apps we ordered came out at rapid speed and tasted fine. Then we waited...and waited...and waited. It was another hour and 15 minutes until we saw our burgers.  I wish  the problems ended there. My Mother's "well done" burger came out, still BLEEDING! My turkey burger and my husband's Kobe Beef burger came out ice cold. The bacon on mine was fatty and rubbery and my husband's was missing all together.  We had to send back two out of three, along with my bacon to be re-cooked. This also took forever.  The fries were cold and greasy. When it was all said and done (over an hour and a half after we were seated) we ended up with mediocre burgers. The manager did an underwhelming job when it came to her "appology"... More like excuses! This was our first and will be our last time at this restaurant. In our opinion, it was not another day in "paradise"!

Oh my!  To celebrate her first teenage birthday, my daughter chose Cheeseburger in Paradise...?  Since it was her birthday, we figured, what the heck.  Arrived and were seated immediately.   Took a while for the staff to realize we were there and it appeared they may have forgotten throughout the night too, thus explaining the very slow service.  Considering there were only a few people at tables, that's the only excuse I think might apply.  Had the popcorn shrimp and queso (not necessarily together)  Not bad but basic.  I had the Baja burger supposedly with jack cheese, jalapenos, shredded lettuce and sour cream.  It had cheese and some mixture under the cheese.  The cheese didn't appear melted nor was the burger hot, warm was even a stretch.  Good fries though.  My wife had the fish sandwich.  She was concerned as it was tilapia but still tasted a little "fishy".  For tilapia to be fishy...?  Same experience with my daughters burger.  When she doesn't even eat half of it, goes to say it wasn't very good.

Just not up to even an average rating.  So many options in the area, no need to stop here.  Oh, by the way, apparently Thursday night is Karaoke night so be prepared.

Excellent service.  The drinks were delivered very quickly.  The menu was refreshingly different including conch fritters (decent).

We hit the place about 4:45pm and there were excellent drink specials, honored at the table as well as the bar.

We were with the kids and their meals were served quickly.

When a review is only 1 star, then there really isn't too much to write. The service was inattentive, the cheeseburgers were cooked on the surface of the sun (evidently, based on how charred they were), and there was a large roach that crawled across our table after we were served our food.

A note of warning to waiters: you ARE, in fact, responsible to ensure that the food you serve is a reasonable approximation of how it is ordered, especially if it is visibly cooked less or more than requested of you.

My son had a good three word review for this place, when he misread the name on the menu. 

Cheeseburgers and Parasites 


Actually it wasn't that bad, but it wasn't great either. The problem for me, was that if a particular food item is displayed in your restraunts name, it better be damn good. These burgers weren't paradise, they were simply average. They have some decent burger toppings ( I myself got a bleu cheese and onion straw burger, which was decent but not wow) but I was surprised to see that the CheeseBurger in Paradise burger was simply a cheeseburger...served with a pickle. 
To go along with that, the fries were blah, McDonald's shoestring sized yet not even as crispy, laying somewhat limp on the plate. I prefer steak fries, I like girth ( ...that's what she said!) 

Upon being sat, the song " Cheeseburger in Paradise" by Jimmy Buffett, was playing over their stereo system. I had a brief but rational worry that this song would be played on a loop as I ate. Thankfully, it wasn't nor were we subjected to JBs entire catalog but the CIP song was peppered liberally in the song rotation , so that we heard it at least 3 times while dining. 

The tikibar decor was cool but not terribly impressive. The service was very good, although it was pretty dead even for a Monday night. My son loved the paper umbrella that came with his kids drink and I could tell that his older sister, who proudly orders drinks and entrees off the regular menu, was seething in jealousy yet too proud with her "adult" status to ask for one.. 

I didn't use the facilities but both offspring reported that they were "freaked out" by the peeping fish placed strategically in the bathrooms. We didn't get dessert but their Chocolate Nachos sounded intriguing , until I saw the faces of a couple nearby, who got the dish. It didn't look pretty. 

Overall, it was an average experience. I would not go out of my way to either return to CIP or to avoid it. When there are so many places to choose from, CIP needs to distinguish itself from all the other restraunt chains. My advice would be to "beef" up those titular average burgers and to get those rude fish out of the bathrooms, that like to watch people make toilet.

Great place. Awesome, cannot be beat burgers. Good drinks, good service, good prices, great apps. The fried pickles are fantastic. Great desserts as well. Terrific place, totally worth it. Great for kids too.
Had a business meeting here this afternoon. Had the quesadillas they were amazing. Service was awesome and spot on. Definitely will be back to try more.

A friend just told me the Exton place closed. I'm going to check this.
I drove by, parking lot is empty and one car backed up to the front door taking things out.. It's closed.

#1 draw here is the tropical drink menu; usually $6-$7 per drink, price goes down to $3 per drink during happy hour.  Food is moderately priced; most of the menu items are under $10.  I never can remember what I eat there which speaks to the very average taste provided.  Also, the restaurant only plays three songs which gets old.

I think this might have been one of the WORST dining experiences I have ever had. Nothing about our time at this establishment even resembled passable. Our margaritas were horrible (and came with an awkward robitussen-esque cap full of tequila on the side?!), the burgers were literally inedible-- even the FRIES were bad! How do you mess up fries?! The burgers both came with Kraft singles UNMELTED on top. And the service was incredibly slow. The only and literally only thing this place has going for it, is that the interior decor is cute-ish (including a tiki sports bar with TVs for sports fanatics). I regret not asking to speak to a manager after our experience here.

I've enjoyed this place and have always had good food and service.  The only caveat to this would be the environment which is a very "child friendly" restaurant where families seem to go out with other families while their children run around the restaurant creating chaos and ruiniing the experience for anyone trying to have an adult conversation.  Apparently the restaurant realizes this clientele base thus does nothing to curtail it so if you want some adult time, it might be better to go to another restaurant or go here later in the day.  Anyway, back to the food which in my experience there has always been tasty.  My mother gets a hamburger and fries which she has always liked and I get the fish sandwhich which has always been good.  Service good as well and I'll be back.
I took my daughter & her fiance there for lunch and had a great time. Good food, fair prices and a freindly server.

Having read other reviews on yelp, I didn't have great expectations heading into this place but all in all, it is not that bad.  The burgers will not knock your socks off but they are better than average.  Nice assortment of appetizers- I loved the chicken nachos with banana peppers and asiago cheese.  On a cold gray day, it was a nice place to visit to get my mind on the summertime!

The service was average and the food was horrible. For a resturant with hamburger in its name, one would think that the hamburgers would be good. NOPE! The hamburgers were not even fair. Will never visit again.

Went there for lunch with my husband.  The restaurant was nearly empty yet it took forever for our food, which was only 2 burgers.  We both found the quality of the meat to be poor.  I ordered mine medium rare and it came out completely raw in the center.  They brought me a new burger, but only after my husband finished his entire meal.  Also thought it was strange that you have to pay extra for condiments on a plain burger.  I should have known to leave when the waitress tried to push fruity alcoholic drinks at noon on a Wednesday.

Everything was good. How about we start there.

Beer: 22oz of Yuengling. Check!
Appetizer: Fried pickles and Queso. Double check!
Entree: Four mini cheeseburgers with onion and pickle. A very delicious check! And fries? Check that off too!
The birthday celebration song and dessert: Check!

There was a very VERY pregnant waitress on the table next to us, which was somewhat off-putting, but I think my entire group got over that pretty quickly as the drinks and the food hit our table. The fried pickles and queso were out super fast. The beer lagged behind but you know the bar gets busy at a place like this. We had enough time to do some damage on the appetizers before the entrees hit the table. 

The theme of the restaurant is fun. The food is good. I like this place.
